Sexuelle IntimitÃ¤t ist etwas, in dem du immer besser werden wirst. Es braucht Kommunikation, Ãœbung und Zeit.

Im "geben" liegt eine unfassbare SchÃ¶nheit und viele Geheimnisse. Sei groÃŸzÃ¼gig.

FÃ¼r dich ist Sex kÃ¶rperliche Anziehung und es ist sehr visuell und augenblicklich.

Vielleicht ist es besser, wenn du dich jetzt erst mal setzt: Frauen empfinden Sex als Teil einer Beziehung, als Sicherheit und als Anzeichen, wie sehr sie geliebt und verlangt werden.

FÃ¼r sie ist Sex wie ein Schmorbraten, der viel Zeit braucht, um zu kÃ¶cheln.

Momentan legst du wahnsinnig viel Wert auf Sex. Lass uns ehrlich sein: Du denkst stÃ¤ndig daran.

Du sollst wissen, sexuelle IntimitÃ¤t ist fantastisch und sehr befriedigend und unglaublich auf die schÃ¶nsten Art und Weisen - aber es darf kein GÃ¶tzenbild sein. Es ist ein Geschenk, das man in der Ehe genieÃŸen sollte.

7. Sex kann SpaÃŸ machen, lustig und verspielt sein

Es gibt so viele Blickwinkel, was sexuelle IntimitÃ¤t betrifft und die meisten davon sind dir jetzt noch nicht bewusst. Du denkst zu eindimensional Ã¼ber Sex.

Sexuelle IntimitÃ¤t ist auch Verletzlichkeit und AuthentizitÃ¤t und wenn du jemanden wirklich liebst, hast du nichts zu verstecken - und ich meine wirklich nichts.

Du kannst dein ehrlichstes Ich sein.

8. Sie zu verfÃ¼hren ist wie eine legale Sexdroge fÃ¼r ihre Seele

Ich habe es vorhin schon angedeutet, aber das ist wahrscheinlich das beste Geheimnis, dass ich dir mit auf den Weg geben kann: VerfÃ¼hre sie.

â¨ Mehr zum Thema: Diese Paare haben mit dem Sex bis zur Hochzeit gewartet - jetzt verraten sie, ob es sich gelohnt hat

Zeig ihr, dass du sie nicht nur kÃ¶rperlich willst. VerfÃ¼hre ihren Geist. VerfÃ¼hre ihr Herz. VerfÃ¼hre sie auf jede mÃ¶gliche Weise.

Denk daran, sie denkt nicht so an Sex, wie du es tust - du bist Haut und Haar und sie ist Herz und Seele.

9. Es ist geheimnisvoller als du denkst

Und noch mal: Gerade sind deine Ansichten Ã¼ber Sex ziemlich simpel.

Es ist schwer zu erklÃ¤ren und ich verstehe es auch heute noch nicht so ganz, aber es passiert etwas Magisches, wenn zwei Menschen Sex haben. Es ist etwas fast Kosmisches, das zwei Seelen aneinander bindet,

10. Sex in der Ehe ist eine Art der Verehrung

Wenn ich sage Sex ist Verehrung, denkst du wahrscheinlich, ich bin verrÃ¼ckt. Aber es ist wahr.

Der Akt ist eine Art der Verehrung, schlicht und einfach. Es ist wie alte Lieder singen, nur mit KÃ¶rpern. Okay, das hat sich jetzt unheimlich angehÃ¶rt. Lass es uns einfach Verehrung nennen.

Ich hoffe wirklich, dass du dir diese Gedanken zu Herzen nimmst. Denn letzten Endes ist Sex in der Ehe noch viel schÃ¶ner, als du es dir vorstellen kannst.

Dieser Artikel erschien ursprÃ¼nglich in der HuffPost US und wurde von Martina Zink aus dem Englischen Ã¼bersetzt und bearbeitet.

ADVERTISEMENTThe Collins Dictionary has said the "word of the year" is "fake news" though of course that's two words.
While Trump may have helped Fake News win the word-of-the-year mantle, India has been quite a fake news factory.
BJP leader Priti Gandhi posted Julian Assange's fake endorsement of Narendra Modi for Prime Minister which Wikileaks had to deny.
"Now they want us to bleed more by telling the state government to stop state advertisements as well," he said.
The government's idea to crack down on fake news sounds like good news.
TEXT:
ADVERTISEMENT

The Collins Dictionary has said the "word of the year" is "fake news" though of course that's two words. It had seen an unprecedented usage increase of 365% since 2016. "Fake news today is legitimate news," it said.

Helen Newstead, the head of language content, said, "Fake news, either as a statement of fact or as an accusation, has been inescapable, contributing to the undermining of society's trust in news reporting."

While Trump may have helped Fake News win the word-of-the-year mantle, India has been quite a fake news factory.

Now, according to Asian Age, the government is contemplating cracking down on fake news.

And about time. Fake news in India is like air pollution in Delhi â€“ toxic, stubborn and growing stronger.

The government has said official advertisements should be denied to outlets that indulge in "unethical reporting", news published out of "bad intent" and "fake news".

The Directorate of Advertising & Visual Publicity will stop release of advertisements to such publications. Until now the print media policy already stated a newspaper could be suspended from empanelment if it was found to have deliberately submitted false information regarding circulation.

This is not symbolic. Government ads are a major source of revenue for media.

The devil, as always, lies in the details. What is fake news? And who defines it? Who defines bad intent? Clearly one person's fake news is another person's truth or at least their agenda.

Fake news in India is like air pollution in Delhi â€“ toxic, stubborn and growing stronger.

Take a few recent examples:

During the riots in Basirhat, an image of a burning vehicle was sent out as part of a call to #SaveBengal. It was shared by Nupur Sharma, BJP spokesperson from Delhi and used on a flyer for protests. The image, it turned out, was from the 2002 Gujarat riots under Narendra Modi's watch.

BJP IT cell head Amit Malviya has been caught more than once peddling fake news, tweets he has refused to take down even after they have been proved to be false. Once he circulated a mischievously edited video clip of NDTV anchor Ravish Kumar. Another time during the Ram Rahim trial he posted a picture of Rahul Gandhi meeting Sant Niranjan Dass of Dera Sach Khand Ballan but captioned it as "Rahul Gandhi visited Dera Sach Sauda as recently as Jan 2017 to seek support."

BJP leader Priti Gandhi posted Julian Assange's fake endorsement of Narendra Modi for Prime Minister which Wikileaks had to deny.

These could be honest mistakes. Who among us has not fallen for fake news, especially when it fits our ideological bias? But sometimes it's far more deliberate and it comes from within the government itself, not some mischief monger on social media.

The state-run Press Information Bureau infamously photoshopped a picture of Narendra Modi looking at flood-ravaged Chennai with divyadrishti clarity through his chopper window. And of course, that iconic "rare" picture of Modi sweeping the floor at a 1988 RSS rally turned out to be a well-morphed fake photo.

So when it comes to curing the epidemic of fake news, physician heal thyself.

Does this mean the BJP is the sole offender? Of course, not. But as Rohan Venkataramakrishnan points out in Scroll, the BJP was an "early pioneer when it came to using the internet for organizing and building political awareness" and it also "has been at the forefront of the fake news phenomenon, with top party leaders and ministers occasionally revealing the kinds of dishonest messages that are much more rampant among the base."

Even more worryingly, in a country where the phrase "anti-national"can be used casually as a bludgeon to silence any dissent that is too bothersome, these new DAVP guidelines could just be another weapon to bring media to heel. The Centre has already told the Jammu and Kashmir government to stop advertising in local newspapers that allegedly publish "anti-national"articles "glamorizing terrorists and anti-national elements". Shujaat Bukhari, editor of Rising Kashmir told HT that three major newspapers there, including his own, are banned from getting central government ads for eight years because they cover "anti-national" issues, for example, the funerals of militants. "Now they want us to bleed more by telling the state government to stop state advertisements as well," he said.

So when it comes to curing the epidemic of fake news, physician heal thyself.

Government ads have long been part of a strategy to make sure that media does not get too uppity. As other ad revenues shrink government ads gain even more clout.

In 2012, Dhirendra K. Jha dubbed Nitish Kumar Bihar's editor-in-chief because he used the government's ad budget to control and bend the media to his will. The editor of Bihartimes.com said though it has been "No. 1" since inception in 1999, its application for empanelment with the Public Relations Department was kept pending without any "concrete reason" while a site based in Bhopal with tenuous connections to Bihar got government ads. He said he believes it's because his site carries reports related to corruption in the state. An Urdu paper Pindar ran afoul of the government because of a piece by its chief editor that apparently upset the government. The editor, Raihan Ghani, said he was demoted to managing editor and eventually resigned. Curiously the year after Ghani was gagged, the paper's government ad revenues ballooned from 1 lakh to 24 and the year after to 40 lakh.

When the ABP group in Bengal was perceived at loggerheads with the Trinamool government, Mamata Banerjee had banned their newspapers from state libraries. Global campaign group Avaaz said that five West Bengal outdoor advertising agencies and one newspaper group refused to run ads urging Mamata Banerjee to "stop attacking protesters and start attacking the problem" after the gangrape of a young woman in Kamduni. Jayalalithaa's Tamil Nadu was boomtown for lawsuits against media perceived as being overly critical of the government. In five years it filed 213 defamation cases against political opponents, 55 of them against media houses for "derogatory " statements whether it was reporting on the CM's vacations or water scarcity in Tamil Nadu. Its predecessor DMK was a poor second with 40 cases between 2006 and 2011.

The government's idea to crack down on fake news sounds like good news. Who could argue with punishing the purveyors of fake news? But the fear is it will have little to do with promoting free and fair journalism and far more to do with the carrot-and-stick policy that makes media toe the line.

Also On HuffPost:
TITLE: Is The Government's Crackdown On Fake News Another Way Of Controlling The Media?

Das Interview lest ihr hier:

Am Ende ist fÃ¼r uns klar: Wir werden uns nicht selbst verleugnen. Wenn wir die Wahl haben zwischen GlaubwÃ¼rdigkeitsverlust oder Neuwahlen, entscheiden wir uns fÃ¼r Neuwahlen. Aber das ist nicht unser Ziel.

Ich neige nicht zu Komplexen, egal, mit welchem Namen Sie das verbinden. Ich neige dazu, feste Prinzipien zu haben. Am Ende muss unsere liberale Handschrift klar erkennbar sein. Wir stehen nicht als StÃ¼tzrad fÃ¼r eine Schwarz-Rote Politik, wie sie die vergangenen vier Jahre gemacht wurde.

Wenn ich mir den ein oder anderen GesprÃ¤chsverlauf anschaue. Aber ich mÃ¶chte nicht zu viele Internas aus den SondierungsgesprÃ¤chen verraten. Generell ist uns natÃ¼rlich klar, dass wir nicht alle unsere Forderung durchsetzen kÃ¶nnen. Doch unsere liberale Handschrift muss erkennbar sein.

Wir sind uns mit den GrÃ¼nen vÃ¶llig einig, dass wir die Klimaschutzziele 2050 erreichen mÃ¼ssen. Allerdings mÃ¼ssen wir das physikalisch hinbekommen.



GrÃ¼nen-Politiker Robert Habeck sagte, alle Parteien mÃ¼ssen sich â€œam Riemen reiÃŸenâ€. Das klingt nicht so, als wÃ¤re man sich vÃ¶llig einig.



Wir sind uns bei den Zielen einig. Beim Weg dorthin hingegen bisher nicht. Wir mÃ¼ssen uns eingestehen, dass unsere jetzige Klimaschutzpolitik nicht funktioniert hat. Wir kÃ¶nnen unsere ehrgeizigen Ziele nur mit Technologien erreichen, die sich noch nicht durchgesetzt haben. Das mÃ¼ssen wir in unserer Klimapolitik dringend miteinbeziehen.



Geben Sie uns ein Beispiel.

Beobachter sehen die Jamaika-Verhandlungen durch die Personaldiskussion in der CSU grundsÃ¤tzlich in Gefahr. Teilen Sie diese Sorge?



Unsere Verhandlungen kÃ¶nnten schneller voranschreiten, wenn die CSU so geschlossen wÃ¤re wie die FDP. Aber Streit gibt es auch bei den GrÃ¼nen, die sich untereinander nicht immer einig sind.

Depuis Bruxelles, le prÃ©sident catalan en appelle Ã  l'Europe. Il est temps de rÃ©pondre. Vous l'avez fait, cher prÃ©sident Macron, mais vous l'avez fait en partie.

SUMMARY:
The most infuriating thing is when your boyfriend refuses to tell you what he wants for Christmas.
After all, you and him both know that he's getting a present whether he likes it or not!
While some men will eventually cave and tell you, there are still those stubborn few who will leave you clueless.
But before you start stressing out about what you're going to get your man, take a deep breath and have a look at our fun Christmas gift ideas for your boyfriend.
Whether your guy is a sophisticated businessman or a casual, cool geek, we have stylish finds for all that they'll actually like.
TEXT:
The most infuriating thing is when your boyfriend refuses to tell you what he wants for Christmas. After all, you and him both know that he's getting a present whether he likes it or not!

While some men will eventually cave and tell you, there are still those stubborn few who will leave you clueless. But before you start stressing out about what you're going to get your man, take a deep breath and have a look at our fun Christmas gift ideas for your boyfriend. Whether your guy is a sophisticated businessman or a casual, cool geek, we have stylish finds for all that they'll actually like.

SUMMARY:
The youths escaped, leaving the injured girl in the bushes near the railway track, close to Railway Protection Force (RPF) police station.
SP Anita Malviya told media persons that the young woman was gang-raped by four youths â€“ Golu Chadhar, Amar, Rajesh and Ramesh.
Times of India reported that the man identified as Golu â€” Golu Bihari Chadhar â€” is out on bail after being charged with murder of his infant daughter.
The alleged rapists took gutkha, cigarette and tea breaks between the horrific assault, the TOI report said.
The incident had occurred on late Tuesday night, and throughout Wednesday, the traumatized family had tried to get an FIR registered, until railway police took action.
TEXT:
ADVERTISEMENT

BHOPAL â€“ A 19-year-old college student was on the way back from her coaching class when she was kidnapped by four youths, dragged to a desolate spot near a railway track close to Habibganj station, and raped for hours.

The woman is pursuing her graduation and preparing for the civil services exam.

The youths escaped, leaving the injured girl in the bushes near the railway track, close to Railway Protection Force (RPF) police station. The survivor somehow managed to drag herself to the police station and informed her parents, both of whom are police personnel.

Still, none of the two police stations â€” MP Nagar and Habibganj â€” both in the heart of New Bhopal, registered an FIR, passing the buck, saying that the area of the crime did not fall under their jurisdiction.

Finally, the railway police registered a case. SP Anita Malviya told media persons that the young woman was gang-raped by four youths â€“ Golu Chadhar, Amar, Rajesh and Ramesh. She said that the accused have been arrested. Times of India reported that the man identified as Golu â€” Golu Bihari Chadhar â€” is out on bail after being charged with murder of his infant daughter.

The alleged rapists took gutkha, cigarette and tea breaks between the horrific assault, the TOI report said.

The ordeal didn't end even after her ordeal. According to reports, at the Habibganj GRP, an officer allegedly accused the victim of "making up a filmy story".

The incident had occurred on late Tuesday night, and throughout Wednesday, the traumatized family had tried to get an FIR registered, until railway police took action.

The Deputy Inspector General of Police (DIG) of Bhopal has ordered a probe into the incident of negligence in conducting their civic duty and SI RN Tekam of MP Nagar police station has been suspended.

The incident has led to shock in the state capital. The MP Human Rights Commission has sought a report from Bhopal police. The Opposition has targeted the state government for poor law-and-order. Minister for Women and Child Development, Archana Chitnis, has said that it was shameful and for such horrific cases the culprits need to be given death penalty.

In 2015, a woman was raped on a moving bus in Bhopal by a man assisted by two associates, one of whom was the driver, triggering painful memories in the city of the Delhi gangrape of a young physiotherapy student.
TITLE: Rapists Of 19-Year-Old Woman Took Tea Breaks Between Assaulting Her For Hours: Report

SUMMARY:
We've all gotten used to Sia Furler hiding her face during performances and appearances, but now the 'This Is Acting' singer has acted boldly after someone tried to exploit her.
"Someone is apparently trying to sell naked photos of me to my fans," Furler tweeted on Tuesday afternoon, "Save your money, here it is for free".
Someone is apparently trying to sell naked photos of me to my fans.
pic.twitter.com/aeQlnTwLuy â€” sia (@Sia) November 7, 2017Furler's screenshot of the cheeky image also included a message from the seller attempting to exploit her for their financial gain.
After Furler posted the image her fans were quick to embrace the move of undercutting the gross invasion of her privacy.
TEXT:
We've all gotten used to Sia Furler hiding her face during performances and appearances, but now the 'This Is Acting' singer has acted boldly after someone tried to exploit her.

"Someone is apparently trying to sell naked photos of me to my fans," Furler tweeted on Tuesday afternoon, "Save your money, here it is for free".

Someone is apparently trying to sell naked photos of me to my fans. Save your money, here it is for free. Everyday is Christmas! pic.twitter.com/aeQlnTwLuy â€” sia (@Sia) November 7, 2017

Furler's screenshot of the cheeky image also included a message from the seller attempting to exploit her for their financial gain. "If you make the purchase," the message reads, "it will be unblurred and you will receive and [sic] additional 14 images".

After Furler posted the image her fans were quick to embrace the move of undercutting the gross invasion of her privacy.

Iï¸ thought Iï¸ couldn't love you any more than when Iï¸ saw you singing to a baby at a coffee shop in Echo Park but here we are November 7, 2017

Furler is currently working on a festive album 'Everyday Is Christmas' which is set to release on November 17.
TITLE: Someone Was Trying To Sell Nude Photos Of Sia So She Tweeted One Herself

While Craig has now spoken out, it was Head Judge Shirley Ballas who took most of the heat from â€˜Strictlyâ€™ viewers, as it was her final decision that saw Aston given his marching orders.

US-PrÃ¤sident Trump hat laut einem japanischen Medienbericht sein UnverstÃ¤ndnis darÃ¼ber geÃ¤uÃŸert, dass Japan nordkoreanische Raketen nicht abgefangen hat

Dabei ist ein Abfangversuch Ã¤uÃŸerst riskant

Trump will sich bei seiner Asienreise auÃŸerdem mit dem russischen PrÃ¤sidenten Putin treffen

US-PrÃ¤sident Donald Trump ist zu Beginn seiner fast zweiwÃ¶chigen Asienreise in Japan eingetroffen. Einige hundert amerikanische und japanische Soldaten bereiteten ihm am Sonntagvormittag (Ortszeit) auf dem US-MilitÃ¤rstÃ¼tzpunkt Yokota einen begeisterten Empfang.

"Japan ist ein geschÃ¤tzter Partner und wichtiger Alliierter, und wir danken ihnen fÃ¼r ihre Freundschaft", sagte Trump.

Nach Informationen der Nachrichtenagentur Kyodo soll er jedoch im Vorfeld UnverstÃ¤ndnis fÃ¼r Tokios Reaktion auf zwei kÃ¼rzliche Raketentests durch Nordkorea geÃ¤uÃŸert haben. Er kÃ¶nne nicht verstehen, warum ein Land von Samurai-Kriegern die Raketen nicht abschoss, soll Trump gesagt haben.

Dabei wÃ¤re sowohl ein erfolgreicher als auch ein gescheiterter Abschuss Ã¤uÃŸerst gefÃ¤hrlich.

"Japan will der Eskalation wohl aus dem Weg gehen"

Der Abfang einer Rakete - gerade einer Interkontinentalrakete - gilt als groÃŸe Herausforderung. Die USA testeten im Mai 2017 ihr Raketenabwehrsystem "Ground-based Midcourse Defense" (GMD) - mit einer Erfolgsquote von 53 Prozent, wie das Pentagon mitteilte.

Das japanische Verteidigungsministerium habe sich nach der Berechnung der Flugroute der nordkoreanischen Raketen dazu entschlossen, keinen Abgangversuch zu starten, berichtet die japanische Tageszeitung "Japan Times". Ein Fehlversuch wÃ¼rde Japan blamieren und Nordkorea womÃ¶glich zu weiteren Test ermuntern, so die Ãœberlegung.

Ein erfolgreicher Abschuss kÃ¶nnte auÃŸerdem die Situation eskalieren lassen. "Einen Abschuss hÃ¤tte Nordkorea umgehend als Provokation und Anlass fÃ¼r zeitnahe weitere Raketentests gesehen, dieser Eskalation wollte Japan wohl aus dem Weg gehen", zitierte der "Spiegel" einen ranghohen Bundeswehroffizier nach einem kÃ¼rzlichen Raketentest der Nordkoreaner.

Trump will sich mit Putin treffen

Der gefÃ¤hrliche Konflikt um das Atomwaffenprogramm in Nordkorea wird eines der zentralen Themen der zweiwÃ¶chigen Asien-Reise von Trump sein. DarÃ¼ber wird er am Montag auch mit dem japanischen MinisterprÃ¤sidenten Shinzo Abe in Tokio sprechen.

Seine erste Asienreise wird Trump von Japan aus weiter nach Seoul fÃ¼hren, nach China, Vietnam und auf die Philippinen. Trump erwartet wÃ¤hrend seiner Reise auch ein Treffen mit seinem russischen Kollegen Wladimir Putin.

"Ich denke, es wird erwartet, dass wir uns mit Putin treffen", sagte Trump am Sonntag auf der Reise nach Tokio an Bord der Air Force One mitreisenden Reportern. "Wir wollen, dass Putin mit Nordkorea hilft, und wir werden eine Reihe verschiedener AnfÃ¼hrer treffen", sagte Trump. Die beiden PrÃ¤sidenten haben sich zuletzt am Rande des G20-Gipfels in Hamburg getroffen.

Ein Treffen Trumps mit Putin am Rande eines Gipfels der Asiatisch-Pazifischen Wirtschaftsgemeinschaft (Apec) in Da Nang in Vietnam war von russischer Seite bereits ins Spiel gebracht, vom WeiÃŸen Haus aber bislang nicht bestÃ¤tigt worden.

Trump selbst hatte vor der Reise dem Sender Fox News gesagt: "Das ist eine sehr wichtige Reise. Wir kÃ¶nnen uns mit Putin treffen." Eine endgÃ¼ltige BestÃ¤tigung eines Treffens steht gleichwohl noch aus.

La tribune publiÃ©e par Nicolas Bedos dans Le HuffPost, sur la libÃ©ration de la parole qui vire, selon lui, Ã  la guerre des sexes, m'a passablement Ã©nervÃ©e. Cher Nicolas Bedos,

Pour tous les cas que je viens de citer, des gouttes d'eau dans un ocÃ©an de plaintes Ã©touffÃ©es, "un seul nom suffisait". Ce nom que l'on vous demande de balancer aujourd'hui, certes bÃªtement, est celui que l'on s'Ã©change sous le manteau depuis des annÃ©es. Celui qui a pu faire rire sous cape. Celui qui a pu devenir un mythe ("Je vais te faire une Baupin", "Je suis le DSK de France 2"). Et pourquoi on vous le demande Nicolas? Je pense d'ailleurs que tout cela vous le savez pertinemment, comme la diffÃ©rence entre la drague lourde et le harcÃ¨lement, je ne vais pas vous faire l'affront de vous donner un cours sur la notion de consentement. D'ailleurs, je prendrai comme un jeu rhÃ©torique de votre part le fait que vous compariez un violeur Ã  un homme infidÃ¨le ou Ã  un radin. Vous-mÃªme, je pense, vous choisiriez sans hÃ©siter l'option "mon radin de patron a refusÃ© de m'augmenter" plutÃ´t que "mon violeur de patron m'a sodomisÃ© de force".

Par contre ne me demandez pas de "comprendre votre colÃ¨re". Je la trouve dÃ©placÃ©e. Vous avez l'impression, en tant qu'homme, d'Ãªtre devenu un gibier? Mais n'est-ce pas cela, entre autres, qui rÃ©volte les femmes? D'avoir le sentiment d'Ãªtre traquÃ©e en permanence?

Et que cela soit clair, je n'ai pas choisi les exemples ci-dessus pour remettre en cause le fait que DSK soit un Ã©conomiste brillant, que j'ai de bons souvenirs d'enfance avec mon cousin, ou que le serveur qui m'a agressÃ©e soit le roi des Frozen Margaritas. Comme je ne remets pas en cause le fait que les films de Woody Allen, Roman Polanski, Kevin Spacey ou produits par Harvey Weinstein puissent Ãªtre remarquables. D'ailleurs, Emile Louis Ã©tait sÃ»rement un formidable chauffeur de bus et peut-Ãªtre dans un autre contexte, j'aurais pu prendre un cafÃ© avec Guy Georges et trouver le mec super sympa.

La question de sÃ©parer l'homme de l'Å“uvre ou mÃªme "la bÃªte", "le porc", puisqu'on l'a nommÃ© ainsi, de l'Ãªtre humain (du voisin, du copain, du pÃ¨re, du fils, du cousin), pose question et cela personne ne peut le nier. C'est philosophiquement et humainement un dÃ©bat Ã  avoir. Mais a-t-on pour autant besoin de le porter aux nues? Qu'un homme qui a tuÃ© sa femme Ã  coups de poing fasse la une des magazines? Qu'un organisme public rende hommage Ã  un homme accusÃ© de plusieurs viols et qui fuit la justice depuis des annÃ©es? Est-ce cela pour vous un monde libre? Mais surtout, est-ce vraiment cela sur quoi porte le dÃ©bat aujourd'hui?

Et si vous (re)lisiez King Kong thÃ©orie de Virginie Despentes? Ou Le deuxiÃ¨me sexe de Simone de Beauvoir? Et si vous creusiez un peu plus les pensÃ©es de FranÃ§oise HÃ©ritier, Marguerite Duras ou GeneviÃ¨ve Fraisse? (pardon, vous n'avez citÃ© QUE des hommes, je me permets de ne citer QUE des femmes). Et que derriÃ¨re ce #, ce n'est pas seulement un ras-le-bol qui s'exprime, mais la remise en cause d'un systÃ¨me oÃ¹ se construisent et se perpÃ©tuent inÃ©galitÃ©s et stÃ©rÃ©otypes. Un systÃ¨me tellement ancrÃ© en nous, hommes comme femmes, qu'il nous a amenÃ© Ã  considÃ©rer que la violence envers la moitiÃ© de l'humanitÃ© Ã©tait naturelle, puisque jusqu'ici personne n'a rien fait.

Et lorsque l'on vous demande si vous connaissez des gens autour de vous qui auraient pu avoir ce genre de comportement, n'est-ce pas beaucoup plus facile de prendre la plume pour dÃ©noncer les dÃ©rives totalitaires d'une "dÃ©nonciation arbitraire", que de se poser les vraies questions: "Ai-je moi aussi un jour Ã©tÃ© un "porc"? "Ai-je, mÃªme sans m'en apercevoir, dÃ©passÃ© la limite? Ai-je laissÃ© passer des comportements inacceptables qui se sont dÃ©roulÃ©s sous mes yeux, par peur, lÃ¢chetÃ©, ignorance? Et la rÃ©ponse est oui, Nicolas, vous l'avez fait. Je l'ai fait aussi. Nous l'avons tous fait. Cette dÃ©ferlante vous gÃªne et tant mieux, car elle vous remet et nous remet tous en question.

Et puis, n'avez-vous pas un peu l'impression que sous couvert de fustiger la pensÃ©e unique, vous en Ãªtes en fait le parfait reprÃ©sentant: le mÃ¢le alpha blanc. Celui qui occupe la place dans les mÃ©dias, Ã  l'assemblÃ©e, dans les postes Ã  responsabilitÃ© et les conseils d'administration, celui qui a, par dÃ©finition, le pouvoir et la parole. Celui qui n'a pas besoin de quota, de manifs ou de # pendÃ©mique pour Ãªtre Ã©coutÃ©. Parce que, si vous approuvez le fait qu'enfin les voix des femmes s'Ã©lÃ¨vent, pourquoi mettre un bÃ©mol en parlant au-dessus d'elles? Si vous souhaitez rÃ©ellement que les femmes de votre entourage n'aient plus Ã  subir et que cette parole libÃ©rÃ©e permette enfin de changer les choses, pourquoi dÃ©placer (et accaparer) le dÃ©bat?

Et mÃªme si je suivais votre raisonnement jusqu'au bout, si votre femme vous apprend qu'elle a Ã©tÃ© agressÃ©e par le facteur, allez-vous lui couper la parole pour lui rÃ©torquer: "je comprends chÃ©rie, mais il va d'abord falloir laisser faire la justice avant de prÃ©venir les voisins et qu'il arrÃªte de venir livrer le courrier chez nous... et puis on ne peut pas lui retirer que c'est un bon facteur, il monte les Chronoposts jusqu'au 6Ã¨me...Â».

Pensez-vous, Nicolas, qu'il serait possible qu'un homme, juste pendant un moment, n'ait rien Ã  dire, juste Ã  Ã©couter? Rien Ã  ajouter si ce n'est tenter de comprendre quelque chose qui le dÃ©passe? Rien Ã  faire, si ce n'est son examen de conscience?

Mais oui, il y a bien une rÃ©volte et comme dans toute rÃ©volte qui se respecte, il y a ceux, dont vous faites partie, ainsi que "vos amis avec qui vous discutez en privÃ©", bien accrochÃ©s Ã  leurs acquis qui ne veulent pas voir les choses bouger. Ceux qui sous couvert de s'interroger, sont juste terrifiÃ©s Ã  l'idÃ©e que le monde qui arrive "soit moins profitable". Moins profitable Ã  qui? Ã€ eux... et Ã  eux seulement.

Lo fa sull'homepage del suo sito internet, in un articolo che commenta i nuovi equilibri politici restituiti dalla consultazione insulare e in cui definisce "una disastrosa performance" quella a cui il Partito Democratico Ã¨ andato incontro domenica.

Nello stesso articolo il settimanale inglese parla della rinascita del centro-destra, sottolineando come Silvio Berlusconi abbia "iniziato ad assumere l'aura di un vecchio statista, nonostante la condanna per evasione fiscale e una serie di scandali a sfondo sessuale" e conclude il pezzo annunciando che "Mr Berlusconi Ã¨ tornato e si vendicherÃ ".

L'Economist non Ã¨ l'unico organo d'informazione straniero ad interessarsi delle elezioni siciliane. La Sueddeutsche Zeitung definisce la vittoria del centro-destra "un eccentrico scherzo della storia", mentre per Le Monde "dopo la Sicilia la destra vuole conquistare l'Italia".

Secondo il Financial Times il centrodestra guidato da Silvio Berlusconi "ha respinto una forte sfida dal movimento populista dei 5 Stelle" e ora "mette pressione" su Matteo Renzi. Per il quotidiano finanziario, i risultati delle urne, viste come "il test finale prima delle prossime elezioni parlamentari" mostrano che "l'umore politico dell'Italia si sta spostando verso la destra euroscettica" e "suggeriscono anche che i 5 Stelle restano una forza potente ma non piÃ¹ in ascesa e che Renzi e il Pd potrebbero essere nei guai". Quanto al Pd il Financial Times sottolinea "la difficoltÃ  a connettersi con gli elettori" e come ora Renzi debba affrontare gli scettici all'interno del suo partito, i quali "credono sia diventato troppo divisivo e che le sue politiche siano troppo centriste per vincere le prossime elezioni". "Il problema piÃ¹ grosso per Renzi - argomenta l'articolo - potrebbe essere che il ritorno di Berlusconi renderÃ  piÃ¹ difficile trovare voti tra i centristi italiani mentre la sinistra non trova ancora un accordo di coalizione che la metterebbe in una posizione piÃ¹ forte nelle elezioni del 2018".
TITLE: The Economist dopo il voto in Sicilia: "Mr. Renzi ha rottamato il Pd. E torna Berlusconi"

Come raccontava all'epoca l'interprete di Mamma mia!, infatti, anni prima si era recata a un'audizione per un film diretto proprio dal collega, incontrandolo per la prima volta: "Si Ã¨ presentato dicendomi: 'Sono Dustin - rutto - Hoffman', e ha messo la sua mano sul mio seno.
Proprio nel 1979, del resto, i due si ritrovarono sul set di Kramer contro Kramer, costruendo un rapporto fatto di continui scontri.

TEXT:
Ãˆ stato prima accusato di molestie dalla scrittrice Graham Hunter, poi di avances insistenti dalla commediografa Wendy Riss Gatsiounis e a una settimana dallo scandalo sessuale che ha colpito Dustin Hoffman il sito di informazione Slate rende pubblico un terzo atto di molestie da parte dell'attore. Stavolta, perÃ², il nome della vittima ha un peso enorme nel mondo del cinema ed Ã¨ quello della tre volte premio Oscar Meryl Streep, che in un'intervista rilasciata nel 1979 al Times aveva ricordato del primo, esplicito incontro tra i due.

Come raccontava all'epoca l'interprete di Mamma mia!, infatti, anni prima si era recata a un'audizione per un film diretto proprio dal collega, incontrandolo per la prima volta: "Si Ã¨ presentato dicendomi: 'Sono Dustin - rutto - Hoffman', e ha messo la sua mano sul mio seno. Ho pensato: 'Che odioso maiale!'" si legge nell'articolo di quasi 40 anni fa.

Proprio nel 1979, del resto, i due si ritrovarono sul set di Kramer contro Kramer, costruendo un rapporto fatto di continui scontri. In un'occasione, ad esempio, la Streep chiese di modificare una scena per puntare i riflettori sulle motivazioni interne del comportamento del suo personaggio e a quel punto Dustin protestÃ²: "PerchÃ© non ammaini la tua bandiera femminista e giri semplicemente la scena?" L'episodio viene narrato nella biografia Her Again: Becoming Meryl Streep. Durante le riprese del medesimo film, poi, l'attore di Los Angeles gettÃ² contro un muro un bicchiere di vino, benchÃ© il gesto non fosse scritto nel copione, e la sua collega se ne lamentÃ² molto.

Tra i due premi Oscar, insomma, non Ã¨ mai corso buon sangue, tanto che durante il programma tv Watch What Happens Live la Streep indicÃ² proprio nell'interprete di Hook il collega che avrebbe potuto uccidere se necessario. L'attrice, a ogni modo, nelle ultime ore ci ha tenuto a precisare a E! News che l'articolo del 1979 non riporta in maniera accurata i dettagli del primo incontro col collega: "Dustin si Ã¨ scusato con Meryl per l'accaduto e lei ha accettato le sue scuse" si precisa infatti nell'articolo.

Le storie sulle presunte e continue avances dell'interprete de Il laureto sono circolate per anni a Hollywood e lo stesso Hoffman, nel 1983, disse a People di essere un "donnaiolo. Sono anche un maschilista, nel mio passato sono corso dietro a tante gonne. Ãˆ difficile per me trovare una donna che non mi attragga".

Prima che Hollywood venisse travolta dal caso Weinstein, in pochi avevano prestato attenzione alle parole di Meryl Streep al Times, ma in un periodo in cui le accuse di abusi sessuali nell'impero del cinema sono all'ordine del giorno, esse assumono tutto un altro peso.
TITLE: "Si Ã¨ presentato e ha messo la sua mano sul mio seno, che odioso maiale!". Nel 1979 Meryl Streep accusÃ² Dustin Hoffman

SUMMARY:
Iâ€™ve come back to my hometown to be able to add to the conversation and share what wealth of knowledge Iâ€™ve received living in other cities.â€â€• Jaque Fragua, 31, artistâ€œI live here in Albuquerque by choice.
Iâ€™m too afraid to leave Albuquerque.â€â€• Rose Jojole, 47, stay-at-home momâ€œI was supposed to move to California, but I changed my mind.
I love Albuquerque.
Itâ€™s very peaceful and beautiful.â€â€• Stephanie Rodgriguez (translated by Lin Marksbury), 28, educational assistantâ€œI moved to Albuquerque because of sign language.
... Warts and all, we love our city and our friends.â€â€• Evelyn Dow, 56, managementâ€œIt just seems like Albuquerque is a good city.â€
TEXT:
Albuquerque was the 22nd stop on HuffPostâ€™s Listen to America road trip. We spoke to locals about why this New Mexico city is home. Hereâ€™s what they had to say:

â€œIâ€™m returning from a stint in LA, New York, around the country really. Iâ€™ve come back to my hometown to be able to add to the conversation and share what wealth of knowledge Iâ€™ve received living in other cities.â€

â€• Jaque Fragua, 31, artist

â€œI live here in Albuquerque by choice. Just closer to my home, Iâ€™m originally from here in the Southwest.â€

â€• Ty Harris, 23, artist

â€œThis is where my people come from, here and in Mexico. ... I came here to be closer to my people, my roots.â€

â€• Lisa Lucero, 53, drummer and union carpenter

â€œI fell in love and I never left. Itâ€™s either love it or hate it. If youâ€™ve never been here at all, the scenery is so breathtakingly different. ... Why would you want to be anywhere else?â€

â€• Paul Mansfield, 69, retired

â€œI love New Mexico. ... When I come back to New Mexico, I literally have joy in my heart.â€

â€• Michael Padilla, 45, business owner

â€œI love it here. Iâ€™m too afraid to leave Albuquerque.â€

â€• Rose Jojole, 47, stay-at-home mom

â€œI was supposed to move to California, but I changed my mind. I wanted to stay close to my family. Iâ€™m very close to my family. ... I love Albuquerque. Itâ€™s very peaceful and beautiful.â€

â€• Stephanie Rodgriguez (translated by Lin Marksbury), 28, educational assistant

â€œI moved to Albuquerque because of sign language. ... I work here in the community now. I love it here.â€

â€• Maila Brock, 39, sign language interpreter

â€œWeâ€™re pretty partial. This is home for us. All of our family is here. ... Warts and all, we love our city and our friends.â€

â€• Evelyn Dow, 56, management

â€œIt just seems like Albuquerque is a good city.â€
TITLE: 'Why Would You Want To Be Anywhere Else?': Meet The People Of Albuquerque

SUMMARY:
Priti Patel has been told her decision not to tell Theresa May she had met with Israeli politicians including Benjamin Netanyahu is a â€œresigning matterâ€.
The international development secretary was forced to apologise on Monday after she held 12 undisclosed meetings while on holiday in August.
She was also reprimanded by Downing Street for suggesting the Foreign Office was aware of the meetings before they took place even though it was not.
On Tuesday No.10 confirmed Patel had suggested the UK send aid money to the Israeli army in the Golan Heights.
May was only made aware Patel had met Netanyahu last Friday - the day after the Israeli prime minister had held talks with the prime minister in Downing Street.
TEXT:
Priti Patel has been told her decision not to tell Theresa May she had met with Israeli politicians including Benjamin Netanyahu is a â€œresigning matterâ€.

The international development secretary was forced to apologise on Monday after she held 12 undisclosed meetings while on holiday in August.

She was also reprimanded by Downing Street for suggesting the Foreign Office was aware of the meetings before they took place even though it was not.

On Tuesday No.10 confirmed Patel had suggested the UK send aid money to the Israeli army in the Golan Heights.

May was only made aware Patel had met Netanyahu last Friday - the day after the Israeli prime minister had held talks with the prime minister in Downing Street.
TITLE: Priti Patel Told Undisclosed Meetings In Israel A 'Resigning Matter'

TEXT:
Donald Trumps Ã¤ltester Sohn soll einer russischen AnwÃ¤ltin eine Aufhebung der Sanktionen gegen Russland in Aussicht gestellt haben

Das behauptete die AnwÃ¤ltin in einem Interview in Moskau

Es kÃ¶nnte ein Paukenschlag sein. Im Fall der Verstrickung des Wahlkampfteams von US-PrÃ¤sident Donald Trump mit dem Kreml hat die russische AnwÃ¤ltin Natalia Veselnitskaya brisante Informationen verÃ¶ffentlicht.

So soll Donald Jr. ihr versprochen haben, ein 2012 von der Obama-Regierung eingefÃ¼hrtes Gesetz zurÃ¼ckzunehmen, das russischen Staatsbeamten Sanktionen auferlegt. Das berichtet die Nachrichtenagentur Bloomberg mit Verweis auf ein Interview der AnwÃ¤ltin in Moskau.

"Falls wir an die Macht kommen..."

Das Versprechen soll Trump Jr. bei einem viel zitierten Treffen am 9. Juni 2016 in New York geÃ¤uÃŸert haben. Ebenfalls anwesend: Trumps Schwiegersohn Jared Kushner und der damalige Kampagnen-Manager Paul Manafort. Letzterer hatte sich Ende Oktober nach monatelangen Ermittlungen gegen ihn dem FBI gestellt. Manafort wird unter anderem VerschwÃ¶rung gegen die USA vorgeworfen.

â¨ Mehr zum Thema: SchlÃ¼sselfigur in der Russland-AffÃ¤re: Wer ist George Papadopoulos - und wie gefÃ¤hrlich ist er fÃ¼r Trump?

Nach eigener Aussage reiste Veselnitskaya unter anderem mit dem Ziel nach New York, sich fÃ¼r das Ende der amerikanischen Sanktionen gegen Russland einzusetzen. Darum ging es auch beim Treffen im Trump Tower am 9. Juni. "Falls wir an die Macht kommen, werden wir uns anschauen, was wir diesbezÃ¼glich unternehmen kÃ¶nnen", soll Trump Jr. der AnwÃ¤ltin geantwortet haben.

Veselnitskaya ging nach eigener Aussage allerdings nicht im offiziellen Auftrag der russischen Regierung in die GesprÃ¤che.

Treffen war Zeitverschwendung

Im Gegenzug wollte der PrÃ¤sidentensohn Unterlagen, die belegen, dass Hillary Clintons Wahlkampagne veruntreute Gelder bezogen hat. Geldgeber der Demokraten sollen bei den Steuern getrickst haben und diese Gelder an Hillary Clinton gespendet haben. Eine Information, die der britische Publizist Rob Goldstone Trump Jr. zuvor in einer E-Mail Ã¼bermittelt hatte â€“ im Namen Veselnitskayas.

Mit diesen konnte die AnwÃ¤ltin aber nicht dienen. Trump Jr. bezeichnete das Treffen darum im Nachhinein als Zeitverschwendung.

Veselnitskaya sicherte zu, die brisanten Informationen Ã¼ber das GesprÃ¤ch auch unter Eid an den US-Sonderermittler Robert Mueller weiterzugeben, wenn es verlangt werde. Damit wÃ¼rde der Druck auf Donald Trump massiv wachsen â€“ eine illegitime Absprache mit der russischen Regierung im Wahlkampf wÃ¤re wohl nur noch schwer mehr von der Hand zu weisen.

Trump wird vorgeworfen, Wahlkampfhilfe aus Russland erhalten zu haben. Fraglich ist, ob dahinter eine direkte Absprache mit dem Kreml steckt.
TITLE: Treffen mit russischer AnwÃ¤ltin: Trumps Sohn soll dem Kreml Aufhebung von Sanktionen versprochen haben

CONSOMMATION - Votre Nutella n'est plus tout Ã  fait le mÃªme. La marque Ferrero, qui produit la cÃ©lÃ¨bre pÃ¢te Ã  tartiner, a finalement confirmÃ© Ã  plusieurs mÃ©dias avoir "procÃ©dÃ© Ã  quelques ajustements" dans sa recette.

Une association allemande de consommateurs s'Ã©tait inquiÃ©tÃ©e le 2 novembre sur Facebook de voir le Nutella prendre une teinte plus claire, photos Ã  l'appui. Exigeant plus de transparence de la part de la marque, l'association notait que le cacao avait reculÃ© dans la liste des ingrÃ©dients, triÃ©s par ordre dÃ©croissant de proportion. Quant Ã  la proportion de lait Ã©crÃ©mÃ© en poudre, elle serait passÃ©e de 7,5 Ã  8,7%. "Ferrero ne veut Ã©videmment pas faire preuve de trop de transparence vis-Ã -vis de ses clients", dÃ©nonce la publication.

En France, le site 76 Actu de Rouen oÃ¹ la plus grande usine Nutella au monde est installÃ©e a pu faire des observations similaires en comparant les diffÃ©rents pots d'une grande surface. Alors que certains affichaient une teneur en lait Ã©crÃ©mÃ© en poudre de 6,6%, d'autres affichaient une proportion de 8,7%.

ContactÃ© par le site, la marque italienne confirme: "afin d'offrir aux consommateurs Ã  tout moment et dans le monde entier, une expÃ©rience gustative unique de qualitÃ© nous avons procÃ©dÃ© Ã  quelques ajustements comme c'est souvent le cas pour d'autres marques".

"La qualitÃ© du produit est inchangÃ©e, tout comme son goÃ»t et sa texture", veut ainsi rassurer le fabriquant.

En France et en Allemagne, les recettes restent ainsi lÃ©gÃ¨rement diffÃ©rentes, pointe France Info. Si outre-Rhin la nouvelle formule est ainsi plus sucrÃ©e mais moins grasse que la prÃ©cÃ©dente, le produit devient par contre tout juste moins gras, moins sucrÃ©, et moins salÃ© en France.

Ce ne sono tanti di nomi spendibili e Renzi lo ha detto chiaramente a Napoli: lavoro per portare il Pd a Palazzo Chigi e non per portare Matteo Renzi".
Sul risultato elettorale in Sicilia, Rosato ha aggiunto: "Il Pd ha preso esattamente gli stessi voti dell'altra" tornata elettorale siciliana.
E' Renzi e solo Renzi che deve valutare se in questa fase convenga che lui sia segretario e anche candidato presidente.
Ora - osserva ancora - Ã¨ il tempo di costruire una coalizione di centrosinistra competitiva e di non perdersi in discussioni fantasiose".
Facciamo che la proposta la fate voi, noi siamo disponibili perchÃ¨ ci stiamo giocando l'Italia, a voi sta a cuore dare un governo stabile all'Italia?".
TEXT:
"Sono mesi che cercano di mettermi da parte, ma non ci riusciranno nemmeno stavolta". CosÃ¬ Matteo Renzi, nell'e-news, promette battaglia contro chi vorrebbe un suo passo indietro "per sistemare i problemi" del centrosinistra. Questa - scrive il segretario Pd - non Ã¨ una novitÃ , visto che hanno studiato vari modi per dirmelo: le prove false di Consip, la polemiche sulle banche, le accuse sulla mancata crescita, i numeri sbagliati sulle tasse e sul Jobs Act [...]. Dire che il problema sono io per il voto in Sicilia si colloca nello stesso filone: utilizzare ogni mezzo per togliere di mezzo l'avversario scomodo. Che poi Ã¨ l'obiettivo di chi Ã¨ contro di noi".

L'ex premier chiede ai suoi di smetterla con i litigi e rilancia l'obiettivo del 40%. "Se il Pd fa il Pd e smette di litigare al proprio interno possiamo raggiungere, insieme ai nostri compagni di viaggio, la percentuale che abbiamo preso nelle due volte in cui io ho guidato la campagna elettorale: il 40 per cento, raggiunto sia alle Europee che al Referendum".

I suoi, intanto, ragionano sulle alleanze. Ettore Rosato e Luigi Zanda offrono a Mdp la carta Gentiloni, ma Bersani li gela: "sono solo tatticismi".

"Abbiamo bisogno dell'alleanza piÃ¹ ampia possibile, con un programma concordato. Abbiamo Paolo Gentiloni che oggi Ã¨ a Palazzo Chigi ed Ã¨ un nome spendibile. Ce ne sono tanti di nomi spendibili e Renzi lo ha detto chiaramente a Napoli: lavoro per portare il Pd a Palazzo Chigi e non per portare Matteo Renzi". CosÃ¬ Rosato a Radio Anch'io su Radio Uno. Sul risultato elettorale in Sicilia, Rosato ha aggiunto: "Il Pd ha preso esattamente gli stessi voti dell'altra" tornata elettorale siciliana. "Ma i Cinque Stelle sono aumentati e il centrodestra, che l'altra volta si Ã¨ presentato diviso, questa volta si Ã¨ presentato unito perdendo anche dei voti. L'Udc questa volta ha preso il 7 per cento e si Ã¨ presentato con Musumeci. L'altra volta si Ã¨ presentato con il centrosinistra portando il 10 per cento" a Rosario Crocetta. "Purtroppo la politica in Sicilia Ã¨ molto, ma molto mobile", ha concluso.

Sul tema Ã¨ intervenuto anche Luigi Zanda, capogruppo Pd a Palazzo Madama: "Dobbiamo dirci tutta la veritÃ , senza sconti sulle ragioni delle nostre sconfitte", afferma a Repubblica. E alla domanda se Matteo Renzi deve fare un passo di lato, risponde: "Solo lui puÃ² decidere di spezzare l'identificazione, prevista dal nostro Statuto, e voluta da Bersani tra segretario e candidato premier". "Io non sono mai stato renziano - spiega Zanda - perÃ² l'ho sostenuto con lealtÃ  . Il nostro Statuto prevede che segretario e candidato premier siano la stessa persona. Solo Renzi puÃ² spezzare questo legame. Lo ha fatto un anno fa con Gentiloni e ha funzionato, ha fatto bene al partito, al Paese e a Renzi stesso. Se vuole scindere le due figure Renzi lo puÃ² fare ancora. E' Renzi e solo Renzi che deve valutare se in questa fase convenga che lui sia segretario e anche candidato presidente. E' una decisione - aggiunge - che assumerÃ  un'importanza nazionale. Se il prossimo governo sarÃ  di coalizione il presidente del consiglio dovrÃ  essere indicato da tutti gli alleati".

Le uscite dei capigruppo Pd di Camera e Senato hanno innescato la reazione del renziano Marcucci: "Non esiste una problema legato al candidato premier del centrosinistra. La legge elettorale non lo richiede. Matteo Renzi sarÃ  il capofila della lista Pd, legittimato dal voto delle primarie, peraltro unico segretario di partito ad averle fatte. Esattamente come avviene con Silvio Berlusconi, Matteo Salvini, Giorgia Meloni e Luigi Di Maio, candidati solo per le rispettive liste di partito", scrive sulla sua pagina Facebook Andrea Marcucci.

"Il premier - chiarisce il senatore Pd - si vedrÃ  dopo le elezioni, a seconda dei numeri che le diverse forze politiche potranno vantare. Ora - osserva ancora - Ã¨ il tempo di costruire una coalizione di centrosinistra competitiva e di non perdersi in discussioni fantasiose".

Dopo la Sicilia, "per le elezioni politiche che facciamo? Proponiamo lo stesso schema: il Pd che costruisce una proposta, un programma, una leadership, cerca condivisone e quando si arriva alla proposta la risposta Ã¨ non ci piace? Facciamo che la proposta la fate voi, noi siamo disponibili perchÃ¨ ci stiamo giocando l'Italia, a voi sta a cuore dare un governo stabile all'Italia?". Lo ha detto Matteo Richetti, rivolgendosi alle forze a sinistra del Pd e in particolare a Mdp, nel corso di 'Ore nove'.

Tuttavia, per Pier Luigi Bersani, leader di Mdp e possibile ma al momento improbabile alleato del Pd alle prossime elezioni politiche, "questo dibattito sui candidati premier Ã¨ solo tatticismo. Con il Rosatellum tutti, anche Brambilla del partito animalista, si possono candidare premier. Con il Pd siamo a una rottura profonda che si risolve solo andando nel profondo". "Il tatticismo Ã¨ solo una tecnica di sopravvivenza. Io chiedo al Pd, parlo con tutti, ma - conclude - rivendicate ancora le cose fatte, il Jobs Act, la buona scuola?".
TITLE: Renzi: "Non mi faranno fuori neanche stavolta"

TEXT:
The Fantasy Bra is here, which means itâ€™s almost time for the Victoriaâ€™s Secret Fashion Show.

Victoriaâ€™s Secret Angel Lais Ribeiro announced Wednesday that sheâ€™ll be wearing the $2 million bra â€• called the â€œChampagne Nights Fantasy Braâ€ â€• at this yearâ€™s show.

â€œIâ€™ve been holding this secret for too long and I am beyond honored to announce that I will be wearing the Champagne Nights Fantasy Bra this year!â€ Ribeiro wrote on Instagram. â€œI am very happy and thankful for my Victoriaâ€™s Secret family for trusting me and all the support from my on family, friends and fans! THANK YOU SO MUCH!!!â€

A post shared by Lais Ribeiro (@laisribeiro) on Nov 1, 2017 at 6:19am PDT

A post shared by Lais Ribeiro (@laisribeiro) on Nov 2, 2017 at 10:42am PDT

A post shared by Lais Ribeiro (@laisribeiro) on Nov 1, 2017 at 3:13pm PDT

According to People, the multi-million dollar bra is made of diamonds, yellow sapphires and blue topaz. It weighs in at over 600 carats and took around 350 hours to create.

Ribero has walked in the Victoriaâ€™s Secret show six times, but this is the first time she will wear the Fantasy Bra.

â€œI never cried so much in my entire life â€” and I have a baby,â€ Ribeiro told People. â€œIt was so emotional. I couldnâ€™t believe it when they told me. It was so beautiful.â€

Take a look at some of the past Fantasy Bras below:
TITLE: Behold, The 2017 Victoria's Secret Fantasy Bra

SUMMARY:
ADVERTISEMENTAfter cars and phones, homes are the next big frontier for technological innovation.
For years, high-tech homes were seen only in cartoons and movies (remember The Jetsons, or the Stark Mansion from Iron Man?).
But as time rolled on, innovations such as flat-screen televisions and voice-controlled assistants have gone from fantasy to reality.
Much of this high-tech wizardry is still in the pipeline, but expected to hit the market soon.
However, there are five amazing innovations that are already transforming our homes.
TEXT:
ADVERTISEMENT

After cars and phones, homes are the next big frontier for technological innovation. For years, high-tech homes were seen only in cartoons and movies (remember The Jetsons, or the Stark Mansion from Iron Man?). But as time rolled on, innovations such as flat-screen televisions and voice-controlled assistants have gone from fantasy to reality. And experts say that the fun's only just beginning.

Researchers are moving steadily closer to perfecting innovations that could transform our lives even furtherâ€”from toilets that can diagnose medical problems, to beds that adjust themselves to maximise sleep quality, and robot housekeepers who can dust and clean faster than any human ever could.

Much of this high-tech wizardry is still in the pipeline, but expected to hit the market soon. However, there are five amazing innovations that are already transforming our homes. Check out this video to find out what they are:

As you can see, smart technology is increasingly getting embedded in every aspect of the modern home, from windows to paint, appliances and more. Yet another reason to hang out at home more often!
TITLE: 5 Innovations That Are Making Our Homes Smarter And Safer

SUMMARY:
We speak with Wayne and Linda, who helped bring former Manus Island detainee, Amir, to Canada.
Tim O'Connor, communications director at the Refugee Council of Australia, accused Turnbull of "playing games with peoples lives".
"Prime Minister Turnbull is saying 'we don't want these refugees, but you can't have them either'," O'Connor said.
"It's an absolutely bizarre situation Prime Minister Turnbull has got himself into.
"Prime Minister Turnbull should be putting human lives in front of short term political point scoring".
TEXT:
An Iranian refugee detained on Manus Island for four years has been whisked to safety in Canada by a big-hearted family, as hundreds of his friends and fellow refugees languish in abysmal conditions in Papua New Guinea.

Amir Taghinia is 24, and until last week he was among the 600 refugees and asylum seekers in the Australian-run centre on Manus Island.

The centre has since been officially closed, with power, water and food cut off in an attempt by local PNG authorities to force residents to move to other nearby accommodation complexes. The United Nations reported last week that at least one of these three new facilities is not finished, while the other two still lack security fences.

We speak with Wayne and Linda, who helped bring former Manus Island detainee, Amir, to Canada. #TheProjectTV pic.twitter.com/iocGYKtRjS â€” The Project (@theprojecttv) November 6, 2017

Taghinia was last week flown to Coquitlam, near Vancouver, where he will be resettled under a novel Canadian policy which allows private sponsorship of refugees. He was sponsored by the family of Chelsea Taylor, an Australian aid worker who formerly worked on Manus, who have agreed to aid him for one year. Under the Canadian program, the sponsoring family or organisation takes responsibility for providing food, accommodation and living expenses, assisting with enrolling in healthcare and education, finding local doctors, and helping with employment searches.

"I am glad some good people of Canada have brought me to safety, but my heart aches for the many brothers I have left behind in the absolute hell that is Manus Island," Taghinia said.

"That ordinary citizens can bring me to safety, with their meagre resources, shines a light on the shameful practices of this government in keeping these other innocent men trapped in such a terrible situation.

"There are clearly many options the Australian Government has to resettle my friends on Manus, it is inhuman that the Australian Government would not take action to give them safety."

In an interview with Canada's CBC News, Taghinia said "I still cannot believe that I am in Canada... People are so welcoming ... they are so lovely, especially my sponsors."

The Asylum Seeker Resource Centre said that Taghinia's case showed why Australia needed to urgently explore third-country resettlement options for the men on Manus, and decried the Turnbull government's refusal to consider the offer of New Zealand Prime Minister Jacinda Ardern to take 150 of the refugees. The ASRC said the Canadian example was "a precedent it could and should extend to those suffering on Manus and Nauru."

Here's a statement from PM Ardern on Manus, reiterating her comments in our story from yesterday.https://t.co/FU76bl0Buv@SkyNewsAust pic.twitter.com/bt0YoDFV4k â€” James O'Doherty (@jmodoh) November 3, 2017

"Amir's Canadian sponsorship demonstrates clearly that it is entirely possible for third countries to step in and provide a workable solution to the current crisis on Manus," said ASRC director of advocacy and campaigns, Jana Favero.

"The Turnbull government must get out of the way. Allow food, water and power to be restored. Allow medical services in and then allow third countries to take the refugees, where they will be welcomed to a new life."

The ASRC said it was a case of "PM Turnbull dithers while crisis deepens". Tim O'Connor, communications director at the Refugee Council of Australia, accused Turnbull of "playing games with peoples lives".

"Prime Minister Turnbull is saying 'we don't want these refugees, but you can't have them either'," O'Connor said.

"It's an absolutely bizarre situation Prime Minister Turnbull has got himself into. New Zealand is prepared to take Australia's refugees from Manus, caring members of the Australian community are putting their hand up, even people in Canada have gone to great lengths to ensure the safety of people whose lives are in jeopardy."

"Prime Minister Turnbull should be putting human lives in front of short term political point scoring".
TITLE: Manus Refugee Resettled In Canada As Australia Ignores His Friends

Apple reconnaÃ®t que "parmi ces changements, (sa) filiale dÃ©tenant ses liquiditÃ©s Ã  l'Ã©tranger a Ã©tÃ© domiciliÃ©e Ã  (...) Jersey" mais que ce choix Ã©tait "spÃ©cifiquement" motivÃ© par la volontÃ© de "s'assurer que ses obligations fiscales et ses paiements aux Etats-Unis n'Ã©taient pas rÃ©duits", sous-entendu par une Ã©ventuelle hausse de son imposition ailleurs.

Dassault livre ses jets de luxe Ã  des sociÃ©tÃ©s bidons de l'Ã®le de Man

Chez Dassault, on a le sens du commerce. D'aprÃ¨s Le Monde, la maison sait se montrer arrangeante avec les clients prÃ¨s de leurs sous. Ainsi, Dassault n'a pas hÃ©sitÃ© Ã  livrer plusieurs jets privÃ©s Ã  un riche homme d'affaires russe sur l'Ã®le de Man pour Ã©chapper Ã  la TVA franÃ§aise.

Oleg Tinkoff, qui a fait fortune dans l'Ã©lectronique, la production de biÃ¨re et la finance, a achetÃ© en 2013 un petit Falcon 2000LX (21 millions d'euros), revendu en 2014 pour acheter un 900LX (32,8 millions d'euros), avant de se raviser pour le 7X en 2016 (41,4 millions d'euros).

Or, d'aprÃ¨s les documents examinÃ©s par Le Monde, Dassault n'a pas facturÃ© de TVA. Pourquoi? Parce qu'il revenait Ã  l'Ã®le de Man, lieu de rÃ©sidence de la sociÃ©tÃ© acheteuse, de percevoir les sommes. Sauf qu'elle ne l'a jamais fait...

GrÃ¢ce Ã  un jeu de sociÃ©tÃ©s Ã©crans, Oleg Tinkoff a Ã©conomisÃ© des millions d'euros de TVA. "Le Russe s'est donc louÃ© son propre avion Ã  lui-mÃªme pour donner l'illusion que la coquille vide de l'Ã®le de Man produisait une activitÃ© commerciale, afin d'obtenir son laissez-passer dans l'espace aÃ©rien europÃ©en sans jamais payer la moindre TVA", rÃ©sume le quotidien.

Pour Dassault, la plaisanterie pourrait prendre un mauvais tour. D'aprÃ¨s le code des impÃ´ts, cette "exonÃ©ration ne s'applique pas lorsqu'il est dÃ©montrÃ© que le fournisseur savait ou ne pouvait ignorer que le destinataire prÃ©sumÃ© de l'expÃ©dition ou du transport n'avait pas d'activitÃ© rÃ©elle". Or, plusieurs e-mails semblent bien le prouver...

Comment Nike passe entre les mailles du fisc hollandais

L'Ã©quipementier sportif amÃ©ricain Nike profite d'un "trou" dans la lÃ©gislation nÃ©erlandaise pour rÃ©duire Ã  seulement 2% son taux d'imposition en Europe, selon de nouvelles rÃ©vÃ©lations publiÃ©es par le journal Le Monde.

Deux sociÃ©tÃ©s basÃ©es au Pays-Bas concentrent "tous les revenus europÃ©ens" de Nike et lui permettent ainsi d'Ã©chapper "Ã  la taxe sur les bÃ©nÃ©fices dans les pays oÃ¹ il vend effectivement les chaussures".

L'Ã©quipementier ne paie ainsi que 2% d'impÃ´t sur les bÃ©nÃ©fices contre 25% pour la moyenne des entreprises europÃ©ennes. "Pour rÃ©ussir ce tour de force, Nike a utilisÃ© toutes les ressources du systÃ¨me fiscal nÃ©erlandais et ses immenses possibilitÃ©s d'optimisation", assure Le Monde.

Le groupe amÃ©ricain se paie "Ã  lui-mÃªme le droit d'utiliser sa marque" et parvient ainsi Ã  rÃ©duire "artificiellement ses profits et donc baisser ses impÃ´ts, tout en constituant un trÃ©sor avec ces royalties", explique le quotidien.

Ce schÃ©ma, mis en place en 2014, "a permis Ã  Nike de rÃ©duire sensiblement son taux d'imposition global, passÃ© de 24% Ã  16% en trois ans", tandis que les pays europÃ©ens ont demandÃ© aux Pays-Bas de combler cette lacune.

L'ONG Oxfam a rÃ©agi en qualifiant Nike de "mauvais payeur". "Ces dizaines de milliards qui Ã©chappent Ã  l'impÃ´t au bÃ©nÃ©fice d'une infime minoritÃ© d'ultra-riches et de multinationales reprÃ©sentent des pertes considÃ©rables pour les budgets des Etats, et ce sont les plus pauvres qui en paient le prix", a dÃ©clarÃ© Manon Aubry, porte-parole pour la France, citÃ©e dans un communiquÃ©.

"Ce que prouve Ã©galement le montage fiscal de Nike Ã  travers les Pays-Bas, c'est que le systÃ¨me d'Ã©vasion fiscale est organisÃ© depuis l'Union europÃ©enne et (cela) rappelle une nouvelle fois l'urgence de s'attaquer aux paradis fiscaux europÃ©ens", a-t-elle soulignÃ©, appelant Bruxelles Ã  effectuer des rÃ©formes.

TITLE: Paradise Papers: Les ruses Ã  la limite de la lÃ©galitÃ© de Dassault, Apple et Nike pour Ã©chapper au fisc

SUMMARY:
Turnbull government MP John Alexander is scrambling to confirm whether he is a dual citizen, which if proven would trigger a byelection that would further threaten the Coalition's grip on power.
Fairfax Media can reveal Mr Alexander's father, Gilbert Alexander, was born in the UK and is likely to have conferred citizenship by descent to his son.
SHAREShare on Facebook SHAREShare on Twitter TWEETLink Member for Bennelong John Alexander in a Liberal Party meeting at Parliament House in Canberra.
SHAREShare on FacebookShare on TwitterLink John Alexander won the Sydney seat of Bennelong at the 2010 election.
Mr Alexander won Bennelong, a culturally diverse electorate on Sydney's north shore in 2010, defeating sitting Labor MP and former ABC broadcaster Maxine McKew.
TEXT:
Turnbull government MP John Alexander is scrambling to confirm whether he is a dual citizen, which if proven would trigger a byelection that would further threaten the Coalition's grip on power.

Fairfax Media can reveal Mr Alexander's father, Gilbert Alexander, was born in the UK and is likely to have conferred citizenship by descent to his son. Mr Alexander has never before been named as an MP with a parent born overseas, meaning his status has flown under the radar since the citizenship saga first erupted in July.

The Liberal member for the Sydney seat of Bennelong has confirmed he never renounced any British citizenship before entering Parliament, and cannot say definitively whether his father did so before the former tennis champion's birth in 1951.

This means he could be ineligible for Parliament under section 44 of the constitution.

SHARE

Share on Facebook SHARE

Share on Twitter TWEET

Link Member for Bennelong John Alexander in a Liberal Party meeting at Parliament House in Canberra. Photo: Glen McCurtayne

A spokesman for Mr Alexander said on Monday: "He believes his dad renounced his UK citizenship in the 41 years he lived in Australia before John was born. But of course he will fully participate in the process that the PM has just announced today."

Prime Minister Malcolm Turnbull on Monday revealed all federal politicians will be required to publicly detail their citizenship history under new transparency measures designed to end the crisis.

Advertisement

The claim that Mr Alexander's father may have renounced at some point after he arrived in Australia in 1911 is complicated by the fact the concept of Australian citizenship did not come into force until 1949.

That means he may have only had a two-year window to renounce before his son was born in 1951.

SHARE

Share on Facebook

Share on Twitter

Link John Alexander won the Sydney seat of Bennelong at the 2010 election. Photo: Peter Rae

Under the online renunciation search tool provided by the British National Archives, there is no record of Mr Alexander's father having renounced at any time after 1948.

Gilbert died in 1987, aged 80.

Fairfax Media has obtained documents that show Gilbert was born in Essex, England in September 1907. He was baptised in London the following month.

An incoming passenger card shows Gilbert and his family travelled from London to Sydney on June 9, 1911, when Gilbert was aged three. He enrolled to vote in the seat of Warringah in 1930 at age 23, and married Mr Alexander's mother, Thelma Fletcher Hipgrave, in 1944. They had John in July 1951.

Under the British Nationality Act 1948, people born to British citizens are automatically given citizenship of the UK by descent.

This law conferred British citizenship on the Nationals' Fiona Nash and One Nation's Malcolm Roberts, who were kicked out of the Senate by the High Court last month. Former Senate president Stephen Parry resigned from Parliament last week after revealing he was a dual UK citizen through the same law.

Asked if he was confident he would not lose any more Coalition MPs to citizenship issues, Mr Turnbull said on Monday: "The federal director has told me that all of the Liberal Party members believe that they are in compliance with the constitution."

Mr Alexander won Bennelong, a culturally diverse electorate on Sydney's north shore in 2010, defeating sitting Labor MP and former ABC broadcaster Maxine McKew. He was reelected at the 2013 and 2016 federal elections. Mr Alexander holds the seat with a margin of almost 10 per cent.

The Turnbull government is down one lower house seat while former deputy prime minister Barnaby Joyce fights a byelection in his NSW seat of New England.

In a statement issued on Monday night, Mr Alexander's spokesman said: "My father was born in the United Kingdom in 1907, before moving to Australia as a very young child.

"He became an Australian citizen as soon as he could. I understand he renounced his British citizenship before I was born, because he was a proud Australian." i
TITLE: Citizenship crisis: Turnbull government MP John Alexander may be a dual citizen

SUMMARY:
Creators the Duffer Brothers have already confirmed that itâ€™s coming, so here are all the questions that will need answering... Will we see Elevenâ€™s sister again?
Episode seven, â€˜The Lost Sisterâ€™, didnâ€™t quite fit in with the rest of the series.
Given how divise the episode has been, we wouldnâ€™t be too shocked if the Duffer Brothers just pretended this whole thing hadnâ€™t happened.
But as Elevenâ€™s sister, Kali, remains somewhere out there with her group of bandits and misfits, it has cleared a path for potential future storylines.
The Duffer Brothers have confirmed that thereâ€™ll be another time skip for the next series though, so itâ€™s unlikely that weâ€™ll get to see the immediate aftermath of the romantic encounters.
TEXT:
We know, we know, â€˜Stranger Things 2â€™ is only a week old but the world spins quickly and before you know it, weâ€™ll be midway through 2018, with more all-new episodes of the Netflix show about to drop. In the past week, weâ€™ve watched (and rewatched) all of the latest installments which means thereâ€™s only one thing left to do. Yup, itâ€™s time to start thinking about what might happen in the third series.

Creators the Duffer Brothers have already confirmed that itâ€™s coming, so here are all the questions that will need answering... Will we see Elevenâ€™s sister again? Episode seven, â€˜The Lost Sisterâ€™, didnâ€™t quite fit in with the rest of the series. While the writers needed to take Eleven out of Hawkins so that she could return and, ultimately, save everyone in the end, this episode-long shift of focus felt a little clunky. Given how divise the episode has been, we wouldnâ€™t be too shocked if the Duffer Brothers just pretended this whole thing hadnâ€™t happened. But as Elevenâ€™s sister, Kali, remains somewhere out there with her group of bandits and misfits, it has cleared a path for potential future storylines.

Netflix

And what about the other children used by the lab? Eleven is (obviouslyâ€¦) number 11 and Kali was branded â€˜008â€™, so - assuming the scientists worked in numerical order - there are potentially at least nine other children that they experimented on. Are they still alive? And if so, will Eleven use her powers to find them, as she did her â€˜sisterâ€™? Could Elevenâ€™s mother ever be saved? It was heartbreaking to watch Millie Bobby-Brownâ€™s character discover the truth about what happened to her mum, finding her suffering from mental and physical health issues after receiving electro-shock treatment from the lab, in order to make her forget about her daughter. She remains at her home, which begs the question of whether thereâ€™s any way she could be saved? Surely Eleven wouldnâ€™t be able to resist visiting her againâ€¦ #JusticeForBob?

Yeah, he made a lot Dad jokes, called his car â€œthe Bobmobileâ€ and listened to too much Kenny Rogers, but in the end, we really grew to love Sean Astinâ€™s character. If heâ€™s good enough for Joyce Byers, heâ€™s good enough for us - and letâ€™s not forget that Bob played a pretty pivotal role in figuring out where Chief Hopper was when he got lost in the Upside Down, before then coming to the rescue again when the demodogs took over the lab. Quite frankly, to call him â€˜the new Barbâ€™ would probably be an undersell, but just as fans of Nancyâ€™s best pal demanded justice for her after season one, weâ€™re hoping for some sort of event to commemorate for Bobâ€™s untimely demise. At least name the Radio Shack after him. What about the two romance storylines? Lucas Sinclair and Mike Wheeler both had their first kisses, with newbie Max Hargrove and Eleven respectively, during the finaleâ€™s Snow Ball dance scene so this will obviously need addressing in future episodes. The Duffer Brothers have confirmed that thereâ€™ll be another time skip for the next series though, so itâ€™s unlikely that weâ€™ll get to see the immediate aftermath of the romantic encounters. Whatâ€™s next for Hopper and Eleven?

Not all of the new relationships in â€˜Stranger Things 2â€™ were romances and the pairing of Hopper and Eleven brought us so much joy, but it was tinged with sadness given that Hopperâ€™s daughter, Sarah, died years ago. Seeing him dote on Eleven and attempt to teach her about the world was heart-breakingly beautiful and when they patched up their differences to close the gate to the Upside Down, we were literally cheering on the sofa. For season three, weâ€™d love to see their bond get even stronger so please guys, no arguing this time. We seriously canâ€™t take it. And Steve and Dustin?

Netflix
TITLE: â€˜Stranger Things 3â€™: 7 Questions That Should Be Answered In The Next Series

SUMMARY:
Priti Patel has been told her decision not to tell Theresa May she had met with Israeli politicians including Benjamin Netanyahu is a â€œresigning matterâ€.
The international development secretary was forced to apologise on Monday after she held 12 undisclosed meetings while on holiday in August.
She was also reprimanded by Downing Street for suggesting the Foreign Office was aware of the meetings before they took place even though it was not.
On Tuesday No.10 confirmed Patel had suggested the UK send aid money to the Israeli army in the Golan Heights.
May was only made aware Patel had met Netanyahu last Friday - the day after the Israeli prime minister had held talks with the prime minister in Downing Street.
TEXT:
Priti Patel has been told her decision not to tell Theresa May she had met with Israeli politicians including Benjamin Netanyahu is a â€œresigning matterâ€.

The international development secretary was forced to apologise on Monday after she held 12 undisclosed meetings while on holiday in August.

She was also reprimanded by Downing Street for suggesting the Foreign Office was aware of the meetings before they took place even though it was not.

On Tuesday No.10 confirmed Patel had suggested the UK send aid money to the Israeli army in the Golan Heights.

May was only made aware Patel had met Netanyahu last Friday - the day after the Israeli prime minister had held talks with the prime minister in Downing Street.
TITLE: Priti Patel Told Undisclosed Meetings In Israel A 'Resigning Matter'

SUMMARY:
The climax of the â€œFifty Shadesâ€ franchise is mere months away.
The first trailer for the final installment of the trilogy you should never watch with your parents arrived on Monday with more whips, chains and corsets than the â€œLady Marmaladeâ€ music video.
Due Valentineâ€™s Day 2018, â€œFifty Shades Freedâ€ finds Christian Grey (Jamie Dornan) and Anastasia Steele (Dakota Johnson) in wedded bliss until forces like a flirty architect, a villainous ex-boss and almost non-existent chemistry threaten to ruin their happily ever after.
Christian also seems to be rubbing off on his paramour in more ways than one (sorry), as Ana can be seen taking charge, brutally reminding everyone that her name is Mrs. Grey thank you very much and evading a lurker with the skill of a â€œFast and Furiousâ€ driver.
Itâ€™s all totally ridiculous, but weâ€™re just happy Kim Basinger, who plays Christianâ€™s version of Mrs. Robinson, is still getting a paycheck.
TEXT:
The climax of the â€œFifty Shadesâ€ franchise is mere months away.

The first trailer for the final installment of the trilogy you should never watch with your parents arrived on Monday with more whips, chains and corsets than the â€œLady Marmaladeâ€ music video.

Due Valentineâ€™s Day 2018, â€œFifty Shades Freedâ€ finds Christian Grey (Jamie Dornan) and Anastasia Steele (Dakota Johnson) in wedded bliss until forces like a flirty architect, a villainous ex-boss and almost non-existent chemistry threaten to ruin their happily ever after.

Christian also seems to be rubbing off on his paramour in more ways than one (sorry), as Ana can be seen taking charge, brutally reminding everyone that her name is Mrs. Grey thank you very much and evading a lurker with the skill of a â€œFast and Furiousâ€ driver.

Itâ€™s all totally ridiculous, but weâ€™re just happy Kim Basinger, who plays Christianâ€™s version of Mrs. Robinson, is still getting a paycheck.

Ã‰TATS-UNIS - Donald Trump ou l'utilitÃ© de la DÃ©mocratie. Mercredi 8 novembre, le chef d'Ã‰tat va fÃªter l'anniversaire de sa victoire Ã  l'Ã©lection prÃ©sidentielle face Ã  Hillary Clinton. Deux mois prÃ©cÃ©dant son investiture, puis dix mois de gouvernance, ponctuÃ©s de polÃ©miques et de faux pas.
