TEXT:
"Mittlerweile reise ich aber oft mit meiner Katze. Das klingt wie ein schlimmes Klischee, aber nach der Trennung von Josh war der Kater unser Scheidungskind. Jetzt bin ich die 40-jÃ¤hrige Schauspielerin, die Ã¼berall ihre Katze mit hinschleppt."

Hollywood-Star Diane Kruger (41) ist es gewohnt, unterwegs zu sein. Im Interview mit der Zeitschrift "Emotion" verriet die gebÃ¼rtige NiedersÃ¤chsin nun, dass sie gerne ihre Katze dabei hat. In Deutschland zu leben, sei auch nach dem Dreh in Hamburg fÃ¼r den Fatih-Akin-Film "Aus dem Nichts" nicht wirklich eine Option, sagt die Schauspielerin. Sie fÃ¼hle sich hier aber auch zu Hause. Durch die Trennung vom langjÃ¤hrigen Partner Joshua Jackson (39, "Dawson's Creek"), den Tod ihres Stiefvaters und der GroÃŸmutter wÃ¤hrend der Dreharbeiten habe sie mit ihrer Mutter zudem eine "intensive Familienzeit" verbracht: "Ich habe das erste Mal seit meiner Kindheit wieder mit ihr in einem Bett geschlafen."

SUMMARY:
Rylee Schuhmacher was finishing class when a friend told her that Premier Brad Wall was talking about her allegations of sexual assault in the province's legislature.
Saskatchewan Premier Brad Wall announces he is retiring from politics during a press conference at the Legislative Building in Regina Aug. 10, 2017.
"It felt like it was a political whipping point rather than something that happened to a real person," Schuhmacher told HuffPost Canada.
The remark incensed Saskatchewan NDP Leader Nicole Sarauer.
Interim Saskatchewan NDP Leader Nicole Sarauer speaks in the Legislative Assembly on Nov. 1, 2017.
TEXT:
Rylee Schuhmacher was finishing class when a friend told her that Premier Brad Wall was talking about her allegations of sexual assault in the province's legislature.

The University of Saskatchewan student told HuffPost Canada she wasn't given a heads up from the premier's office that her experience â€” claims that have launched two internal investigations â€” would be brought up in legislature last week.

Saskatchewan Premier Brad Wall announces he is retiring from politics during a press conference at the Legislative Building in Regina Aug. 10, 2017.

"It felt like it was a political whipping point rather than something that happened to a real person," Schuhmacher told HuffPost Canada.

The sociology student published a blog post last month with detailed allegations of how she was sexually assaulted by a former NDP election candidate. Her story was one of two the premier made a reference to in legislature.

"It's like things finally had started dying with all that had happened after I went public and now it's back," she said.

It felt like it was a political whipping point rather than something that happened to a real person.

Wall's comments raised eyebrows for Schuhmacher and the NDP, of which she is an active member. The remark came up during question period on Tuesday during debate over a land deal scandal involving the province's Global Transportation Hub (GTH).

Wall said he found it "interesting" the opposition was lecturing him on accountability when the NDP "has a former leader who is alleged, alleged to have a complaint on sexual harassment brought to him, and it's also been alleged that he did nothing about it."

The remark incensed Saskatchewan NDP Leader Nicole Sarauer. She called on Wall to retract his statement the next day.

Interim Saskatchewan NDP Leader Nicole Sarauer speaks in the Legislative Assembly on Nov. 1, 2017.

"Shame on this premier for using these words for cheap political points," she said.

Sarauer accused Wall of "completely ignoring" Schumacher's request that her story "not to be used for political gain." Wall doubled down and questioned the party on why the accused continued to be a member of the provincial NDP after allegations about his conduct surfaced.

NDP MLA Trent Wotherspoon called Wall's points "disgusting" and added, "Those aren't his stories to tell."

Watch the full exchange between Sarauer and Wall:

"I make no apology for raising it," Wall later told reporters. He justified the relevance of bringing up the young woman's story by citing it was in the pursuit of transparency and accountability.

Wall's chief of operations and communications told HuffPost Canada the premier is "in no way whatsoever avoiding any political issues."

In an email, Kathy Young said the government has answered "hundreds of questions" about the GTH.

"This goes directly to the NDP's handling of accusations of sexual harassment and assault and the fact that alleged perpetrators were employed within the NDP organization after these allegations came to light to their leader, caucus and party."

The NDP did not respond to HuffPost Canada's request for comment.

'Creepy men and predatory men aren't partisan by nature'

Two independent investigations into the claims related to the former NDP candidate's actions as well as the party's handling of the allegations remain ongoing.

Schumacher, an organizer with the Saskatchewan NDP's youth wing, said the "Harvey Weinstein effect" encouraged her to go public with her own story of sexual harassment and assault.

The 19-year-old said she wasn't pleased with the premier using her sensitive story for politicking. She asked for an apology.

My apology to you. pic.twitter.com/tsK4cvTu0m â€” Brad Wall (@PremierBradWall) November 1, 2017

Wall called Schumacher on Thursday. She said during the 20-minute phone call, Wall hedged that as the father of two girls, he was appalled by the nature of her story.

"I commend him if his genuine intent is to end this kind of behaviour in politics," she said.

She added that there was one thing she couldn't shake: that the premier used her story as a political foil of sorts, a talking point against the NDP.

"Creepy men and predatory men aren't partisan by nature. They aren't exclusive to one party," she said.
TITLE: Teen Disappointed Brad Wall Used Sex Assault Story As 'Political Whipping Point'

SUMMARY:
Nel pieno della bufera dei Paradise Papers, Ã¨ imminente la stretta anti-elusione di Donald Trump, pronta ad abbattersi su giganti come Apple, Ford, Pfizer.
Un escamotage usato da molte societÃ  che cosi' evitano il pagamento delle tasse negli Usa su gran parte delle somme guadagnate.
Apple - scrive il New York Times - avrebbe accumulato piÃ¹ di 128 miliardi di dollari di profitti offshore, che non sono tassati dagli Stati Uniti o da altri Paesi.
Sulla vicenda Apple ha spiegato in sintesi che su alcuni conti sono accumulati i fondi proprio per la copertura fiscale.
IL CASO HAMILTON -Tra i nomi piÃ¹ noti dell'inchiesta Paradise Papers Ã¨ spuntato oggi quello del pilota Lewis Hamilton.
TEXT:
Nel pieno della bufera dei Paradise Papers, Ã¨ imminente la stretta anti-elusione di Donald Trump, pronta ad abbattersi su giganti come Apple, Ford, Pfizer. E che dovrebbe garantire entrate stimate in 154 miliardi di dollari in dieci anni. Nella riforma fiscale presentata dai repubblicani al Congresso americano e' infatti spuntata a sorpresa una 'supertassa' del 20% sui soldi che le multinazionali versano all'estero, nelle casse di societÃ  affiliate che spesso operano in veri e propri paradisi fiscali.

La 'supertassa' - che alcuni commentatori definiscono una vera e propria 'bomba atomica' - in particolare dovrebbe essere applicata a tutte quelle multinazionali che si rifiutano di assoggettare le loro filiali o societÃ  offshore sotto la giurisdizione dell'Irs, l'agenzia delle entrate statunitense. Un escamotage usato da molte societÃ  che cosi' evitano il pagamento delle tasse negli Usa su gran parte delle somme guadagnate. Fin dalla campagna elettorale Trump aveva promesso di 'punire' non solo le grandi societÃ  che spostano parte della loro produzione all'estero, a danno dei posti di lavoro, ma anche quelle che si rifugiano in paradisi fiscali per eludere il sistema fiscale americano

APPLE - La mossa di Trump potrebbe colpire multinazionali come la Apple, attualmente sotto lente d'ingrandimento per lo scandalo dei conti off shore. "L'isola di Jersey, nel canale della Manica, Ã¨ il 'nuovo paradiso fiscale' di Apple, dove sono parcheggiati miliardi di dollari non tassati" scriveva ieri il New York Times citando i Paradise Papers e documenti segreti dello studio legale Appleby, con base nelle Bermuda e a servizio delle aziende e dei ricchi. Apple - scrive il New York Times - avrebbe accumulato piÃ¹ di 128 miliardi di dollari di profitti offshore, che non sono tassati dagli Stati Uniti o da altri Paesi. Strategie come quella usata da Apple per l'isola di Jersey, e usate da altri colossi - secondo il Nyt -, costano ai governi a livello mondiale circa 240 miliardi di dollari di entrate perse ogni anno, in base ai dati dell'Ocse. Apple - scrive infine il quotidiano newyorkese - avrebbe scelto Jersey dopo le indagini del Congresso americano sull'elusione fiscale e dopo il giro di vite lanciato dalle autoritÃ  irlandesi. Sulla vicenda Apple ha spiegato in sintesi che su alcuni conti sono accumulati i fondi proprio per la copertura fiscale.

IL CASO HAMILTON -Tra i nomi piÃ¹ noti dell'inchiesta Paradise Papers Ã¨ spuntato oggi quello del pilota Lewis Hamilton. Vi sono infatti pure 16,5 milioni di sterline riconducibili a Hamilton, sottratti al fisco e trasferiti con "un marchingegno" su conti offshore dell'Isola di Man, fra gli altarini svelati dai 'Paradise Papers': le carte che documentano operazioni finanziarie spregiudicate di personaggi ricchi e potenti del pianeta. L'iridato britannico di Formula 1, da poco campione del mondo per la quarta volta, viene additato dal Guardian, che gli attribuisce inoltre una fortuna pari a 130 milioni sparsa in paradisi fiscali come Malta o Guernsey.

Hamilton si sarebbe in particolare fatto rimborsare 3,3 milioni di sterline d'Iva (Vat in inglese) sull'acquisto di un jet privato, trasferito fiscalmente sull'Isola di Man nel 2013 facendo apparire il tutto come un'operazione di leasing consentita - nel Regno Unito o nell'Ue - solo per velivoli usati a scopo di business commerciale e non a titolo personale. Il pilota ha fatto rispondere da un portavoce in questi termini: "Essendo uno sportivo globale che paga tasse in un vasto numero di Paesi, Lewis si affida a un team di consulenti professionisti nella gestione dei suoi affari. Questi consulenti hanno rassicurato Lewis che ogni cosa Ã© stata fatta alla luce del sole e la questione Ã© ora nelle mani dei suoi avvocati".
TITLE: Paradise Papers, in arrivo la super tassa di Trump contro giganti come Apple, Ford o Pfizer

SUMMARY:
Dear readers,I am so pleased to announce "Listen to America," a hugely ambitious, cross-country project weâ€™re undertaking at HuffPost to understand whatâ€™s on the minds of Americans and what it means to be American in 2017.
Weâ€™ll listen to whatâ€™s most important to them, and help tell those stories to the vast HuffPost audience.
As we visit 25 cities, weâ€™ll use our bus â€” built out as a mobile video studio â€” to listen and collect hundreds if not thousands of voices, and weâ€™ll share many of them along the way.
Third, as journalists, being good listeners, and getting out of our own way, are at the core of our practice.
"Listen to America" is an opportunity to practice this skill over and over, and discover great stories out in the field, where they live.
TEXT:
Dear readers,

I am so pleased to announce "Listen to America," a hugely ambitious, cross-country project weâ€™re undertaking at HuffPost to understand whatâ€™s on the minds of Americans and what it means to be American in 2017. Consider this an invitation to our journey.

For journalists, listening is more important than ever. Why? First, trust in the news media is at an all-time low. We want to address that head-on, and build trust in the work we do, by visiting communities that are often ignored by national media. Weâ€™ll listen to whatâ€™s most important to them, and help tell those stories to the vast HuffPost audience.

Second, political divisions between us seem starker than ever. But at HuffPost, we believe thereâ€™s still so much that unites us as citizens. We aim to discover and highlight all that, and show what Americans have in common. As we visit 25 cities, weâ€™ll use our bus â€” built out as a mobile video studio â€” to listen and collect hundreds if not thousands of voices, and weâ€™ll share many of them along the way. Weâ€™ll also create ways for you to make your voice heard too, even if we arenâ€™t coming to your hometown.

Third, as journalists, being good listeners, and getting out of our own way, are at the core of our practice. "Listen to America" is an opportunity to practice this skill over and over, and discover great stories out in the field, where they live.

Weâ€™re popping our own bubbles in more ways than one. Join us! The bus hits the road on Sept. 12 in St. Louis. Check our map to see if weâ€™re coming to your town. Subscribe to our newsletter. And shoot us any tips or thoughts at listening@huffpost.com. Weâ€™re here.

Best,Lydia Polgreen
TITLE: Listen to America

(Gabriella Miller Kids First Research Act)? SUMMARY:
There's now an excuse to get extra silly this silly season and it comes in the form of a gin advent calendar.
Yes, you read that correctly -- an advent calendar that has ousted chocolate and brought in the gin.
The Advent Season Traditionally, advent is the season before Christmas during which Christians prepare for the coming of Christ.
Of course, the Advent season is celebrated by many people, religious or not.
The Australian Gin Advent Calendar is available for purchase via the Gintonica website, however they can only be shipped to locations within Australia.
TEXT:
There's now an excuse to get extra silly this silly season and it comes in the form of a gin advent calendar.

Yes, you read that correctly -- an advent calendar that has ousted chocolate and brought in the gin.

The people at Gintonica created the calendar which includes 24 different types of Australian craft gin ready to try each day of December. The various gins come from five different Australian states and represent 21 distillers. The bottles are 50 millilitres in size.

The calendar also includes serving suggestions and tasting notes from the distillers and a few gin cocktail recipes.

The Advent Season Traditionally, advent is the season before Christmas during which Christians prepare for the coming of Christ. The name 'Advent' itself comes from the Latin word 'adventus' which means 'arrival'. The season includes the four Sundays before Christmas and is observed using a wreath with four candles -- one candle for each week in the season. Each Sunday, a new candle is lit as Christmas approaches. Of course, the Advent season is celebrated by many people, religious or not. Advent calendars are often the highlight of this time for children, as they can eat a little chocolate each day. All over the world, Christmas markets pop-up in town squares and main streets, decorations appear and trees go up. In the warmer weather, many Aussies choose to check out the light displays in their local areas, or to travel a little further afield and visit some of the more extravagant houses. For most of us, Advent is a time to catch up with family and friends and attend Christmas parties among the mad dash from store to store to get that Christmas shopping done.

The Australian Gin Advent Calendar is available for purchase via the Gintonica website, however they can only be shipped to locations within Australia. Orders will be shipped before December 1, so you won't need to play catch up once the final month of 2017 ticks around.

Chocolate, step aside.

The calendar retails for $295 and over 70 percent of the stock has already been sold.
TITLE: This Gin Advent Calendar Is The Perfect Tonic For Anyone Sick Of Chocolate

SUMMARY:
WASHINGTON (Reuters) - Special Counsel Robert Mueller has collected sufficient evidence to charge Michael Flynn, U.S. President Donald Trump's former national security adviser, and his son, NBC News reported on Sunday, citing multiple sources familiar with the investigation.
Mueller is increasing pressure on Flynn following his indictment of Trump campaign manager Paul Manafort, NBC News said.
Special Counsel Robert Mueller has got enough evidence to charge Micheal Flynn.
Flynn served 24 days as Trump's national security adviser but was fired after it was discovered he had misrepresented his contacts with a Russian diplomat to Vice President Michael Pence.
(Reporting by Howard Schneider; Additional reporting by Nathan Layne in New York; Editing by Lisa Shumaker)
TEXT:
WASHINGTON (Reuters) - Special Counsel Robert Mueller has collected sufficient evidence to charge Michael Flynn, U.S. President Donald Trump's former national security adviser, and his son, NBC News reported on Sunday, citing multiple sources familiar with the investigation.

NBC News said Mueller's team is looking at possible money laundering charges, lying to federal agents, and Flynn's role in a possible plan to remove an opponent of the Turkish president from the United States in exchange for millions of dollars.

Mueller is increasing pressure on Flynn following his indictment of Trump campaign manager Paul Manafort, NBC News said.

Special Counsel Robert Mueller has got enough evidence to charge Micheal Flynn.

Flynn served 24 days as Trump's national security adviser but was fired after it was discovered he had misrepresented his contacts with a Russian diplomat to Vice President Michael Pence.

Barry Coburn, a lawyer for the younger Flynn, declined to comment. Robert Kelner, Flynn's lawyer, did not immediately respond to a request for comment.

NBC said that Mueller's office also declined comment.

Reuters was not immediately able to confirm the report.

(Reporting by Howard Schneider; Additional reporting by Nathan Layne in New York; Editing by Lisa Shumaker)
TITLE: Mueller Has Enough Evidence to Charge Mike Flynn, Trumpâ€™s Former National Security Adviser: Report

SUMMARY:
La Sicilia Ã¨ la quarta regione italiana per numero di abitanti, ma Ã¨ anche portatrice di una specificitÃ  che non ne puÃ² fare, oltre una certa misura, un test elettorale di valenza nazionale.
Una diserzione del voto che non ha trovato un contenimento neanche con il risultato, indubbiamente importante, del Movimento cinque stelle.
Ma la lezione che porge il contenuto piÃ¹ significativo dal punto di vista del prossimo appuntamento elettorale nazionale, riguarda il valore della coalizione.
PerchÃ© le leggi elettorali italiane, dal comune al Parlamento, non incoraggiano le corse solitarie, ma le coalizioni.
La filosofia "coalizionale" impone comportamenti e approcci coerenti, conventio ad includendum e non ad excludendum, mediazioni e non digrignamento di denti, copertura politica di un'intera area e non di un segmento soltanto.
TEXT:
La Sicilia Ã¨ la quarta regione italiana per numero di abitanti, ma Ã¨ anche portatrice di una specificitÃ  che non ne puÃ² fare, oltre una certa misura, un test elettorale di valenza nazionale. Non possono essere sottovalutate le macrotendenze, questo Ã¨ certo, che si muovono innanzitutto verso una ulteriore solcatura nel rapporto tra cittadini e urne, crollato al 46,5%. Una diserzione del voto che non ha trovato un contenimento neanche con il risultato, indubbiamente importante, del Movimento cinque stelle. La prima considerazione, allora, riguarda la performance dei grillini, su cui si Ã¨ spesa in modo massivo l'immagine del neoleader Di Maio, che con un coup de thÃ©Ã¢tre, dichiara, ostentando una degnazione intinta nel fiele a risultato appena acquisito, di "cancellare" il faccia a faccia televisivo con Renzi, perchÃ© non si addice al vincitore il confronto col perdente. Il voto grillino in Sicilia, al netto di quel che sarÃ  il governo di palazzo dei Normanni, racconta una cosa su cui occorre riflettere: i Cinque stelle non attingono al bacino del non-voto, ma prosciugano quello di altri partiti, confermando il tasso altissimo di volatilitÃ  dell'opzione elettorale dei siciliani. E degli italiani. Ma la lezione che porge il contenuto piÃ¹ significativo dal punto di vista del prossimo appuntamento elettorale nazionale, riguarda il valore della coalizione. Il centro-destra vince perchÃ© ha costruito un'alleanza. Il centro-sinistra perde perchÃ© non ha saputo (o voluto) costruirla. I Cinque stelle non ci provano perchÃ© nascono anti-coalizionali e, forse, alla fine, non si pongono l'obiettivo del governo (bisognerÃ  cominciare a considerare anche questa ipotesi) ma solo quello di collocare un gruppo dirigente nelle assemblee elettive. PerchÃ© le leggi elettorali italiane, dal comune al Parlamento, non incoraggiano le corse solitarie, ma le coalizioni.

Dunque se il centrosinistra vuole veramente partecipare al torneo elettorale, occorrerÃ  che si attrezzi, abbandonando il mantra coltivato dall'avvento dell'Italicum fino all'approvazione del Rosatellum (che fatica con questi ridicoli latinorum!), quello della lista autosufficiente. Ãˆ cambiato radicalmente lo scenario, ma evidentemente si fa fatica a metabolizzare che chi vada da solo sia destinato a perdere. La filosofia "coalizionale" impone comportamenti e approcci coerenti, conventio ad includendum e non ad excludendum, mediazioni e non digrignamento di denti, copertura politica di un'intera area e non di un segmento soltanto. Recupero d'identitÃ  culturali e non pragmatismo uber alles. Il perno dell'area c'Ã¨ e si chiama Pd. C'Ã¨ pure una forza alla sua sinistra che, se riuscisse a fare una sorta di reductio ad unum e a superare l'istinto antagonista nei confronti dello stesso Pd, potrebbe raccogliere strati interessanti di elettorato.

Occorre il riequilibrio al Centro. Il Pd non riesce a raccogliere il segmento elettorale centrista-riformista: quel che poteva prendere l'ha giÃ  preso e digerito. Bisogna che quella parte di paese che ha sostenuto da posizioni moderate i governi di questa legislatura, dimostri di avere l'intelligenza di unirsi per avere un ruolo importante nella coalizione di centro-sinistra. Alfano, i diversi rivoli dell'esperienza montiana, le esperienze regionali di liste civiche di area, i rappresentanti della cultura moderata e cattolico-democratica che siedono in Parlamento, devono mettersi insieme per competere, non per confezionare una lista-civetta. Competere per vincere, uniti in una coalizione equilibrata, capace di rappresentare tutte le culture riformiste del paese.
TITLE: La lezione siciliana Ã¨ "vince chi si coalizza". Il Pd c'Ã¨, la sinistra pure, ora tocca al centro

SUMMARY:
ADVERTISEMENTThe Haryana Urban Development Authority (HUDA) today said it sold approximately 10-acre plot to Swedish furniture maker IKEA for around Rs 842 crore in its single largest property auction till date.
HUDA sold an approximately 10 acres of commercial land for a whopping Rs 842 crore in Sector 47 of Estate-II of HUDA Gurugram, an official said.
"The site was successfully auctioned to IKEA, a multinational group, that designs and sells ready-to-assemble furniture..," J Ganesan, Chief Administrator HUDA, said.
This is not a one-off deal as we have planned out auctions of other institutional and commercial properties across the city in the next few months.
Gurugram has seen a reduced demand mainly due to rapidly changing investments scenario in real estate, especially in commercial sector.
TEXT:
ADVERTISEMENT

The Haryana Urban Development Authority (HUDA) today said it sold approximately 10-acre plot to Swedish furniture maker IKEA for around Rs 842 crore in its single largest property auction till date.

HUDA sold an approximately 10 acres of commercial land for a whopping Rs 842 crore in Sector 47 of Estate-II of HUDA Gurugram, an official said. The site was put for e-auction on October 6 this year and was bidded on October 31.

"The site was successfully auctioned to IKEA, a multinational group, that designs and sells ready-to-assemble furniture..," J Ganesan, Chief Administrator HUDA, said.

"It will augment our efforts in ensuring steady revenue stream for HUDA. This is not a one-off deal as we have planned out auctions of other institutional and commercial properties across the city in the next few months. Gurugram has seen a reduced demand mainly due to rapidly changing investments scenario in real estate, especially in commercial sector. However, we are hopeful to sell more properties and gather handsome revenue for HUDA from the Estates of Gurugram," an official release quoted Ganesan as saying.

With IKEA marking its arrival in Gurugram, it very well highlights the importance of this city and its position in the global marketplace as a business and investor friendly destination, he said.

The site was put for e-auction three times earlier but had no takers until October 31 when the multinational finally participated and emerged successful.
TITLE: IKEA Buys 10-Acre HUDA Plot In Gurugram For Whopping Rs 842 Crore

TEXT:

Davanti alla commissione d'inchiesta sulle banche Ã¨ appena terminata l'audizione di Fabrizio Viola, commissario liquidatore di Veneto Banca e Popolare di Vicenza, quando Matteo Orfini affida a Facebook un nuovo attacco nei confronti degli "organi di controllo" ritenuti incapaci di intervenire tempestivamente per evitare il tracollo dei dei istituti veneti.

Questa volta i renziani del Pd tirano in ballo le "scavalcate", cioÃ¨ - come spiega il senatore dem Gianni Dal Moro che ha sollevato la questione in commissione - quei tentativi dei soci delle banche venete che hanno provato a vendere le azioni prima del crollo e non ci sono riusciti, trovandosi scavalcati da altri che invece hanno ricevuto un trattamento preferenziale e sono riusciti a vendere prima del danno.

Quello delle scavalcate Ã¨ in realtÃ  un tema giÃ  noto alla magistratura che indaga sulle due banche venete alla luce di alcune denunce presentate da alcuni ex soci, ma il Pd ha deciso di chiedere direttamente a Viola di ufficializzare l'esistenza o meno di questo fenomeno. "Presumibilmente sÃ¬", avrebbe risposto uno dei membri della squadra che ha affiancato il commissario liquidatore durante l'audizione, secondo quanto riferito a Huffpost da un parlamentare presente.

Dal Moro, su Facebook, trae le conclusioni: "Mentre tutto questo succedeva, nulla veniva rivelato tempestivamente dagli organi di controllo". Orfini, poco dopo, ha condiviso e rilanciato il post del collega, rivendicando il lavoro del Pd: "Siamo stati - e ancora siamo - molto criticati per quello che in queste settimane abbiamo detto sulle crisi bancarie, ovvero che i sistemi di vigilanza non hanno funzionato al meglio", scrive Orfini. "Tanti - aggiunge - sono corsi in soccorso a un sistema il cui malfunzionamento Ã¨ sotto gli occhi di tutti, indignandosi per le nostre critiche e accusandoci con parole di fuoco di essere stati irresponsabili, improvvidi, addirittura indecenti. Peccato che alla fine la veritÃ  si impone: la commissione di inchiesta sta lavorando e sono bastate le prime audizioni a dimostrare la fondatezza delle nostre critiche. Ed Ã¨ solo l'inizio".

Il Pd tiene il punto a due giorni dal confronto all'americana tra la Banca d'Italia e la Consob proprio davanti alla commissione d'inchiesta. Un faccia a faccia molto atteso perchÃ© ci sono diversi punti delle due rispettive letture, fornite dagli organi di controllo, che non tornano. Il punto piÃ¹ controverso riguarda il prezzo delle azioni delle due banche venete, che si Ã¨ rivelato essere troppo elevato: da qui partirÃ  un confronto che vedrÃ  i rappresentanti di Bankitalia e Consob rispondere uno dopo l'altro per poi lasciare spazio alle domande dei parlamentari.
TITLE: I renziani di nuovo all'attacco di Bankitalia: "Dopo le porte girevoli scopriamo le scavalcate, nessuno se ne Ã¨ accorto"

Dabei war es Deutschland, das Russland den Krieg erklÃ¤rte.
Und zwar auch deshalb, weil die Deutschen davon ausgingen, dass unser Land sich zu einem Wirtschafts-Riesen entwickeln und zu groÃŸ und zu stark werden wÃ¼rde.

"UdSSR und Russland - MÃ¶rder und Mordopfer"Ein derartiger vÃ¶lliger historischer Bruch ist in der Geschichte selten, aber nicht einmalig.
TEXT:
Oleg Nikishin via GettyImages

Was die Ereignisse, die sich heute vor 100 Jahren in Russland zugetragen haben, und die noch fÃ¤lschlich als "Oktoberrevolution" bezeichnet werden, wirklich bedeuten, wird bis heute von der offiziellen Geschichtsschreibung ignoriert. Und in den Medien verfÃ¤lscht.

Der staatliche TV-Sender Rossija 1 hat dem 7. November 1917 (nach dem damals gÃ¼ltigen Kalender der 25. Oktober 1917) eine ganze Talkshow gewidmet. Dort sagte der Chef der Kommunistischen Partei, Gennadij Sjuganow: "Die Geschichte kennt keinen Konjunktiv. Was passiert ist, ist passiert."

Aber das stimmt nicht.

Wenn man uns verbieten will, darÃ¼ber nachzudenken, was ohne Lenins Putsch passiert wÃ¤re, dann ist das klare Zensur. Und auch eine Rechtfertigung fÃ¼r die Verbrechen in unserer Vergangenheit.

Russland hÃ¤tte sich nicht in den ersten Weltkrieg einmischen sollen, sagte der Chef-Kommunist. Dabei war es Deutschland, das Russland den Krieg erklÃ¤rte. Und zwar auch deshalb, weil die Deutschen davon ausgingen, dass unser Land sich zu einem Wirtschafts-Riesen entwickeln und zu groÃŸ und zu stark werden wÃ¼rde.

Aber gehen wir noch weiter.

Die neue Regierung wollte sich auf die BÃ¼rger berufen

Hunderte Jahre hielt man die Macht - die Zarenkrone - fÃ¼r gottgegeben.

Ende des 19. Jahrhunderts lieÃŸ der Glauben an Gott nach.

Die Februar-Revolution 1917 - der Sturz des Zaren - war deshalb zeitgemÃ¤ÃŸ.

Die neue Regierung wollte sich nicht mehr auf Gott berufen, sondern auf ihre BÃ¼rger.

Deshalb hatte sie fÃ¼r November 1917 Wahlen ausgerufen.

Gleichzeitig setzte die Provisorische Regierung unter Alexander Kerenski den Krieg fort. An der Front schaffte sie erstaunliche Erfolge.

Dann kam Lenin und die Revolution

Wladimir Uljanow, der sich Lenin nannte, hatte zur gleichen Zeit nur ein einziges Ziel: An die Macht zu kommen. Und er wusste: Dazu musste Russland erst den Krieg verlieren, denn ein Sieg hÃ¤tte Kerenski zum Helden gemacht.

Russlands Position im Krieg verbesserte sich rasch. Tschechen, Slowaken und Kroaten wollten nicht mehr weiter gegen Russland kÃ¤mpfen, wo es jetzt keinen Zaren mehr gab, und Wien signalisierte notgedrungen Verhandlungsbereitschaft.

Als Berlin erfuhr, dass der eigene BÃ¼ndnisgenosse abtrÃ¼nnig werden kÃ¶nnte, wandte es sich an einen alten Freund, der von Deutschland bezahlt wurde - Wladimir Uljanow alias Lenin.

Der befahl seinen Leuten, unverzÃ¼glich die Minister der Provisorischen Regierung festzunehmen - am 25. Oktober (7. November): "Jede VerzÃ¶gerung wÃ¤re gleichbedeutend mit dem Tod", war damals die Parole. Einen Tag spÃ¤ter wÃ¤re der Frieden mit Ã–sterreich unterzeichnet worden.

Massenterror gegen das eigene Volk

Am 26. Oktober erlieÃŸ Lenin sein "Dekret fÃ¼r den Frieden" - also die Kapitulation Russlands.

Der angebliche "2. Kongress der Volksdeputierten" - in Wirklichkeit nur eine Versammlung von Abgeordneten aus den wenigen Regionen, in denen Lenins Leute wirklich eine Mehrheit hatten - "ernannte" eine bolschewistische Regierung.

â–º Bei den Wahlen zur Verfassungsgebenden Versammlung, die diese ausrief, erhielt Lenins Partei im November 1917 nicht mal ein Viertel der Stimmen.

Im Dezember schaffen die Kommunisten hastig die WTscheKa, eine VorgÃ¤nger-Organisation des KGB, die Massenterror gegen das eigene Volk betrieb.

Lenins KÃ¤mpfer schossen auf Demonstranten

Am 18. Januar 1918 traf sich ein Teil der gewÃ¤hlten Abgeordneten zur verfassungsgebenden Versammlung.

Als diese die Erlasse der Sowjets fÃ¼r illegal erklÃ¤rte, wurde sie aufgelÃ¶st. In der gleichen Nacht lieÃŸ Lenin seine KÃ¤mpfer mit Maschinengewehren auf Demonstranten schieÃŸen, die auf die StraÃŸe gingen, um ihre legitim gewÃ¤hlten Abgeordneten zu verteidigen. Mehr als hundert Menschen starben.

Lenins Mitstreiter Bucharin rief den BÃ¼rgerkrieg aus. Die bolschewistische Regierung hatte keine LegitimitÃ¤t. Sie kÃ¤mpfte ausschlieÃŸlich fÃ¼r die Interessen ihrer AnfÃ¼hrer. Sie hatte keine soziale Basis, weder im alten noch im neuen Russland.

"Diktatur des Proletariates"

Selbst die russischen Marxisten wie Plechanow und Martow erkannten die so genannte Revolution, die in Wirklichkeit ein Putsch war, nicht an. Deshalb mussten Lenin und seine AnhÃ¤nger sich von der ganzen tausendjÃ¤hrigen Geschichte Russlands lossagen.

Die nationale Symbolik - das Wappen, die Hymne, die Flagge, der Staatsnamen - alles wurde abgeschafft. Stattdessen schuf man die so genannte "UdSSR". An Stelle der demokratischen Republik, die sich gerade aus dem konstitutionellen Monarchie entwickelt hatte, trat eine "Diktatur des Proletariates".

Schon am 20. November 1917 erklÃ¤rten die Bolschewiken das gesamte bestehende Recht fÃ¼r ungÃ¼ltig. Alle Gesetze verloren ihre Wirkung, die Gerichte und Staatsanwaltschaften wurden aufgelÃ¶st. Ganz offen wurde erklÃ¤rt, dass die neue Regierung das VÃ¶lkerrecht nicht anerkennt.

â–º Auch der bestehenden Moral wurde der Kampf angesagt. Ebenso wie der Kirche.

Der radikale Bruch wird heute ignoriert

Lenins "Plan der monumentalen Propaganda" sollte die Erinnerung an alles auslÃ¶schen, was mit dem alten Russland zu tun hatte. DenkmÃ¤ler wurden zerstÃ¶rt, Ortsnamen geÃ¤ndert, ebenso der Kalender und die Rechtschreibung.

1921 wurden alle humanitÃ¤ren FakultÃ¤ten der russischen UniversitÃ¤ten geschlossen. Erst Jahrzehnte spÃ¤ter wurde das Studium von Geschichte, Soziologie, Recht und Philosophie wieder mÃ¶glich.

Dieser radikale Bruch durch die Bolschewiki wird heute von der russischen Politik - und deshalb auch der Geschichtsforschung und in den SchulbÃ¼chern - ignoriert.

"UdSSR und Russland - MÃ¶rder und Mordopfer"

Ein derartiger vÃ¶lliger historischer Bruch ist in der Geschichte selten, aber nicht einmalig. Das sowjetische und postsowjetische Regime hat in etwa so viel gemeinsam mit dem historischen Russland wie die Bundesrepublik mit dem Dritten Reich. "Die UdSSR und Russland - das ist MÃ¶rder und Mordopfer", schrieb Solschenizyn.

Statt der russischen Idee riefen die Bolschewisten die sowjetische Idee aus: Soziale Gerechtigkeit, Verzicht auf Ausbeutung, freie Entwicklung des Individuums, usw.

â–º Doch diese lauten Parolen waren nur ein Vorhang, mit dem die schreckliche sowjetische RealitÃ¤t verdeckt wurde.

In der Sowjetunion herrschte totale Zensur, die Grenzen waren geschlossen, die Menschen wurden maximal ausgebeutet, die Wirtschaft war rÃ¼ckstÃ¤ndig, es herrscht Mangel selbst an Waren des tÃ¤glichen Bedarfs, Hunger, Armut, ein katastrophaler Niedergang der Landwirtschaft und vieles mehr.

Es ist deshalb kein Wunder, dass die gesamte Geschichte der Sowjetunion auch eine Geschichte des Widerstands der einfachen Menschen gegen dieses System ist - und zugleich des Kampfes dieses Systems gegen die eigenen Menschen.

â¨ Das kÃ¶nnte euch auch interessieren: Friede mit Russland - bloss wie?

Russland hatte den Anspruch, eine Weltmacht zu sein

Bolschewismus - das sind drei kÃ¼nstlich erzeugte Hunger-Katastrophen, GULAG - "ein Auschwitz ohne Krematorium" - der "rote Terror" und der "groÃŸe Terror", die Deportation von sechs Millionen Menschen.

Russland schritt in das 20. Jahrhundert mit dem Anspruch, eine fÃ¼hrende Weltmacht zu sein. Es beendete das Jahrhundert mit dem Zusammenbruch der Sowjetunion.

In 70 Jahren Kommunismus hat Russland 5,5 Millionen Quadratkilometer LandflÃ¤che verloren - das ist zehnmal so viel wie das Territorium Frankreichs. 1917 lebten in Russland 186 Millionen Menschen, heute sind es 143 Millionen.

Fast alle Opfer von Stalins Terror gegen das eigene Volk sind, still und leise, offiziell rehabilitiert.

â–º Das bedeutet, dass Lenin und Stalin einen VÃ¶lkermord an ihrem eigenen Volk begangen haben.

Wir brauchen eine intellektuelle moralische Erneuerung

Was kann man dazu noch sagen? Um aus der 100-jÃ¤hrigen Sackgasse herauszukommen, in die Russland heute vor 100 Jahren eingebogen ist, brauchen wir eine gigantische intellektuelle moralische Erneuerung.

Nur, wenn wir uns von dem tief sitzenden Erbe und Denken aus der Sowjetzeit lossagen, das Geschehene juristisch aufarbeiten und endlich VergangenheitsbewÃ¤ltigung beginnen, wenn wir an das alte Russland anknÃ¼pfen, und dessen Erbe reformieren und modernisieren, wenn wir uns dabei die Erfahrung der europÃ¤ischen Demokratien zu Herzen nehmen, nur dann haben wir eine Chance, die russische Zivilisation wiederauferstehen zu lassen.

Nur so kÃ¶nnen wir uns aus der Rolle des AussÃ¤tzigen befreien, in die wir uns selbst manÃ¶vriert haben. Und einen wÃ¼rdigen Platz in der Geschichte der Menschheit einzunehmen.

Der Text wurde von Boris Reitschuster aus dem Russischen Ã¼bersetzt.

____
TITLE: 100 Jahre Oktoberrevolution: Wie der VÃ¶lkermord am eigenen Volk begann

L'islamologue et thÃ©ologien suisse controversÃ© Tariq Ramadan, accusÃ© de viol en France et d'abus sexuel sur des mineures en Suisse, est mis en congÃ© de l'universitÃ© d'Oxford, en Grande-Bretagne, oÃ¹ il enseigne, a annoncÃ© mardi l'universitÃ©.

"D'un commun accord et avec effet immÃ©diat, Tariq Ramadan, professeur d'Ã©tudes islamiques contemporaines a pris un congÃ© de l'universitÃ© d'Oxford", a indiquÃ© la prestigieuse universitÃ©.

"Un congÃ© n'implique aucune prÃ©somption ou acceptation de culpabilitÃ© et permet au professeur Ramadan de rÃ©pondre aux accusations extrÃªmement graves portÃ©es contre lui, qu'il nie catÃ©goriquement, tout en rÃ©pondant Ã  notre principale prÃ©occupation - rÃ©pondre Ã  la dÃ©tresse accrue et comprÃ©hensible, et mettre en prioritÃ© le bien-Ãªtre de nos Ã©tudiants et du personnel", souligne l'universitÃ©.

Tariq Ramadan, 55 ans, petit-fils du fondateur de la confrÃ©rie Ã©gyptienne islamiste des FrÃ¨res musulmans, et brillant orateur, bÃ©nÃ©ficie d'une forte popularitÃ© dans les milieux musulmans conservateurs. Il est aussi trÃ¨s contestÃ©, notamment dans les sphÃ¨res laÃ¯ques, qui voient en lui le tenant d'un islam politique

Il a Ã©tÃ© visÃ© par deux plaintes pour viol en France, survenues au milieu de la vague de libÃ©ration de la parole qui a suivi l'affaire Weinstein, du nom du puissant producteur amÃ©ricain accusÃ© de viols et d'agressions sexuelles.

Tariq Ramadan s'est dÃ©fendu farouchement de ces accusations de viol en dÃ©nonÃ§ant sur sa page Facebook une "campagne de calomnie" qui fÃ©dÃ¨re ses "ennemis de toujours". Ce pÃ¨re de quatre enfants, mariÃ© depuis plus de 30 ans Ã  une FranÃ§aise convertie s'est dit "serein et dÃ©terminÃ©".

Samedi, la Tribune de GenÃ¨ve a publiÃ© un long article consacrÃ© Ã  quatre anciennes Ã©lÃ¨ves de Tariq Ramadan lorsqu'il enseignait le franÃ§ais et la philosophie Ã  GenÃ¨ve entre 1984 et 2004.

Parmi ces quatre femmes, trois ont avouÃ© avoir cÃ©dÃ© Ã  "l'emprise psychologique" de leur professeur et avoir eu des relations sexuelles avec lui, l'une Ã  15 ans et les deux autres Ã  18 ans. La quatriÃ¨me, qui avait 14 ans Ã  l'Ã©poque, Ã©voque le harcÃ¨lement auquel elle a dÃ» faire face.

Sur son compte twitter, Tariq Ramadan a dÃ©menti "catÃ©goriquement" ces allÃ©gations et annoncÃ© le dÃ©pÃ´t d'une plainte contre X pour diffamation.

Au Royaume-uni, un scandale de harcÃ¨lement sexuel Ã©branle la classe politique depuis plusieurs semaines, visant des personnalitÃ©s de premier plan.

L'universitÃ© d'Oxford dit avoir "toujours reconnu la gravitÃ© des allÃ©gations contre le professeur Ramadan, tout en soulignant l'importance de l'impartialitÃ© et des principes de justice et de procÃ©dure rÃ©guliÃ¨re".

TEXT:
Nordkorea war das dominierende Thema beim Treffen von Donald Trump und Japans Premierminister Shinzo Abe

Trump sagte: "Die Ã„ra der strategischen Geduld" sei zu Ende

Donald Trump hat seine Position bezÃ¼glich Nordkorea bekrÃ¤ftigt. Die Ã„ra strategischer Geduld sei vorbei, sagte der US-PrÃ¤sident.

"Wenn die Leute sagen, meine Rhetorik sei zu stark, sollten wir uns ansehen, wohin wir mit schwacher Rhetorik in den vergangenen 25 Jahren gekommen sind", sagte Trump am Montag in Tokio bei einer gemeinsamen Pressekonferenz mit Japans Premier Shinzo Abe.

Maximaler Druck auf PjÃ¶ngjang

Der japanische Regierungschef beteuerte ebenfalls, dass Japan und die USA im Konflikt um Nordkoreas Atom- und Raketenprogramm den Druck auf PjÃ¶ngjang erhÃ¶hen wollten. Dies sei nicht die Zeit fÃ¼r Dialog mit Nordkorea.

"Dialog um des Dialoges willen mache keinen Sinn", sagte Abe. "Wir wollen durch alle mÃ¶glichen Mittel den Druck auf Nordkorea bis zum Maximalen erhÃ¶hen."

Konkret kÃ¼ndigte Abe an, die Sanktionen auszuweiten: Die VermÃ¶genswerte von 35 nordkoreanischen Gruppierungen und Einzelpersonen sollen eingefroren werden. Mit dieser Strategie wollen die VerbÃ¼ndeten den andauernden Nukleartests des nordkoreanischen Regimes Einhalt gebieten.

â¨ Mehr zum Thema: Medienbericht: Trump kritisiert vor Asien-Reise Japans Umgang mit Nordkorea

Trump verteidigt RÃ¼ckzug aus Handelsabkommen TPP

Trump verteidigte in Japan auch den RÃ¼ckzug der USA aus dem transpazifischen Handelsabkommen TPP. Bei einem Treffen mit GeschÃ¤ftsleuten sagte Trump am Montagmorgen (Ortszeit) in Tokio: "Wir werden mehr Handel haben als im Rahmen von TPP, und die Situation wird viel weniger komplex sein." TPP sei nicht die richtige Idee gewesen.

TPP sollte rund um den Pazifik die grÃ¶ÃŸte Freihandelszone der Welt schaffen. Der Vertrag war im Februar 2016 unterzeichnet worden, aber noch nicht in Kraft getreten. Die elf Handelspartner reprÃ¤sentieren 800 Millionen Menschen und 40 Prozent der Weltwirtschaft. Sie wollen nach dem RÃ¼ckzug der USA groÃŸenteils ohne Amerika weiter vorangehen.

"Der Handel mit Japan ist nicht frei und er ist nicht gegenseitig, aber er wird es bald sein", sagte Trump. Er habe keinen Zweifel, dass dies fair geschehen werde. Es werde eine Zeit dauern, aber dann werde es Handelsdeals und "Handelskonzepte" geben.

Entsprechende GesprÃ¤che mit Japan dauerten schon sehr lange. Das finanzielle Ergebnis werde besser fÃ¼r beide LÃ¤nder sein. In den vergangenen Jahrzehnten habe Japan in Handelsfragen mit den USA immer gewonnen, sagte Trump.

Ein interner Machtkampf sorgt fÃ¼r Unruhe in der rheinland-pfÃ¤lzischen AfD

Die Gegner des Landeschefs Uwe Junge rufen zur Revolte auf

Der Vorgang ist auÃŸergewÃ¶hnlich - und kÃ¶nnte Auswirkungen auf die gesamte Partei haben

Auch nach den Querelen um den RÃ¼ckzug der AfD-Chefin Frauke Petry kommt die Partei nicht zur Ruhe.

WÃ¤hrend sich die AfD im Bundestag sortiert, gÃ¤rt es in den LandesverbÃ¤nden gewaltig.

Der Landtagsfraktion in Sachsen und Nordrhein-Westfalen droht nach einer Austrittswelle das Aus. In Petrys Landesverband in Sachsen wurde gar ein Notvorstand berufen. Und auch die Auseinandersetzungen in der AfD-Fraktion in Rheinland-Pfalz nehmen zu.

Im Fokus: Der rheinland-pfÃ¤lzische AfD-Chef Uwe Junge. Er muss sich seit einigen Wochen mit lautem, parteiinternen Widerstand herumschlagen.

Querelen um den Parteitag

â–º Ende Oktober versÃ¤umte er, die Einladungen zum Parteitag rechtzeitig an die Mitglieder zu verschicken. Daraufhin regte sich heftiger Widerstand. Die HuffPost berichtete.

Solche kleinen Formfehler kÃ¶nnten sich "bitter rÃ¤chen", sagte der Polit-Experte Werner Patzelt von der TU Dresden. â€œDas machen sich interne Gegner zu Nutze, die sich in der Partei gegen die FÃ¼hrung durchsetzen wollen.â€

â–º Nun steht Junge erneut unter Druck - im Kern geht es um eine Initiative seiner parteiinternen Rivalin und Stellvertreterin Christiane Christen.

In einem Aufruf, der bereits mehrere hundert Unterzeichner hat, appelliert sie, zu den "GrÃ¼ndungsidealen der Partei" zurÃ¼ckzukehren. Christen kritisiert die undurchsichtige Verteilung von Posten und deren Bezahlung. Der Landesvorstand solle zur "IntegritÃ¤t und Rechtstreue" zurÃ¼ckkehren.

VorwÃ¼rfe sind "falsch und bÃ¶swillig"

Junge wandte sich daraufhin in einer Mail wÃ¼tend an die rheinland-pfÃ¤lzischen AfD-Mitglieder. Die VorwÃ¼rfe seien "falsch und bÃ¶swillig", heiÃŸt es einem Schreiben, dass der HuffPost vorliegt.

Der Aufruf suggeriere, den Mitgliedern werde "die Partei weggenommen oder es bestÃ¼nde zumindest die Gefahr dazu. Ich mÃ¶chte diesem Aufruf mit einem Schreiben an Sie alle entgegen treten, weil hier der erneute Versuch unternommen wird, die gute Arbeit des Landesvorstands und der Fraktion in Frage zu stellen."

Christen hatte sich Mitte des Jahres aus dem Landesverband zurÃ¼ckgezogen, nachdem ihre Bewerbung auf die Spitzenkandidatur zur Bundestagswahl gescheitert war.

"Die VorgÃ¤nge sind bemerkenswert"

Die VorgÃ¤nge sind ungewÃ¶hnlich - und kÃ¶nnten auch Ã¼ber die Landesgrenzen hinaus in der AfD zu spÃ¼ren sein. Denn der Machtkampf kann fÃ¼r Junge gefÃ¤hrlich werden, sagt Carl Berning, Politologe an der UniversitÃ¤t Mainz.

"Seine Aussichten auf eine Karriere in Berlin schwinden, wenn der Eindruck entsteht, dass er seinen Laden nicht im Griff hat.â€

Der Machtkampf sei insofern bemerkenswert, weil der Landesverband in der AuÃŸenwahrnehmung als einer der stabilsten in Westdeutschland gilt, erklÃ¤rt Berning.

"Der Machtkampf kÃ¶nnte Junge gefÃ¤hrlich werden"

Junge gilt in der Partei als gemÃ¤ÃŸigt, galt bis zu Petrys Weggang als Vertrauter der damaligen Parteichefin und unterstÃ¼tzt den Partei-Ausschluss des RechtsauÃŸen BjÃ¶rn HÃ¶cke.

Einige Beobachter sehen in dem Machtkampf um Junge deswegen auch einen Kampf des rechten Lagers um die Vorherrschaft in der Partei.

"Zeit fÃ¼r einen Putsch ist gÃ¼nstig"

Zum Showdown kÃ¶nnte es auf dem Landesparteitag Ende des Jahres kommen. Weil dann auch der Landesvorstand gewÃ¤hlt werden muss, kÃ¶nnten Junges Gegner zur offenen Revolte blasen.

â€œDie Zeit fÃ¼r einen Putsch im Landesverband ist kurz vor dem Parteitag strategisch gÃ¼nstig", sagt Politologe Berning.

Bis zur nÃ¤chsten Landtags- und Bundestagswahl ist es noch lange hin. Ein Streit um die ParteifÃ¼hrung wÃ¼rde also keine Stimmen kosten - sofern es gelingt, wieder Einigkeit herzustellen.

"Dies wird nÃ¶tig sein, sollte der Streit um die ParteifÃ¼hrung tatsÃ¤chlich eskalieren, um einen personellen Wechsel hervorzurufen", sagt Berning.

Falls es tatsÃ¤chlich zum Putsch kommt, wÃ¤re das ein weiterer Schritt zur Radikalisierung der Partei.

In the next few weeks, there are many wedding dates, which will boost demand," said Kumar Jain, a Mumbai-based jeweller.

That's why the market is in premium, despite moderate demand," said a dealer with a private bank in Mumbai.
TEXT:
A saleswoman keeps a gold necklace in a shelf at a showroom in Mumbai, India, August 13, 2015.

ADVERTISEMENT

MUMBAI/BENGALURU -- Demand for physical gold was lacklustre in top consumers India and China this week, while the lure of the metal remained stable in Singapore, but India's peak wedding season is expected to usher in renewed interest for bullion in coming weeks.

Gold is considered an essential part of weddings in India, second-biggest consumer of the metal in the world after China, and it is a popular gift on such occasions.

"The wedding season has started. In the next few weeks, there are many wedding dates, which will boost demand," said Kumar Jain, a Mumbai-based jeweller.

Dealers in India were charging a premium of up to $3 an ounce this week over official domestic prices, unchanged from last week. The domestic price includes a 10 percent import tax.

"Gold imports by (jewellery) export houses have fallen sharply in the last few weeks. That's why the market is in premium, despite moderate demand," said a dealer with a private bank in Mumbai.

In October, India tightened gold import norms for jewellery exporters by restricting them from importing the yellow metal only for export purposes and not for selling in the domestic market.

Meanwhile, in China, the market for the precious metal remained quiet, with premiums of $5 to $9 an ounce being charged over benchmark rates, as against the $6.50 to $10 range in the previous week.

Benchmark spot gold was on track to register a small weekly gain, hovering around the $1,275.00 level as of 0919 GMT on Friday, but still below Thursday's mark of $1,284.10, highest in nearly two weeks. [GOL/]

"Dips below the $1,270 level (toward the beginning of the week) spurred some buying, but the upside, (around the $1,280 level) limited purchases," said Ronald Leung, chief dealer at Lee Cheong Gold Dealers in Hong Kong.

Premiums in Hong Kong remained more or less unchanged from last week, in the 60 cents to $1.20 range.

"Premiums are quite low, and except for periodic large sales, the market is quiet," said Joshua Rotbart, managing partner of J. Rotbart & Co in Hong Kong.

In Singapore, premiums rose to 70-90 cents from the 50 cents last week.

"There has been interest from two segments, the wholesalers and high net worth individuals, so it is still strong," said Loh Mun Chun, Director, Private Wealth at GoldSilver Central in Singapore.

"The wholesalers need to buy ... to produce jewellery, especially with some spillover demand coming from the Diwali and Dhanterras festivals, while the high net worth individuals ... buy to diversify their portfolio and they have the money."

Japanese markets were closed for a public holiday on Friday.

Also On HuffPost:
TITLE: Wedding Bells Set To Ring In Fresh Gold Demand In India

TEXT:
INSOLITE - Dans le petit village normand de Boissey, entre Lisieux et Caen, se trouve une cabine tÃ©lÃ©phonique. InutilisÃ©e depuis longtemps, elle vieillissait sur le bord d'une dÃ©partementale. Qu'allait-elle bien pouvoir devenir? Allait-elle Ãªtre dÃ©mantelÃ©e, comme le prÃ©voyait l'un des amendements de la Loi Macron?

C'Ã©tait compter sans l'ingÃ©niositÃ© et la crÃ©ativitÃ© de l'artiste plasticienne Ã‰velyne Tosello, qui, aprÃ¨s s'Ãªtre installÃ©e dans cette commune du Calvados, a dÃ©cidÃ© de prendre en charge la reconversion pratique et esthÃ©tique de la cabine tÃ©lÃ©phonique qui est devenue une petite bibliothÃ¨que libre. Une "cabliothÃ¨que" en somme.

La "cabliothÃ¨que" a Ã©tÃ© installÃ©e en 2015, mais elle connaÃ®t une seconde jeunesse (et rÃ©colte les louanges des internautes) depuis qu'elle s'est retrouvÃ©e sur Twitter dÃ©but novembre.

Au dÃ©part c'est une cabine tÃ©lÃ©phonique dans un village, de plus prÃ¨s c'est une bibliothÃ¨que, et Ã  bien y penser c'est beaucoup plus encore. pic.twitter.com/TejskfB1mx 4 novembre 2017

Le principe est simple: n'importe qui peut venir se servir ou dÃ©poser un nouveau livre. Une fois lu, l'ouvrage doit Ãªtre replacÃ© dans la "cabliothÃ¨que", afin que les autres riverains puissent en profiter. BasÃ©e sur le civisme des lecteurs, l'initiative a Ã©tÃ© soutenue par la Mairie de la ville et par son maire, Monsieur Philippe Desforges.

L'idÃ©e a germÃ© dans la tÃªte de l'artiste pendant la fÃªte de ce village de 230 Ã¢mes, en juillet 2015. AprÃ¨s avoir eu l'autorisation d'Orange (anciennement France TÃ©lÃ©com), propriÃ©taire des cabines tÃ©lÃ©phoniques dans l'hexagone, Ã‰velyne Tosello s'est retroussÃ©e les manches, prÃªte Ã  donner Ã  l'habitacle une nouvelle vie: "J'ai dÃ©cidÃ© de m'impliquer dans la vie du village, afin de crÃ©er du lien humain et social. Mon fils a rÃ©alisÃ© les calligraphies que l'on voit en haut de la "cabliothÃ¨que" et un menuisier du village s'est chargÃ© de fabriquer les Ã©tagÃ¨res. On ne voulait pas dissimuler la beautÃ© de la cabine, juste la rÃ©habiliter", confie l'artiste au HuffPost. Trois mois de travaux plus tard, la cabine tÃ©lÃ©phonique Ã©tait mÃ©tamorphosÃ©e.

Deux annÃ©es sont passÃ©es et des centaines de livres ont Ã©tÃ© empruntÃ©s. MÃªme si Ã‰velyne Tosello a eu de bons Ã©chos de la part des habitants, elle manque de retour. Les nombreux partages des photos de sa bibliothÃ¨que en ce mois de novembre lui permettront sans doute d'avoir plus de tÃ©moignages de lecteurs.

Environ 600 ouvrages sont proposÃ©s dans cette cabine et malgrÃ© quelques livres "piquÃ©s", Ã‰velyne Tosello retient surtout le bon cÃ´tÃ© de cette expÃ©rience. La "cabliothÃ¨que" est devenu un lieu d'Ã©change culturel et littÃ©raire dans ce petit village: "Ã‡a a crÃ©Ã© du lien social dans un village un peu vieillissant".

L'initiative a inspirÃ© d'autres communes franÃ§aises: dans le Morbihan, le Vaucluse, l'Oise ou le Vercors, des dizaines de cabines tÃ©lÃ©phoniques sont reconverties en bibliothÃ¨ques. Mais celle de Boissey a Ã©tÃ© l'une des premiÃ¨res avec la "cabliothÃ¨que" de ConliÃ¨ge, dans le Jura, inaugurÃ©e un an plus tÃ´t. Des pionniers!

Jamais Ã  court d'idÃ©es, Ã‰velyne Tosello ne compte pas raccrocher: deux autres cabines tÃ©lÃ©phoniques sont en attente de reconversion. "J'aimerais qu'elles deviennent des petits musÃ©es. Mais je ne le ferai pas seule, il faut que les autres habitants de Boissey se motivent. Les Normands, il faut les secouer pour casser leur petit mode de vie", lance-t-elle dans un Ã©clat de rire.

SUMMARY:
One of the two puppies allegedly killed by Vishesh Iyengar.
Worse, he boasted about killing the first puppy, posting it on a WhatsApp group, reported The Times of India.
"1 down, 1 more to go, DoggyTales," Vishesh Iyengar reportedly posted in a WhatsApp group of some of his classmates at an engineering college in Vellore.

TEXT:
One of the two puppies allegedly killed by Vishesh Iyengar.

ADVERTISEMENT

A man in Tamil Nadu was so overcome with anger that some puppies apparently peed in his clothes, that he flung them off a terrace, killing them on the spot. Worse, he boasted about killing the first puppy, posting it on a WhatsApp group, reported The Times of India.

"1 down, 1 more to go, DoggyTales," Vishesh Iyengar reportedly posted in a WhatsApp group of some of his classmates at an engineering college in Vellore. "Black dog down," he replied after a group member asked him if the dog was dead.

According to reports, Iyengar killed one black puppy and another light brown puppy soon afterwards. The second puppy had been recently rescued by another resident in the area and was their pet. It had apparently wandered into the apartment complex where Iyengar lives.

A police complaint has been registered at the Katpadi K1 station by animal rights activists. The resident who had rescued the second puppy reportedly claimed that Iyengar did not show any remorse, saying, "It's just a dog, I didn't kill a human."

Also On HuffPost:
TITLE: Engineering Student Kills 2 Puppies In Tamil Nadu, Posts News Proudly On WhatsApp Group

TEXT:
C'est un fait: les femmes et les hommes n'apprÃ©hendent pas l'espace urbain de la mÃªme faÃ§on. Rues, cafÃ©s, espaces culturels et sportifs, transports... sont occupÃ©s diffÃ©remment. Les incivilitÃ©s y sont rÃ©guliÃ¨res, quand elles n'entraÃ®nent pas de situations dramatiques.

Depuis le dÃ©but de l'annÃ©e, plusieurs discriminations dont sont victimes les femmes au sein de l'espace public ont Ã©tÃ© dÃ©noncÃ©es de maniÃ¨re massive sur les rÃ©seaux sociaux, en tÃ©moignent les hashtags qui fleurissent autour du harcÃ¨lement (#BalanceTonPorc, #DearCatCaller) ou encore autour du phÃ©nomÃ¨ne de #Manspreading -qui consiste Ã  s'asseoir en Ã©cartant les cuisses et en occupant ainsi le plus de place possible au dÃ©triment des autres voyageurs. La toile est devenue cet espace public sans contour gÃ©ographique, oÃ¹ les voix se libÃ¨rent collectivement et appellent Ã  la mise en place de solutions locales. Ainsi en juin dernier, Ã  Madrid, le mÃ©tro rÃ©agissait au phÃ©nomÃ¨ne de #Manspreading en lanÃ§ant une campagne d'affichage pour sensibiliser la gent masculine, tandis que le collectif franÃ§ais Osez le fÃ©minisme invitait la RATP Ã  faire de mÃªme, sans succÃ¨s...

Comment inspirer une mobilitÃ© conviviale et un urbanisme pro-fÃ©minin? Comment mettre fin au clivage des genres dans les espaces publics? Comment favoriser des actions citoyennes et politiques au service d'un vivre-ensemble Ã©galitaire?

TEDxChampsÃ‰lysÃ©esWomen a choisi cette annÃ©e de concentrer ses regards sur les rÃ©alitÃ©s physiques et virtuelles dans lesquelles le genre est Ã  l'origine d'une discrimination, et de mettre en lumiÃ¨re des idÃ©es venues d'horizons diffÃ©rents, de maniÃ¨re Ã  soulever le dÃ©bat et inspirer des actions positives en faveur d'une #EQUALIciTY:

- Dans le champ de l'Ã©ducation, il est primordial que l'ensemble des systÃ¨mes Ã©ducatifs revisite les rÃ´les femme-homme et inculquent aux citoyens une culture de solidaritÃ© face aux agressions dans l'espace public.

- De mÃªme, les politiques publiques se doivent d'Ãªtre exemplaires et incitatives, Ã  l'image du principe de Gender Budgeting (loi du 12 janvier 2007) dÃ©fini par le Conseil de l'Europe, qui permet d'Ã©valuer les inÃ©galitÃ©s financiÃ¨res liÃ©es au genre et d'Ã©tendre l'obligation de vigilance Ã  tous les services de l'Ã‰tat en matiÃ¨re de dÃ©pense publique.

- Nous partageons la conviction que c'est en nous rassemblant en un mÃªme lieu un moment donnÃ© que nous pourrons tisser des liens et faire Ã©merger collectivement une rÃ©flexion constructive au service d'un vivre-ensemble citoyen.

C'est ce projet que je porte depuis 2013 et c'est cette conviction qui m'anime: l'Ã©galitÃ© ne se dÃ©crÃ¨te pas, elle se construit ensemble!

SUMMARY:
Boris Johnson has been savaged by Labourâ€™s Emily Thornberry and Yvette Cooper for a diplomatic blunder that risks extending a jail term for a British woman arrested in Iran.
Shadow Foreign Secretary Emily Thornberry laid into Johnson, declaring Theresa May didnâ€™t have the â€œstrength or authorityâ€ to sack him, but he should do the decent thing and resign.
How many more times does the Foreign Secretary have to insult our international partners, damage our diplomatic relations, and now imperil the interests of British nationals abroad?
The Foreign Secretary said that he also intended to take a trip to Iran personally to try to secure her release.
Boris Johnson doesnâ€™t understand magnitude of the job & responsibility he holds https://t.co/lZkeoETlSp â€” Anna Soubry MP (@Anna_Soubry) November 7, 2017
TEXT:
Boris Johnson has been savaged by Labourâ€™s Emily Thornberry and Yvette Cooper for a diplomatic blunder that risks extending a jail term for a British woman arrested in Iran. Amid shouts of â€œresign!â€ and â€œshame!â€, the Foreign Secretary also came under heavy attack from Tory MPs such as Anna Soubry after he refused to apologise properly for his remarks about Nazanin Zaghari-Ratcliffe. Johnson admitted â€œI could have been clearerâ€ when he claimed last week that Zaghhari-Ratcliffe had been training journalists in Iran - a line which was seized on by the Tehran authorities as proof that she was â€˜spreading propagandaâ€™ against the regime. But he sparked anger after he refused repeated requests to apologise for his comments. Eventually, he said he was â€˜sorryâ€™- but only â€˜ifâ€™ his words had been taken out of context. Zaghari-Ratcliffeâ€™s employer the Thomson-Reuters foundation had insisted the Foreign Secretary should correct his remarks, amid claims that Iranian judges want to double her possible sentence for alleged spying from five years to 10 years. She was arrested last year after a family holiday to see relatives. Her three-year-old daughter has been placed with grandparents while her mother has been locked in jail, often in solitary confinement. Shadow Foreign Secretary Emily Thornberry laid into Johnson, declaring Theresa May didnâ€™t have the â€œstrength or authorityâ€ to sack him, but he should do the decent thing and resign.

PA Wire/PA Images Boris Johnson at the Foreign Affairs Committee last week.

Thornberry said that he should say sorry for â€œthe distress and anguish that his foolish words have causedâ€ to Zaghari-Ratcliffe and her family. â€œHow many more times does this need to happen? How many more times does the Foreign Secretary have to insult our international partners, damage our diplomatic relations, and now imperil the interests of British nationals abroad? â€œWhat will it take before the Prime Minister will say â€˜Enough is Enoughâ€™? â€œBut if the truth is that she canâ€™t, because she doesnâ€™t have the strength or authority to sack him, how about the Foreign Secretary himself showing a bit of personal responsibility, and admitting that a job like this, where your words hold gravity and your actions have consequences, is simply not the job for him.â€

Empics Entertainment Yvette Cooper.

Cooper was just as withering, declaring â€œthe lives and the safety of British citizens across the globe depends on having a Foreign Secretary who does not bluster and is not too careless or too lazy to consider his wordsâ€. â€œThe Foreign Secretary cannot be trusted to do this job. And he should resign.â€ Johnson said that Zaghhari-Ratcliffeâ€™s husband Richard had sent him a note welcoming his clarification. The Foreign Secretary said that he also intended to take a trip to Iran personally to try to secure her release. And he hit back at Thornberry, insisting that the Iranian foreign minister had assured him his remarks had had no bearing on the sentencing process. â€œShe deflects blame and accountability for those holding that mother in jail - and that is the Iranian regime,â€ Johnson said. Eventually, after his 40-minute grilling, Johnson expressed his regrets for his words, although only with a caveat that they had been misinterpreted. Lib Dem MP Layla Moran, whose Oxford constituency includes family members of the jailed mother, said: â€œThe fact is the family have been worried sick, by his irresponsible comments. â€œOn a human level is the Foreign Secretary at all sorry for the rollercoaster of emotions he has caused Nazanin and her family this week and could he at least apologise to them today?â€

PA Wire/PA Images Anna Soubry

Johnson replied: â€œOf course Iâ€™m sorry if any words of mine have been so taken out of context and so misconstrued as to cause any kind of anxiety for the family of Nazanin Zaghari-Ratcliffe, of course I am..â€ But he faced a fresh backlash for qualifying his apology with the word â€˜ifâ€™.

Classic non-apology ... I m sorry â€˜ifâ€™ - might have saved himself a lot of bother if heâ€™d just said he made a mistake + promised to fix it https://t.co/oJB0RbQjUL â€” Laura Kuenssberg (@bbclaurak) November 7, 2017

The lack of contrition is as shameful as the original error. Boris Johnson doesnâ€™t understand magnitude of the job & responsibility he holds https://t.co/lZkeoETlSp â€” Anna Soubry MP (@Anna_Soubry) November 7, 2017
TITLE: Boris Johnson Savaged By Emily Thornberry And Yvette Cooper Over His Iran Blunder

SUMMARY:
â€œHi, Iâ€™m Kris Jenner, Iâ€™m a big celebrity,â€ she first tells the cashier, who beams with delight at the introduction.
The Ellen Show Kris Jenner leans in to whisper a secret to the cashier about a pack of razors.
But it was her last secret shared that left the cashier with a particularly nervous expression on her face.
â€œBut you know what, too blessed to be stressed.â€â€œAnd laugh really hard,â€ Ellen instructs her, prompting Jenner to roll her head back and cackle loudly.
â€œJust keep laughing, just keep laughing, yes!â€The Ellen Show Kris Jenner laughs loudly after telling the cashier, who briefly hid behind the register, that she was being pranked on "The Ellen DeGeneres Show."
TEXT:
After E! network inked a $150 million deal to renew â€œKeeping Up With The Kardashians,â€ the 99-cent store would seem the last place youâ€™d find family matriarch Kris Kenner.

But thatâ€™s exactly where â€œThe Ellen DeGeneres Showâ€ sent the reality TV star as part of the talk showâ€™s hidden earpiece series, Ellenâ€™s Show Me More Show, on Friday and the results couldnâ€™t have been funnier.

The 62-year-old momager, with Ellen feeding directions into her ear, was instructed to eat and wear unpaid merchandise, laugh hysterically on cue, demonstrate her finger-dancing skills, and confess that she buys razors to shave her back to an unsuspecting cashier.

As the video shows, it didnâ€™t take long for her to pull off a pretty convincing celebrity breakdown.

â€œHi, Iâ€™m Kris Jenner, Iâ€™m a big celebrity,â€ she first tells the cashier, who beams with delight at the introduction. â€œBefore I check out, I have a couple questions.â€

Jenner is then instructed to question the prices on a coconut and a pack of razors â€• during which she is forced to reveal her hairy secret â€• and also ask how much wine a plastic bucket can hold.

The Ellen Show Kris Jenner leans in to whisper a secret to the cashier about a pack of razors.

But it was her last secret shared that left the cashier with a particularly nervous expression on her face.

â€œMommyâ€™s broke,â€ she tells the cashier in a whisper. â€œBut you know what, too blessed to be stressed.â€

â€œAnd laugh really hard,â€ Ellen instructs her, prompting Jenner to roll her head back and cackle loudly. â€œJust keep laughing, just keep laughing, yes!â€

The Ellen Show Kris Jenner laughs loudly after telling the cashier, who briefly hid behind the register, that she was being pranked on "The Ellen DeGeneres Show."

Behind her, a man impatiently waits to pay for several items and gives her a glare.

He may not have been amused, but Ellenâ€™s audience sure was.
TITLE: Kris Jenner Prank Shopping With Ellen In Her Ear Is Pure Hilarity

A number of celebrities have spoken out in a call for â€œactionâ€, following the mass shooting in Texas over the weekend.
On Sunday (5 November), 26 people were killed in a shooting at a church in Sutherland Springs, Texas.
The response from the US government, including President Trumpâ€™s claim this is not â€œa gun situationâ€ but a problem relating to â€œmental healthâ€, and Speaker Paul Ryanâ€™s call for â€œprayersâ€ has been met with a backlash on social media, including from a number of celebrity critics.
TEXT:
A number of celebrities have spoken out in a call for â€œactionâ€, following the mass shooting in Texas over the weekend.

On Sunday (5 November), 26 people were killed in a shooting at a church in Sutherland Springs, Texas.

The response from the US government, including President Trumpâ€™s claim this is not â€œa gun situationâ€ but a problem relating to â€œmental healthâ€, and Speaker Paul Ryanâ€™s call for â€œprayersâ€ has been met with a backlash on social media, including from a number of celebrity critics.
TITLE: Celebrities Call For Action And Gun Reform In Wake Of Texas Church Shooting

TEXT:
A woman who was shopping with her child during a shooting at a Walmart leaves the area in Thornton, Colorado November 1, 2017. REUTERS/Rick Wilking

ADVERTISEMENT

At least two people were killed and one wounded in a shooting inside a Walmart store in suburban Denver on Wednesday, police said.

Police in Thornton, Colorado, did not immediately release any information about the circumstances of the shooting or who was responsible for the gunfire.

In a Twitter post about 90 minutes after the shooting, police said investigators had confirmed that two men were dead and a woman was taken to a local hospital, but no further details were given.

The situation appeared potentially ominous from authorities' initial reports.

"We've got multiple parties down, we're still trying to ascertain what their conditions are," Officer Victor Avila of the Thornton Police Department told Reuters by telephone not long after police arrived on the scene.

#BREAKING Police in Thornton Co search @Walmart store after gunfire reported. Police also believe multiple people are down #fox5atl pic.twitter.com/jDI0MhWrRE â€” Paul Gourley (@pgFox5) November 2, 2017

About an hour after the initial alert, police said on Twitter that the threat of gunfire had ended at the store, which was surrounded by police and fire crews.

"At this time this is NOT an active shooter. Active crime scene. We will update as info becomes available," the police department said in that tweet. Confirmation of the two fatalities came about 20 minutes later.

Thornton is city of about 120,000 people roughly 10 miles (16 km) northeast of downtown Denver.

Avila said police were called to the store at about 6:30 p.m. Mountain time (8:30 p.m. ET) and that the gunshots had ceased by the time the first officers arrived at the scene.

A Walmart customer, Aaron Stephens, 44, of Thorton, told Reuters he was inside paying for groceries at a self-checkout stand when he heard gunshots and the sound of ricocheting bullets.

"The employees started screaming and the customers started screaming" as people began to flee the store, he recounted. "I ran out, too, because I didn't want to get shot."

Stephens said he did not see where the shooting had come from and did not see anyone struck by bullets.

Local NBC television affiliate 9NEWS reported that a woman whose son was in the Walmart had told her that he had heard about 30 gunshots and was still inside.

A video posted on Twitter showed the Walmart, which is situated in a large complex of big-box stores and other retail outlets adjacent to U.S. Interstate 25, apparently empty except for police officers with guns drawn.
TITLE: At Least Two Dead In Shooting Inside Walmart Store In Suburban Denver

Il record lo raggiunge Luigi Genovese, studente universitario di 21 anni, e ora il piÃ¹ giovane deputato eletto all'Assemblea regionale siciliana.

TEXT:
Il record lo raggiunge Luigi Genovese, studente universitario di 21 anni, e ora il piÃ¹ giovane deputato eletto all'Assemblea regionale siciliana. Diciassettemila preferenze, anzi 17.359 nel feudo di papÃ  in provincia di Messina. Il papÃ  Ã¨ Francantonio, l'ex deputato del Pd condannato a 11 anni di carcere in primo grado, per truffa e frode fiscale, e passato in Forza Italia. Pesano, eccome, i cosiddetti "impresentabili" nel voto siciliano che ha portato all'elezione di Nello Musumeci. A Palermo Ã¨ stata eletta Marianna Caronia, che accolse Berlusconi al Politeama con uno striscione di benvenuto di almeno cinque metri, coinvolta nell'inchiesta sugli appalti del servizio marittimo, il famoso "sistema Trapani" che ha potato in carcere l'ex sindaco: 6370 preferenze. Sempre a Palermo Ã¨ stato eletto con 6554 preferenze Riccardo Savona, giÃ  deputato regionale con la destra nel 2012, poi passato con Crocetta e ora tornato in Forza Italia. Non Ã¨ indagato ma la rottura (con Crocetta) si consumÃ² nel corso del congresso dei Riformisti, quando l'ex governatore, vedendolo seduto in prima fila disse, citando Pio La Torre: "Qui qualcuno deve uscire dalla sala". Il riferimento era a un'intercettazione di Savona con il re dell'eolico Vito Nicastri, secondo le indagini della Dia spregiudicato manager a servizio di Matteo Messina Denaro, ultimo grande latitante di Cosa Nostra.

Per poco invece non Ã¨ stato eletto Riccardo Pellegrino, uno dei nomi piÃ¹ chiacchierati di questa campagna elettorale, arrivato secondo a Catania nella lista di Forza Italia. Fratello di Gaetano, imputato per mafia, consigliere comunale nella sua cittÃ , ha raccolto 4427 preferenze. Complessivamente Forza Italia ha eletto dodici deputati regionali, la lista di Musumeci DiventerÃ  Bellissima quattro, la lista Fdi-Lega tre, i Popolari e autonomisti di Saverio Romano cinque.

Altro escluso Antonello Rizza, sindaco di Priolo parecchi capi di imputazione, arrestato con l'accusa di truffa e turbativa d'asta, nonostante le sue 4929 preferenze. A Trapani non ce l'ha fatta Giovanni Lo Sciuto, tornato da poco in Forza Italia dal partito di Angelino Alfano. Lo Sciuto non ha indagini in corso ma Ã¨ finito piÃ¹ volte tra le polemiche per i suoi vecchi rapporti di conoscenza con Matteo Messina Denaro. Il giornalista Sandro Ruotolo, in una sua inchiesta, mostrÃ² una fotografia in cui i due vengono immortalati assieme al matrimonio della cugina del superlatitante. "All'epoca dei fatti, la famiglia Messina Denaro non aveva, per quelle che erano le mie conoscenze di ragazzino, problemi con la giustizia e, non avendo io il dono della chiaroveggenza, non potevo prevedere quello che sarebbe successo", ha precisato Lo Sciuto. Facendo una somma, solo per le liste di Forza Italia: 39.639 le preferenze dei nomi piÃ¹ chiacchierati.

Sempre a sostegno di Musumeci, nella lista dell'Udc, viene eletto a Messina Cateno De Luca con 5418, vulcanico ex deputato regionale, per il quale la procura ha chiesto una condanna a 5 anni: Ã¨ accusato di aver favorito le imprese della sua famiglia quando era sindaco del piccolo comune di Fiumedinisi. L'inchiesta Ã¨ nota come il "Sacco di Fiumedinisi". Sono invece rimasti fuori a Siracusa Giovan Battista Coltraro (2752), giÃ  sostenitore di Crocetta, per falso in atto pubblico e Giuseppe Sorbello, detto Pippo (1949), democristiano da piÃ¹ lustri, grande tessitore di relazioni, incappato cinque anni fa in un'inchiesta per voto di scambio con il clan Nardo di Lentini. Ad Agrigento non viene eletto, sempre nell'Udc, Gaetano Cani, nonostante i 4220 voti. Ãˆ rinviato a giudizio per estorsione, perchÃ© avrebbe fatto firmare ai docenti di un istituto paritario le dimissioni in bianco. Facendo la somma, sono 14339 i voti raccolti dagli "impresentabili" del partito di Lorenzo Cesa.

Tra i Popolari e autonomisti, la lista ispirata da Saverio Romano sono eletti nomi pesanti dei tempi di TotÃ² Cuffaro. A partire da Toto Cordaro, storico avvocato di Vasa vasa nel processo per concorso esterno: 8170 voti a Palermo. Stessa cifra Roberto Lagalla, ex rettore dell'UniversitÃ  di Palermo e soprattutto ex assessore alla SanitÃ  dell'ultimo governo Cuffaro. E, direbbe TotÃ², "ho detto tutto". Nessuno dei due Ã¨ coinvolto in processi, entrambi legati a un passato politicamente ingombrante. A Palermo non Ã¨ invece riuscito a farsi eleggere Roberto Clemente nonostante i 5520 voti. Al suo attivo una condanna, in primo grado, per corruzione elettorale. Altro escluso Roberto Corona, a Messina (2218), condannato in primo grado a 3 anni, per via di alcune fideiussioni facili quando presiedeva Confcommercio con relativa confisca di 650mila euro di beni. Sempre tra i non eletti, a Trapani perÃ², c'Ã¨ il nome di Santino Catalano (2210 voti), che patteggiÃ² un anno e 11 mesi per abuso edilizio. Complessivamente, 26.288 voti comprendendo l'avvocato di Cuffaro e il suo assessore alla SanitÃ , non indagati.

Risulta eletto, nelle liste di Musumeci, Giuseppe Zitelli con 6221, condannato a risarcire 3000 euro oltre le spese legali e di giustizia dalla Corte dei conti, nell'ambito di una Rimborsopoli nella provincia di Catania. Tra i non eletti invece Pietro D'AÃ¬, con la lista di Musumeci DiventerÃ  Bellissima: Ã¨ stato scagionato da ogni accusa per mafia, col Gip che ha rivelato solo una gestione della cosa pubblica in taluni casi "francamente illecita". Per lui solo 1708 voti. Restano fuori anche Ernesto Calogero (1699), condannato in primo grado a 4 anni per compravendita di diplomi

Complessivamente, il peso dei voti legati ai personaggi piÃ¹ chiacchierati, stando ai piÃ¹ noti, raggiunge nel centrodestra quota 89903, piÃ¹ di un decimo del totale dei voti di Musumeci (830mila).

Anche a sinistra ci sono parecchi chiacchierati, trasformisti e riciclati vari. Luca Sammartino e Michele Catanzaro, due enfant prodige della covata di Cuffaro nell'Udc, sono eletti col Pd rispettivamente con 32.492 e 6.409 voti. Eletto a Ragusa anche Emanuele Dipasquale, detto Nello (5972). Le cronache di qualche tempo ricordano di quando era un berlusconiano di ferro e urlava "il Pd fa schifo", "Ã¨ pieno di pagliacci". Ma questa Ã¨ un'altra storia. Ed ha a che fare col partito della Nazione di Renzi.
TITLE: Il peso degli impresentabili sulla vittoria di Nello Musumeci in Sicilia

Peter Dutton has been called a "terrorist" by the Greens.
Immigration Minister Peter Dutton has shrugged off comments by Greens MP Adam Bandt after he accused the senior Liberal of being a "terrorist" over his handling of the Manus Island detention centre crisis.
If terrorism is using violence to threaten lives for political purposes, then yes, Peter Dutton is a terrorist.
Prime Minister Malcolm Turnbull will discuss the issue on Sunday with newly-elected New Zealand Prime Minister Jacinda Ardern, who is in Sydney for a whirlwind visit.
Labor Senator Doug Cameron said Prime Minister Malcolm Turnbull had failed on the long-running issue.
TEXT:
Peter Dutton has been called a "terrorist" by the Greens.

Immigration Minister Peter Dutton has shrugged off comments by Greens MP Adam Bandt after he accused the senior Liberal of being a "terrorist" over his handling of the Manus Island detention centre crisis.

Bandt told a rally in Melbourne on Saturday that Dutton was prepared to kill for political gain, likening him to a "terrorist" for "threatening people's lives".

He also said Australia was "being shamed in the eyes of the world" for its treatment of the remaining 600 Manus Island asylum seekers, who are said to be without water, power and food after the shutdown of the PNG facility.

If terrorism is using violence to threaten lives for political purposes, then yes, Peter Dutton is a terrorist. https://t.co/xLBgSlKE1H â€” Adam Bandt ğŸ³ï¸â€ğŸŒˆ (@AdamBandt) November 4, 2017

Dutton brushed off the criticism, saying the federal government stood by its record on preventing asylum seekers dying at sea.

"I think that says more about Mr Bandt and the Greens than it does about me. The Australian Government has stopped deaths at sea. We've got every child out of detention," he said, according to the ABC.

"Mr Bandt, when he was in Government with [former Prime Minister] Julia Gillard, presided over 50,000 people coming on 800 boats and 1,200 people drowned at sea."

More than 1,000 people gathered at Melbourne's State Library on Saturday for the rally before an action at Federation Square backing the men who remain at the centre, despite its official closure this week.

In Sydney, hundreds rallied in the city's CBD against the treatment of the men.

Prime Minister Malcolm Turnbull will discuss the issue on Sunday with newly-elected New Zealand Prime Minister Jacinda Ardern, who is in Sydney for a whirlwind visit.

Ardern this week confirmed that the previous NZ government's offer to take 150 refugees from Australia's offshore detention centres still stands amid the ongoing stand-off on Manus.

Labor Senator Doug Cameron said Prime Minister Malcolm Turnbull had failed on the long-running issue.

"The Coalition could have easily done the Bali process, walked there with our neighbours about how we deal with this issue, (and) done international agreements to get people off the island," he told the ABC.

The UN has described the situation on Manus as an unfolding humanitarian crisis.
TITLE: Manus Island Crisis: Peter Dutton Hits Back After Greens Label Him A 'Terrorist'
