TEXT:
When Osama bin Laden wasnâ€™t planning terrorist attacks, such as 9/11, he was apparently watching YouTube videos like â€œCharlie Bit My Finger.â€

And that shocks Howard Davies-Carr, who filmed his son Charlie biting the finger of brother Harry in the now-legendary 2007 viral video.

Turns out â€œCharlie Bit My Fingerâ€ was one of the many videos that Navy SEALs found in bin Ladenâ€™s collection when they stormed his compound in Abbottabad, Pakistan, on May 2, 2011, according to a CIA press release issued Wednesday.

Davies-Carr filmed the 55-second video in May 2007 just to capture a moment in their lives, and he uploaded it only after reviewing it and finding it funny.

It struck a chord with many, ultimately receiving more than 854 million views.

But Davies-Carr told HuffPost exclusively that he had no idea one of the viewers might be the mastermind of one of the worst terrorist attacks on American soil.

â€œI donâ€™t know how to react,â€ Davies-Carr said when contacted by phone at his home in London. â€œItâ€™s hard to take in.

â€œYou never can tell who has a lighter side. Itâ€™s hard to imagine heâ€™s planning terrible things one minute and then laughing with his family over this the next.â€

Davies-Carr said his sons, 13-year-old Harry and 11-year-old Charlie, arenâ€™t surprised by it because theyâ€™re too young to know much about 9/11.

However, his wifeâ€™s first reaction was different than his own.

â€œShe wondered, â€˜Were they targets?â€™â€ he said.

â€œCharlie Bit My Fingerâ€ was, perhaps, the strangest film found in bin Ladenâ€™s video stash, which included old Tom & Jerry cartoons, feature films including â€œCarsâ€ and â€œResident Evil,â€ and a number of crochet tutorials, according to Gizmodo.

Davies-Carr says heâ€™s aware of many high-profile people whoâ€™ve seen â€œCharlie Bit My Fingerâ€ but admits bin Laden â€œis the most notorious.â€
TITLE: 'Charlie Bit My Finger' Dad Is Shocked His Video Was In Osama Bin Laden's Collection

In San Francisco steht ein Haus, das auf den ersten Blick wie ein gewÃ¶hnliches Reihenhaus aussieht

In der Chenery Street in San Francisco steht ein Haus, das auf den ersten Blick wie ein gewÃ¶hnliches Reihenhaus aussieht. Doch dieser Eindruck tÃ¤uscht - hinter der Fassade des Hauses versteckt sich mehr. Das Haupthaus erstreckt sich auf drei GebÃ¤udeeinheiten, die an die StraÃŸe angrenzen.

Wenn man es betritt, kÃ¶nnte man meinen, in einer Villa aus einem James Bond-Film zu sein.

Das Haupthaus sieht nÃ¤mlich aus wie ein eindrucksvoller Palast â€“ mit Glasdach und einem Swimmingpool im Speisesaal. Im HauptgebÃ¤ude sind Buntglasfenster der ehemaligen Kirche Little Sisters of the Poor verbaut.

Das Haus wurde im Jahr 1987 erbaut

Das Glasdach der Villa lÃ¤sst sich zudem zur Seite fahren, damit die Sonnenstrahlen auch ungefiltert in das Innere des Hauses fallen kÃ¶nnen. Im HauptgebÃ¤ude befinden sich fÃ¼nf Schlafzimmer und genauso viele BÃ¤der. Im Obergeschoss der Villa hat man einen atemberaubenden Blick auf die Skyline von San Francisco.

Die Villa wurde im Jahr 1987 fÃ¼r den Werbefachmann Robert Pritikin gebaut. Derzeit steht das Anwesen zum Verkauf. Wer es haben mÃ¶chte, muss aber tief in die Tasche greifen: Das Anwesen kostet elf Millionen Dollar, also umgerechnet knapp zehn Millionen Euro.

36,6 Prozent gaben an, dass sie sich deprimiert fÃ¼hlen, wenn sie das GefÃ¼hl haben, dass ihr Partner ihr Handy Ã¼ber sie stellt.
Diese 30 Minuten werden Ã¼ber die Zeit hinweg lÃ¤nger, denn es wirkt wie eine Pause, die die Paare sehr schÃ¤tzen.â€ â€• Christine Wilke3.
Wenn sich dein Partner â€œgephubbedâ€ fÃ¼hlt, erkenne es an und hÃ¶re auf damitâ€œIhr solltet ausmachen, dass ihr es euch gegenseitig sagt, wenn ihr euch â€œgephubbedâ€ fÃ¼hlt oder einen â€œphubbingâ€-RÃ¼ckfall habt.
Wir verlieren uns alle gerne mal in den Tiefen des Bildschirms, es kann also schnell passieren, dass wir es gar nicht bemerken, dass wir es schon wieder machen.

TEXT:
"Phubbing" heiÃŸt, dass wir jemanden wegen unseres Handys ignorieren

Viele von uns haben wahrscheinlich selbst schon mal "gephubbed"

Im Video seht ihr, welche anderen Anzeichen es fÃ¼r eine scheiternde Beziehung gibt

Ein Date kann fast schon nicht mehr deprimierender werden als dieses: Eine Klientin der Eheberaterin Christine Wilke war so sehr in ihr Handy vertieft, dass sie nicht mal bemerkt hatte, dass das Date vorbei war.

â€œSie hatte ein ernsthaftes Problem mit ihrem Smartphone und hat es nach diesem Essen mit ihrem Freund bemerktâ€, sagt die Therapeutin aus Pennsylvania.

â€œMeine Klientin war in ihrem Bildschirm versunken und als sie aufsah, hatte ihr Partner schon lÃ¤ngst bezahlt und wartete an der TÃ¼r auf sie.â€

Diese Frau hat ganz extremes â€œphubbingâ€ betrieben - ihren Partner ignoriert und nur ihrem Handy die Aufmerksamkeit geschenkt.

Das Wort â€œphubbingâ€ setzt sich aus den englischen WÃ¶rtern â€œphoneâ€, also Handy, und â€œsnubbingâ€, jemanden oder etwas ignorieren, zusammen.

Und dieses Verhalten scheint sich immer mehr zu verbreiten und sich in unser Leben einzuschleichen - vor allem in Beziehungen.

Wenn der Partner eine AffÃ¤re mit dem Handy hat

In einer neuen Studie der Baylor UniversitÃ¤t wurden 143 Paare gefragt, wie oft ihre Interaktionen mit ihrem Partner durch ihr Handy unterbrochen wurde.

70 Prozent gaben â€œmanchmalâ€, â€œoftâ€, â€œsehr oftâ€ oder â€œstÃ¤ndigâ€ an.

In einer weiterfÃ¼hrenden Umfrage mit 145 Menschen gaben 22,6 Prozent an, dass â€œphubbingâ€ in ihrer Beziehung zu Streit gefÃ¼hrt habe. 36,6 Prozent gaben an, dass sie sich deprimiert fÃ¼hlen, wenn sie das GefÃ¼hl haben, dass ihr Partner ihr Handy Ã¼ber sie stellt.

Wilkes bekommt dieses frustrierende Schauspiel die ganze Zeit in ihrer Praxis zu sehen. â€œDie Paare, die zu mir kommen, haben ein starkes Verlangen, eine starke Verbindung zueinander aufzubauen oder sie zu vertiefen - aber ihre Handys haben ihr Leben Ã¼bernommenâ€, erklÃ¤rt die Therapeutin.

â€œOft erzÃ¤hlen sie mir dann, dass es sich anfÃ¼hlt, als hÃ¤tte ihr Partner eine AffÃ¤re mit dem Smartphone.â€ Eine Beziehung vor einem Bildschirm zu fÃ¼hren, ist zweifellos keine Art und Weise zu leben.

Wilkes und andere Eheberater und Therapeuten geben deshalb ihre besten RatschlÃ¤ge, wie ihr eurer â€œphubbingâ€ in den Griff bekommen kÃ¶nnt:

1. HÃ¶rt auf zu denken, dass ihr euer komplettes Date auf Snapchat und Instagram teilen mÃ¼sst

â€œEine Sache fasziniert mich immer wieder (als Therapeut macht sie mich allerdings eher traurig): Ein Paar geht zusammen aus, aber eine Person ist stÃ¤ndig damit beschÃ¤ftigt, Bilder zu teilen, anstatt dem anderen Aufmerksamkeit zu schenken.

Social Media hat viele Vorteile, aber es kann auch dazu fÃ¼hren, dass die Menschen sofortige BestÃ¤tigung suchen, anstatt einfach mit dem Moment zufrieden zu sein, in dem sie sich gerade befinden.

â¨ Mehr zum Thema: Liebe Konzertfans, packt endlich eure verdammten Smartphones weg!

Wenn du auch einer der ÃœbeltÃ¤ter von â€œSchau mich an!â€-Postings bist, anstatt die gemeinsame Zeit mit deinem Partner zu genieÃŸen, solltest du dich bemÃ¼hen, Disziplin zu lernen.

HÃ¶r auf, so besessen von Likes zu sein. Das heiÃŸt natÃ¼rlich nicht, dass du kein sÃ¼ÃŸes Selfie von euch posten kannst.

Aber halte dich einfach mit dem Posten zurÃ¼ck, bis das Date vorbei ist - oder, wenn es sein muss, warte, bis dein Partner auf die Toilette verschwindet. â€• Carin Goldstein, Eheberaterin und Familientherapeutin aus Sherman Oaks, Kalifornien

2. Lass dein Handy mal fÃ¼r 30 Minuten am Tag liegen

â€œEine der Aufgaben, die ich meinen Paaren mitgebe, ist eine 30-minÃ¼tige â€œElektronik-freie-Zoneâ€ zu schaffen - jeden Tag.

â¨ Mehr zum Thema: Digitalisierung - Fluch und Segen zugleich

In dieser Zeit kÃ¶nnen sie wertvolle gemeinsame Zeit verbringen, ohne gestÃ¶rt oder abgelenkt zu werden. Diese 30 Minuten werden Ã¼ber die Zeit hinweg lÃ¤nger, denn es wirkt wie eine Pause, die die Paare sehr schÃ¤tzen.â€ â€• Christine Wilke

3. Bring dein technisches Time Out aufs nÃ¤chste Level: Handy-Freier Wochenend-Trip

â€œIch arbeitete mit einem PÃ¤rchen, das Ã¼ber ein Wochenende nach Palm Springs vereisen wollte. Gemeinsam haben wir ein paar Regeln erstellt, was die Elektronik betrifft: Die Handys mÃ¼ssen das ganze Wochenende aus bleiben und in ihren Koffern bleiben.

Jeder darf sein Handy einmal am Tag fÃ¼r fÃ¼nf Minuten an machen - das ist genug Zeit um kurz seine Nachrichten zu checken und sicher zu gehen, dass einen zu Hause kein Weltuntergang erwartet.

Als das Wochenende vorbei war, schwÃ¤rmten sie davon, wie viel mehr sie die kleinen Dinge schÃ¤tzen gelernt haben, der erfrischende Pool, gemeinsam lachen und tiefe, verbundene IntimitÃ¤t.â€ â€• Spencer Scott, Psychologe aus Santa Monica, California



4. Wenn sich dein Partner â€œgephubbedâ€ fÃ¼hlt, erkenne es an und hÃ¶re auf damit

â€œIhr solltet ausmachen, dass ihr es euch gegenseitig sagt, wenn ihr euch â€œgephubbedâ€ fÃ¼hlt oder einen â€œphubbingâ€-RÃ¼ckfall habt.

Wir verlieren uns alle gerne mal in den Tiefen des Bildschirms, es kann also schnell passieren, dass wir es gar nicht bemerken, dass wir es schon wieder machen.

Es ist wichtig seinem Partner zuzuhÃ¶ren und sein Smartphone zur Seite zu legen, wenn der andere das GefÃ¼hlt hat, dass du â€œphubbstâ€ - das ist ein wichtiger Schritt in die richtige Richtung fÃ¼r eine gesunde Beziehung.â€ â€• Kristin Zeising, Psychologin aus San Diego, Kalifornien



5. Dein Smartphone ist nicht dein Gegner

â€œDas mag gegen die eigene Intuition sein, aber wenn du das Verlangen nach Zeit und Aufmerksamkeit hast, versuche nicht zu denken, dass dein Handy das Problem ist - sondern sieh es als einen Teil der LÃ¶sung an.

â¨ Mehr zum Thema: Dieses lustige Video macht auf die Gefahren von Smartphones aufmerksam - und es hat eine wichtige Botschaft

FÃ¼rsorgliche Nachrichten Ã¼ber den Tag verteilt, oder Snapchats, die nur zwei Sekunden dauern, kÃ¶nnen eine schÃ¶ne Erinnerung daran sein, dass du und dein Partner Ã¼ber den Tag hinweg aneinander denkt. Es hilft vielleicht auch, sich so weniger isoliert und gereizt zu fÃ¼hlen.â€ â€• Spencer Scott

6. Mach dir klar, dass es nicht so einfach sein wird, dein Handy wegzulegen

â€œEs ist ein Suchtverhalten - es ist nicht so einfach, damit aufzuhÃ¶ren. Mach dir klar, dass es Zeit brauchen wird, es zu schaffen - aber du schaffst das! Am Anfang wirst du noch eine sogenannte kognitive Dissonanz spÃ¼ren.

Deine Gewohnheit, wie du dein Handy benutzt, zu unterbrechen wird sich falsch fÃ¼r dich anfÃ¼hlen.

Es wird ungefÃ¤hr einen Monat dauern, bis sich die neue Gewohnheit - deinen Liebsten, Freunden und Familie Aufmerksamkeit in Person zu geben und nicht Ã¼ber dein Handy - natÃ¼rlich anfÃ¼hlt.

Aber vertrau mir: das wird es wert sein.â€ â€• Barbara Melton, Beraterin aus Charleston, South Carolina

Dieser Artikel erschien ursprÃ¼nglich in der HuffPost US und wurde von Martina Zink aus dem Englischen Ã¼bersetzt und bearbeitet.

(ame)

SUMMARY:
ADVERTISEMENTNEW DELHI -- The all-powerful GST Council may consider lowering tax rates on a host of goods such as handmade furniture, plastic products and daily use items like shampoo, and simplify return filing rules in its meeting this week.
The council, headed by Finance Minister Arun Jaitley, is scheduled to meet on November 10 to consider lowering of the 28% GST rate on certain common use items, government officials said.
The council has been meeting every month since the Goods and Services Tax (GST) regime, which amalgamated over a dozen central and state taxes, was introduced on July 1.
Also tax rate on items like furniture, electric switches, plastic pipes could be relooked," an official said.
The GST Council, which comprises of representatives of all states, have already rationalised tax rates for over 100 items.
TEXT:
ADVERTISEMENT

NEW DELHI -- The all-powerful GST Council may consider lowering tax rates on a host of goods such as handmade furniture, plastic products and daily use items like shampoo, and simplify return filing rules in its meeting this week.

The council, headed by Finance Minister Arun Jaitley, is scheduled to meet on November 10 to consider lowering of the 28% GST rate on certain common use items, government officials said.

In further relief to small and medium enterprises, the panel is likely to rationalise tax rate in sectors where the total incidence of taxation has gone up because the goods were earlier either exempt from excise or was attracted lower VAT rates in the previous indirect tax regime.

The council has been meeting every month since the Goods and Services Tax (GST) regime, which amalgamated over a dozen central and state taxes, was introduced on July 1.

The meetings have resulted in an array of changes to ease compliance burden on businesses as well as provided relief to consumers.

"A rationalisation of items in the 28% tax bracket is expected. Most of the daily use items could be lowered to 18%. Also tax rate on items like furniture, electric switches, plastic pipes could be relooked," an official said.

All types of furniture attract a 28% tax under GST. Wooden furniture is handmade by unorganised sector artisans and is mostly used by middle class families and there have been demands for lowering tax incidence on them.

Also, some items of plastic attract 18% GST but goods like shower baths, sinks, wash basins, bidets, lavatory pans, seats and covers, flushing cisterns and similar sanitary ware of plastics attract 28% levy.

There is a need for rationalisation of tax rates on these items, officials said. The plastic manufacturers in their representation to the revenue department had said that 80% of the industry is in MSME category.

Besides, the GST rate on weighing machines, compressors may also be rationalised to 18% from 28%.

Officials said 90% of the manufacturers are from small and medium industries who in the pre-GST era were exempt from excise duty on manufactured value of less than Rs 1.5 crore.

Hence, such machines only attracted VAT of 14.5%. With regard to compressors, the total pre-GST incidence was 17.5% (12.5% excise duty and 5% VAT), they said stressing on need to rationalise the tax incidence.

The GST Council, which comprises of representatives of all states, have already rationalised tax rates for over 100 items. The Council has last month approved an Approach Paper to be followed by the fitment committee while deciding on future rate revisions.

Under GST various goods and services have been bracketed in 5, 12, 18 and 28%. GST has subsumed over a dozen taxes, including excise, service tax and VAT, and transformed India into a single market.
TITLE: GST Council May Consider Lowering Tax Rates On Common Goods Like Plastic Products And Shampoo

SUMMARY:
For the past year, I have struggled to stomach the presence of Johnny Depp.
Heard then donated her entire Â£7million settlement to charity, giving half to an organisation that works to prevent domestic violence.
While still unacceptable, incidents that result in your estranged wife requesting a temporary restraining order are not the same as the alleged harassment of over 50 women (Weinstein has denied all claims of nonconsensual sex).
Maybe the video would be remembered for longer and the womanâ€™s words taken more seriously than Heardâ€™s ever were.
But in this post-Weinstein Hollywood, Iâ€™m finding the celebration of Depp increasingly more difficult to bear.
TEXT:
For the past year, I have struggled to stomach the presence of Johnny Depp.

This started with his split from Amber Heard. When they settled their divorce outside of court, many aspects of the coupleâ€™s parting remained private, but a number of others did not. The video of him, drinking and appearing to throw a bottle in his kitchen is on the internet, as is a photograph of a mirror, stained with the name of a man Depp thought his wife was having an affair with. Heard said that the words on it are written in paint and blood, which had leaked from Deppâ€™s hand shortly after he accidentally chopped off a chunk of his finger off (Depp claimed he injured the finger during a filming). In a joint statement, the couple labelled their marriage â€œat times volatile, but always bound by loveâ€. Heard then donated her entire Â£7million settlement to charity, giving half to an organisation that works to prevent domestic violence.

The months I spent covering this - writing news stories, a piece on the mediaâ€™s portrayal of Heard and another on the settlement money - left me with a dislike for Depp, but one that I could put aside when necessary (mainly when I wanted to watch Sweeney Todd or Edward Scissorhands again).

I rolled my eyes when he was announced as the special guest for Glastonburyâ€™s all-new Cinemageddon area and skipped â€˜Fantastic Beasts And Where To Find Themâ€™ when his role in it was revealed, but knew that others still held highly favourable opinions of him and respected their decisions.

Then on Thursday, I watched as fans clamoured for a glimpse of the star at the Murder On The Orient Express premiere, shouting his name and cheering him on. When Depp appeared on the big screen, the people inside the Royal Albert Hall whooped and clapped and suddenly, the indifference Iâ€™d just about managed to just muster up before was gone. Things are different now.

For the past month, the entertainment industry has played host to an unprecedented amount of sexual harassment and abuse allegations, beginning with those against Harvey Weinstein. Itâ€™s being described as a â€œwatershed momentâ€ for improving the treatment of women in the industry and time will hopefully confirm that this is the case.

But the revelations that have been made in the last month could also have a ripple effect that we did not initially expect. (Itâ€™s hard to know what to call it all, but I refuse to say â€œscandalâ€ or â€œcontroversyâ€ and hasten to label the accounts â€œincidentsâ€)

For me, it appears that I can no longer find excuses to separate a manâ€™s reported actions from his â€œartâ€. Itâ€™s too much of an ask when my average working day now includes hours of reading and writing about crimes powerful men in Hollywood have allegedly committed against women (and in some cases, other men).

Let me be clear: Depp and Weinstein are miles apart. The two are not linked and this is not a comparison of their alleged actions. While still unacceptable, incidents that result in your estranged wife requesting a temporary restraining order are not the same as the alleged harassment of over 50 women (Weinstein has denied all claims of nonconsensual sex). But as we deal with the fallout from the latter, Iâ€™m finding it harder and harder to look past the former.

Depp isnâ€™t just â€˜getting byâ€™ in the industry. The quality of his movies may have flatlined but when it comes to earnings, heâ€™s going from strength to strength. â€˜Pirates Of The Caribbeanâ€™ continues to be one of Disneyâ€™s most financially successful franchises and Depp will also take the lead in the forthcoming â€˜Fantastic Beasts And Where To Find Themâ€™ films. He occasionally performs with his band, Hollywood Vampires, and fronts a Christian Dior fragrance campaign.

Only time will tell on this, but I wonder what would happen if an actor went through a similar split now, or in a few months time. Would we question them more? Perhaps the actorâ€™s famous friends would hesitate before publicly defending him so fervently. Maybe the video would be remembered for longer and the womanâ€™s words taken more seriously than Heardâ€™s ever were.

The line in the sand has been drawn though, decreeing that Weinstein - who takes the role of a beached whale in this analogy - be left to wilt on the shore as Captain Jack Sparrow sails past untroubled. Iâ€™m not saying Depp should face the same consequences as the ones the producer is and, given that his divorce played out pre-Weinstein, itâ€™s unlikely heâ€™ll face anything other than continued adulation from legions of fans in the years to come. But in this post-Weinstein Hollywood, Iâ€™m finding the celebration of Depp increasingly more difficult to bear.
TITLE: In Post-Weinstein Hollywood, The Celebration Of Johnny Depp Is Increasingly Hard To Bear

President Donald Trump responded to the deadliest mass shooting in Texas history by saying the attack was a result of â€œa mental health problemâ€ and not due to lax gun control laws.
â€œThis is a mental health problem at the highest level.
â€” Jim Acosta (@Acosta) November 6, 2017Trump on Texas shooting and gun control: "It's a little bit soon to go into it."
(He said this after Vegas shooting too) â€” Jim Acosta (@Acosta) November 6, 2017.
Focuses on mental health.
TEXT:
President Donald Trump responded to the deadliest mass shooting in Texas history by saying the attack was a result of â€œa mental health problemâ€ and not due to lax gun control laws.

During a news conference Monday in Tokyo, Trump said it was â€œa little bit soonâ€ to get into a discussion about gun control.

â€œThis isnâ€™t a guns situation,â€ Trump said, noting that a person in the crowd with a gun shot at the attacker and caused him to flee. â€œThis is a mental health problem at the highest level. Itâ€™s a very, very sad event.â€

The president woke on Monday morning in Japan to the news that a lone gunman had opened fire on churchgoers at a small Baptist church in rural Texas and killed at least 26 people and injured another 20. The dead and wounded range in age from 5 to 72 years old.

While answering questions in Tokyo, the president referred to the gunman, who multiple reports identified as 26-year-old Devin Patrick Kelley, as a â€œvery deranged individual.â€

BREAKING: Trump calls Texas church shooting a 'mental health problem at the highest level,' says gunman 'deranged' â€” The Associated Press (@AP) November 6, 2017

Trump on Texas shooting and gun control: "I think mental health is your problem here." â€” Jim Acosta (@Acosta) November 6, 2017

Trump on Texas shooting and gun control: "It's a little bit soon to go into it." (He said this after Vegas shooting too) â€” Jim Acosta (@Acosta) November 6, 2017

.@POTUS, at joint news conference, brings up the Texas church shooting. Asks: who would ever think a thing like that could happen? â€” Hallie Jackson (@HallieJackson) November 6, 2017

NEW / POTUS on TX shooting: â€œthis isnâ€™t a guns situation. We could go into itâ€ but itâ€™s a little soon, he says. Focuses on mental health. â€” Hallie Jackson (@HallieJackson) November 6, 2017

The accused gunman was a former member of the U.S. Air Force from 2010 until his discharge in 2014. He was court-martialed in 2012 for assault on his spouse and their child, according to a USAF spokesperson.

Earlier on Monday, Trump tweeted his prayers to the people of Sutherland Springs, Texas, before giving an official statement on the shooting at a meeting with U.S. and Japanese business leaders in Tokyo.

May God be w/ the people of Sutherland Springs, Texas. The FBI & law enforcement are on the scene. I am monitoring the situation from Japan. â€” Donald J. Trump (@realDonaldTrump) November 5, 2017
TITLE: Trump Says Deadly Texas Shooting Isn't A Guns Issue, It's A Mental Health Problem

SUMMARY:
Modi presents the Prince of Bhutan with an official football from the FIFA U-17 World Cup.
ADVERTISEMENTKing Jigme Khesar Namgyel Wangchuck and Queen Jetsun Pema Wangchuck are on an official trip to India.
The Crown Prince of Bhutan, Jigme Namgyel Wangchuck, won hearts all around with his cuteness.
And Swaraj wasn't immune to his charm either.
EAM @SushmaSwaraj receives Their Majesties, The King, The Queen and The Gyalsey (Prince) of Bhutan pic.twitter.com/D9rrB2ClFH â€” Raveesh Kumar (@MEAIndia) October 31, 2017Slay, little prince.
TEXT:
Modi presents the Prince of Bhutan with an official football from the FIFA U-17 World Cup.

ADVERTISEMENT

King Jigme Khesar Namgyel Wangchuck and Queen Jetsun Pema Wangchuck are on an official trip to India. Right from the airport, where External Affairs Minister Sushma Swaraj received them, to other official engagements, the star of the moment wasn't the royal couple.

The Crown Prince of Bhutan, Jigme Namgyel Wangchuck, won hearts all around with his cuteness. Born in February, 2016, the little prince was presented with an official football from the FIFA U-17 World Cup and a chess set by Prime Minister Narendra Modi.

As his smiling parents kept an eye on the pint-sized crown prince, he charmed the PM, bowing prettily and eagerly reaching out for the ball.

And Swaraj wasn't immune to his charm either.

Special gesture for a valued friend. EAM @SushmaSwaraj receives Their Majesties, The King, The Queen and The Gyalsey (Prince) of Bhutan pic.twitter.com/D9rrB2ClFH â€” Raveesh Kumar (@MEAIndia) October 31, 2017

Slay, little prince.
TITLE: PHOTOS: India Can't Get Enough Of Bhutan's Incredibly Cute, 2-Year-Old Crown Prince

SUMMARY:
ADVERTISEMENTNEW DELHI -- Revenue Secretary Hasmukh Adhia has been designated as the new Finance Secretary, an official order said today.
Adhia is a 1981 batch IAS officer of Gujarat cadre.
The Appointments Committee of the Cabinet has approved designating Adhia as the Finance Secretary, the order issued by the Department of Personnel and Training said.
As per the convention, the senior most Secretary in the Finance Ministry is designated as the Finance Secretary.
There are five departments under the Finance Ministry-- Expenditure, Economic Affairs, Financial Services, Revenue and Department of Investment and Public Asset management (DIPAM).
TEXT:
ADVERTISEMENT

NEW DELHI -- Revenue Secretary Hasmukh Adhia has been designated as the new Finance Secretary, an official order said today.

Adhia is a 1981 batch IAS officer of Gujarat cadre.

The vacancy was caused following the superannuation of Ashok Lavasa last month.

The Appointments Committee of the Cabinet has approved designating Adhia as the Finance Secretary, the order issued by the Department of Personnel and Training said.

As per the convention, the senior most Secretary in the Finance Ministry is designated as the Finance Secretary.

There are five departments under the Finance Ministry-- Expenditure, Economic Affairs, Financial Services, Revenue and Department of Investment and Public Asset management (DIPAM).

IAS officer Rajiv Kumar of 1984 batch is the Financial Services Secretary. Ajay Narayan Jha is Expenditure Secretary and Neeraj Kumar Gupta Secretary, DIPAM. Both are 1982 batch IAS officers.
TITLE: Hasmukh Adhia, The Man Behind Demonetisation, Made Finance Secretary

La intÃ©rprete de 27 aÃ±os escribe para denunciar que Ed Westwick, famoso por interpretar a Chuck Bass en Gossip Girl, la violÃ³ en 2014. Este martes el actor ha negado a travÃ©s de sus redes sociales haber cometido ese acto.

"Me despertÃ© de pronto con Ed sobre mÃ­, con sus dedos entrando en mi cuerpo. Le dije que parara, pero era fuerte. LuchÃ© lo mÃ¡s fuerte que pude pero agarrÃ³ mi cara con sus manos, me zarandeÃ³ y me dijo que querÃ­a follarme. Estaba paralizada, aterrorizada. No pude hablar, no podÃ­a moverme. Ã‰l me agarrÃ³ y me violÃ³", escribe.

SegÃºn cuenta, el episodio ocurriÃ³ en casa de Westwick, a la que fue acompaÃ±ada de un productor. AllÃ­, el actor propuso que podÃ­an "follar todos", a lo que ella respondiÃ³ diciendo que querÃ­a marcharse. "Pero el productor no querÃ­a que Ed se sintiese incÃ³modo al irnos. Ed insistiÃ³ en que nos quedÃ¡semos para cenar. Dije que estaba cansada y que querÃ­a irme, intentando evitar una situaciÃ³n incÃ³moda. Ed me sugiriÃ³ que echase una cabezada en la habitaciÃ³n de invitados. El productor dijo que deberÃ­amos quedarnos 20 minutos mÃ¡s y limar asperezas y luego nos irÃ­amos", escribe.

En ese momento se fue a la habitaciÃ³n a tumbarse y al final se quedÃ³ dormida. Fue al despertarse de forma repentina cuando se encontrÃ³ a Ed encima. "Fue como una pesadilla y los dÃ­as siguientes no fueron mejor".

"El productor me echÃ³ la culpa y me dijo que habÃ­a sido participante activa", continÃºa la actriz. "Me dijo que no podÃ­a ir diciendo por ahÃ­ que Ed me habÃ­a violado y que no querÃ­a ser 'esa chica'. Y durante mucho tiempo le creÃ­. No querÃ­a ser 'esa chica".

TEXT:
Une Ã©valuation de divers appareils Ã©lectroniques publiÃ©e mardi par le magazine ProtÃ©gez-Vous ne conclut pas Ã  une domination gÃ©nÃ©rale de marques en particulier mais signale que selon les appareils, certaines offrent de meilleurs produits que d'autres.

Le palmarÃ¨s a Ã©tÃ© dressÃ© grÃ¢ce Ã  un sondage de satisfaction menÃ© auprÃ¨s de plus de 2500 consommateurs qui ont achetÃ© des appareils au cours des cinq derniÃ¨res annÃ©es et aux tests effectuÃ©s en laboratoire dans les trois derniÃ¨res annÃ©es.

SUMMARY:
Once upon a time, Princess Charlotte could have been bumped down to fifth-in-line to the throne if the third royal baby was a boy.
Princess Charlotte in Berlin during the royal tour of Poland and Germany in July 2017.
The act then became official in March 2015, just two months before Princess Charlotte was born, securing her place as fourth-in-line to the throne.
Earlier on HuffPost:Thanks to the new succession laws, Prince Charles is first-in-line to the throne, followed by Prince William, Prince George and Princess Charlotte.
(L-R) Queen Elizabeth II, Prince Philip, Duchess of Cambridge, Princess Charlotte, Prince George and Prince William, Duke of Cambridge looking out at the Trooping the Colour parade in June 2017.
TEXT:
Once upon a time, Princess Charlotte could have been bumped down to fifth-in-line to the throne if the third royal baby was a boy. However, she can now thank her great-grandmother, Queen Elizabeth II, for changing this (outdated) royal rule before her birth.

Under the Act of Settlement of 1701, all male siblings could skip ahead of their sisters in the line of succession, no matter their birth order, PopSugar reports. This is known as male primogeniture, and unfortunately meant the Queen's second child and only daughter, Princess Anne, was bumped from third-in-line to the throne to fifth after the birth of her siblings Prince Andrew and Prince Edward.

Princess Charlotte in Berlin during the royal tour of Poland and Germany in July 2017.

In 2013, Her Majesty decided to change this sexist system with the Succession of the Crown Act, which essentially replaced male primogeniture with absolute primogeniture. The act then became official in March 2015, just two months before Princess Charlotte was born, securing her place as fourth-in-line to the throne.

The new succession laws now apply to all royals born after Oct. 28, 2011. That year, 16 British Commonwealth countries â€” including Canada, Australia, New Zealand and the Bahamas â€” voted to make the changes. At that time, Britain's then-Prime Minister David Cameron said, "The idea that a younger son should become monarch instead of an elder daughter simply because he is a man ... this way of thinking is at odds with the modern countries that we have become."

Earlier on HuffPost:

Thanks to the new succession laws, Prince Charles is first-in-line to the throne, followed by Prince William, Prince George and Princess Charlotte. The third royal baby, regardless of gender, will then be fifth-in-line, followed by Prince Harry.

The royals have always had very particular rules regarding succession and titles. For example, another rule is that Prince George's future children will receive royal titles, but Princess Charlotte's won't.

(L-R) Queen Elizabeth II, Prince Philip, Duchess of Cambridge, Princess Charlotte, Prince George and Prince William, Duke of Cambridge looking out at the Trooping the Colour parade in June 2017.

Lucy Hume, associate director of expert etiquette company Debrett's, explained this to Town & Country saying, "Royal titles are inherited through sons, so if Princess Charlotte has children they would not automatically inherit the titles HRH, Prince, or Princess," she said.

However, Hume added that there can be exceptions: "The monarch may offer to bestow a royal title upon his or her daughter's children."
TITLE: Princess Charlotte Can Thank The Queen For Securing Her Succession To The Throne

TEXT:
Il record lo raggiunge Luigi Genovese, studente universitario di 21 anni, e ora il piÃ¹ giovane deputato eletto all'Assemblea regionale siciliana. Diciassettemila preferenze, anzi 17.359 nel feudo di papÃ  in provincia di Messina. Il papÃ  Ã¨ Francantonio, l'ex deputato del Pd condannato a 11 anni di carcere in primo grado, per truffa e frode fiscale, e passato in Forza Italia. Pesano, eccome, i cosiddetti "impresentabili" nel voto siciliano che ha portato all'elezione di Nello Musumeci. A Palermo Ã¨ stata eletta Marianna Caronia, che accolse Berlusconi al Politeama con uno striscione di benvenuto di almeno cinque metri, coinvolta nell'inchiesta sugli appalti del servizio marittimo, il famoso "sistema Trapani" che ha potato in carcere l'ex sindaco: 6370 preferenze. Sempre a Palermo Ã¨ stato eletto con 6554 preferenze Riccardo Savona, giÃ  deputato regionale con la destra nel 2012, poi passato con Crocetta e ora tornato in Forza Italia. Non Ã¨ indagato ma la rottura (con Crocetta) si consumÃ² nel corso del congresso dei Riformisti, quando l'ex governatore, vedendolo seduto in prima fila disse, citando Pio La Torre: "Qui qualcuno deve uscire dalla sala". Il riferimento era a un'intercettazione di Savona con il re dell'eolico Vito Nicastri, secondo le indagini della Dia spregiudicato manager a servizio di Matteo Messina Denaro, ultimo grande latitante di Cosa Nostra.

Per poco invece non Ã¨ stato eletto Riccardo Pellegrino, uno dei nomi piÃ¹ chiacchierati di questa campagna elettorale, arrivato secondo a Catania nella lista di Forza Italia. Fratello di Gaetano, imputato per mafia, consigliere comunale nella sua cittÃ , ha raccolto 4427 preferenze. Complessivamente Forza Italia ha eletto dodici deputati regionali, la lista di Musumeci DiventerÃ  Bellissima quattro, la lista Fdi-Lega tre, i Popolari e autonomisti di Saverio Romano cinque.

Altro escluso Antonello Rizza, sindaco di Priolo parecchi capi di imputazione, arrestato con l'accusa di truffa e turbativa d'asta, nonostante le sue 4929 preferenze. A Trapani non ce l'ha fatta Giovanni Lo Sciuto, tornato da poco in Forza Italia dal partito di Angelino Alfano. Lo Sciuto non ha indagini in corso ma Ã¨ finito piÃ¹ volte tra le polemiche per i suoi vecchi rapporti di conoscenza con Matteo Messina Denaro. Il giornalista Sandro Ruotolo, in una sua inchiesta, mostrÃ² una fotografia in cui i due vengono immortalati assieme al matrimonio della cugina del superlatitante. "All'epoca dei fatti, la famiglia Messina Denaro non aveva, per quelle che erano le mie conoscenze di ragazzino, problemi con la giustizia e, non avendo io il dono della chiaroveggenza, non potevo prevedere quello che sarebbe successo", ha precisato Lo Sciuto. Facendo una somma, solo per le liste di Forza Italia: 39.639 le preferenze dei nomi piÃ¹ chiacchierati.

Sempre a sostegno di Musumeci, nella lista dell'Udc, viene eletto a Messina Cateno De Luca con 5418, vulcanico ex deputato regionale, per il quale la procura ha chiesto una condanna a 5 anni: Ã¨ accusato di aver favorito le imprese della sua famiglia quando era sindaco del piccolo comune di Fiumedinisi. L'inchiesta Ã¨ nota come il "Sacco di Fiumedinisi". Sono invece rimasti fuori a Siracusa Giovan Battista Coltraro (2752), giÃ  sostenitore di Crocetta, per falso in atto pubblico e Giuseppe Sorbello, detto Pippo (1949), democristiano da piÃ¹ lustri, grande tessitore di relazioni, incappato cinque anni fa in un'inchiesta per voto di scambio con il clan Nardo di Lentini. Ad Agrigento non viene eletto, sempre nell'Udc, Gaetano Cani, nonostante i 4220 voti. Ãˆ rinviato a giudizio per estorsione, perchÃ© avrebbe fatto firmare ai docenti di un istituto paritario le dimissioni in bianco. Facendo la somma, sono 14339 i voti raccolti dagli "impresentabili" del partito di Lorenzo Cesa.

Tra i Popolari e autonomisti, la lista ispirata da Saverio Romano sono eletti nomi pesanti dei tempi di TotÃ² Cuffaro. A partire da TotÃ² Cordaro, storico avvocato di Vasa vasa nel processo per concorso esterno: 8170 voti a Palermo. Stessa cifra Roberto Lagalla, ex rettore dell'UniversitÃ  di Palermo e soprattutto ex assessore alla SanitÃ  dell'ultimo governo Cuffaro. E, direbbe TotÃ², "ho detto tutto". Nessuno dei due Ã¨ coinvolto in processi, entrambi legati a un passato politicamente ingombrante. A Palermo non Ã¨ invece riuscito a farsi eleggere Roberto Clemente nonostante i 5520 voti. Al suo attivo una condanna, in primo grado, per corruzione elettorale. Altro escluso Roberto Corona, a Messina (2218), condannato in primo grado a 3 anni, per via di alcune fideiussioni facili quando presiedeva Confcommercio con relativa confisca di 650mila euro di beni. Sempre tra i non eletti, a Trapani perÃ², c'Ã¨ il nome di Santino Catalano (2210 voti), che patteggiÃ² un anno e 11 mesi per abuso edilizio. Complessivamente, 26.288 voti comprendendo l'avvocato di Cuffaro e il suo assessore alla SanitÃ , non indagati.

Risulta eletto, nelle liste di Musumeci, Giuseppe Zitelli con 6221, condannato a risarcire 3000 euro oltre le spese legali e di giustizia dalla Corte dei conti, nell'ambito di una Rimborsopoli nella provincia di Catania. Tra i non eletti invece Pietro D'AÃ¬, con la lista di Musumeci DiventerÃ  Bellissima: Ã¨ stato scagionato da ogni accusa per mafia, col Gip che ha rivelato solo una gestione della cosa pubblica in taluni casi "francamente illecita". Per lui solo 1708 voti. Restano fuori anche Ernesto Calogero (1699), condannato in primo grado a 4 anni per compravendita di diplomi

Complessivamente, il peso dei voti legati ai personaggi piÃ¹ chiacchierati, stando ai piÃ¹ noti, raggiunge nel centrodestra quota 89903, piÃ¹ di un decimo del totale dei voti di Musumeci (830mila).

Anche a sinistra ci sono parecchi chiacchierati, trasformisti e riciclati vari. Luca Sammartino e Michele Catanzaro, due enfant prodige della covata di Cuffaro nell'Udc, sono eletti col Pd rispettivamente con 32.492 e 6.409 voti. Eletto a Ragusa anche Emanuele Dipasquale, detto Nello (5972). Le cronache di qualche tempo ricordano di quando era un berlusconiano di ferro e urlava "il Pd fa schifo", "Ã¨ pieno di pagliacci". Ma questa Ã¨ un'altra storia. Ed ha a che fare col partito della Nazione di Renzi.
TITLE: Il peso degli impresentabili sulla vittoria di Nello Musumeci in Sicilia

En tant qu'entrepreneur, le travail Ã  domicile prÃ©sente certains avantages du point de vue fiscal, notamment celui de pouvoir dÃ©duire les dÃ©penses raisonnables effectuÃ©es pour gagner un revenu. Le fait de possÃ©der un bureau Ã  domicile ne permet pas automatiquement de considÃ©rer une personne comme travailleur autonome. En effet, une personne possÃ©dant un bureau dans son sous-sol, mais qui n'a qu'un seul client et qu'elle doit se dÃ©placer rÃ©guliÃ¨rement Ã  l'emplacement de son client pourrait Ãªtre considÃ©rÃ© comme un travailleur salariÃ© et non un travailleur autonome. Chaque situation Ã©tant unique, et en cas de doute, il est prÃ©fÃ©rence de demander Ã  l'Agence du revenu du Canada et Ã  Revenu QuÃ©bec si la personne peut se qualifier de travailleur autonome et si elle par consÃ©quent dÃ©duire ses dÃ©penses courantes.

Pour qu'un contribuable puisse dÃ©duire ses dÃ©penses, son bureau Ã  domicile doit Ãªtre son principal lieu d'affaires ou Ãªtre exclusivement utilisÃ© dans le but de tirer un revenu d'entreprise et rencontrer des clients ou des patients sur une base rÃ©guliÃ¨re et contenue dans le cadre de son entreprise (1).

Le contribuable doit cependant Ãªtre en mesure de justifier toutes les dÃ©penses qu'il dÃ©duit, il est donc important de tenir une comptabilitÃ© Ã  jour des revenus et des dÃ©penses puisque nulle n'est Ã  l'abri d'une vÃ©rification par le fisc. Les frais de dÃ©placement constituent les dÃ©penses les plus souvent vÃ©rifiÃ©es.

Le montant Ã  dÃ©duire est dÃ©terminÃ© en proportion de la superficie du bureau par rapport Ã  la superficie totale de la maison.

Avoir un bureau Ã  domicile permet Ã©galement de dÃ©duire entre autres le coÃ»t de l'assurance habitation de la rÃ©sidence, l'Ã©lectricitÃ©, le chauffage, l'impÃ´t foncier, le tÃ©lÃ©phone et les intÃ©rÃªts sur un prÃªt hypothÃ¨ques. Le montant Ã  dÃ©duire est dÃ©terminÃ© en proportion de la superficie du bureau par rapport Ã  la superficie totale de la maison.

MalgrÃ© le fait qu'il soit possible de dÃ©duire plusieurs dÃ©penses, il n'est pas toujours possible de dÃ©duire toutes les dÃ©penses. En effet, il n'est pas possible de crÃ©er une perte de revenu d'entreprise avec les dÃ©penses (2). ConsÃ©quemment, les dÃ©penses engagÃ©es pourront Ãªtre dÃ©duites qu'Ã  concurrence du revenu du contribuable. Les dÃ©penses qui ne pourront pas Ãªtre dÃ©duites Ã  une annÃ©e d'imposition ne sont toutefois pas complÃ¨tement perdues, elles pourront Ãªtre dÃ©duites Ã  une annÃ©e ultÃ©rieure (3).

En plus des frais de dÃ©placement et des faires reliÃ©s Ã  l'immeuble dans lequel se trouve le bureau, il est possible pour le contribuable de dÃ©duire les frais de location d'une voiture ou les intÃ©rÃªts payÃ©s sur un prÃªt pour acquÃ©rir une voiture (4).

Ã‰tant donnÃ© qu'un travailleur autonome peut Ãªtre appelÃ© Ã  faire des achats et des ventes dans le cadre de l'exploitation de son travail, il pourrait devoir s'inscrire Ã  la TPS et Ã  la TVQ. Cette inscription doit Ãªtre faite uniquement si le montant total des ventes taxables puisque si ce total est infÃ©rieur Ã  30 000$, le travailleur autonome n'a pas Ã  percevoir la TPS et la TVQ.

Finalement, un travailleur autonome pourrait Ã©galement avoir comme obligation de payer des acomptes provisionnels compte tenu du fait qu'aucun impÃ´t n'est prÃ©levÃ© sur ses revenus d'entreprise. Le versement des acomptes est obligatoire dÃ¨s que l'impÃ´t Ã  payer sur le revenu est supÃ©rieur Ã  1 800$ au fÃ©dÃ©ral et au provincial. Les acomptes viennent compenser le fait qu'aucune dÃ©duction d'impÃ´t n'est faite sur les revenus d'entreprise, ils constituent donc des paiements partiels de l'impÃ´t que devra payer le travailleur autonome. Ces acomptes sont payables le 15 des mois de mars, juin, septembre et dÃ©cembre. Dans l'Ã©ventualitÃ© oÃ¹ le montant total des acomptes versÃ©s est supÃ©rieur au montant d'impÃ´t que le travailleur aurait dÃ» payer, ce dernier recevra un remboursement correspondant Ã  l'excÃ©dent et si les acomptes ne sont pas suffisants, le travailleur devra payer la diffÃ©rence.

Pour en savoir davantage sur les dÃ©penses admissibles, nous avons rÃ©digÃ© un article sur le sujet disponible en cliquant ici ainsi qu'un guide complet pour rÃ©duire vos impÃ´ts. Eine kleine Sammlung der lustigen, sarkastischsten, besten oder anrÃ¼hrendesten Antworten von Muslimen auf die tÃ¤glichen Zumutungen:1.
Nur sind viele Muslime genervt - denn so einfach ist die ganze Sache eben auch nicht.
Und das ist erst der Anfang der AufzÃ¤hlung.
Der britischen BBC sagte sie, sie hatte das nicht wirklich vorgehabt, aber sie habe ihn testen wollen.
Die Antwort, die Lamyaa auf Twitter postete, war eindeutig:"Mein Schatz, das ist nicht meine Entscheidung.
TEXT:
Muslime mÃ¼ssen sich dieser Tage viele blÃ¶de SprÃ¼che anhÃ¶ren, blÃ¶de Fragen beantworten

Es ist die Kehrseite einer gesellschaftlich notwendigen Diskussion darÃ¼ber, wie Christen und Muslime zusammenleben wollen

Einige Muslime haben darauf ziemlich coole Antworten gefunden

Muslim zu sein, das kann gerade keinen SpaÃŸ machen. Neben ein bisschen sachlicher Auseinandersetzung gibt's vor allem Vorurteile und GepÃ¶bel. Im Netz, auf der StraÃŸe, Ã¼berall.

Wie schÃ¶n, dass sich viele Muslime ihren Humor bewahrt haben. Eine kleine Sammlung der lustigen, sarkastischsten, besten oder anrÃ¼hrendesten Antworten von Muslimen auf die tÃ¤glichen Zumutungen:

1. Bad Hair Day

Klar, mit einem Kopftuch lÃ¤sst sich ein Bad-Hair-Day schon mal eher rumbringen als ohne. Aber eine DauerlÃ¶sung ist das nicht.

Der US-Biologiestudentin Heraa Hasmi wurde das Gefrotzel jedenfalls zu blÃ¶d. Als eine junge Frau twitterte: "KopftuchtrÃ¤gerinnen haben es gut, sie mÃ¼ssen sich nicht Haare waschen", schrieb sie:

"Menschen haben es so gut, sie mÃ¼ssen nicht duschen, seit sie Kleidung tragen."

Humans are so lucky they don't have to shower since they wear clothes :((( https://t.co/AT6YpL3Gwp â€” Heraa Hashmi (@caveheraa) 7. November 2017

2. Sorry, keine Zeit fÃ¼r Dschihad

Kurz nach Weihnachten 2015 soll der Chef der IS-Terrormiliz Abu Bakr al-Baghdadi alle Muslime dazu aufgerufen haben, sich dem Kampf anzuschlieÃŸen. Der Autor und Menschenrechtsaktivist Iyad El-Baghdadi â€“ er schreibt vorsichtshalber in seinem Twitter-Profil, dass er also nicht der Baghadadi sei â€“ hat die Info verbreitet. Seine Follower wussten die offenbar ironisch gemeinte Vorlage zu schÃ¤tzen.

Und antworteten, warum sie, leider, leider, auf keinen Fall kÃ¤mpfen kÃ¶nnten: "Ich muss meinen Goldfisch noch zum Tierarzt bringen."

I have to take my goldfish to the vet. https://t.co/MdkSGmEvbD â€” Hayat Libya (@LIBYA_WIN) 26. Dezember 2015

3. Danke, Mr. Trump

Am 13. Oktober twitterte US-PrÃ¤sident Donald Trump einen Auszug aus einer Rede. "In Amerika beten wir nicht die Regierung an, sondern Gott." Es sollte ein Anbiederungsversuch an konservative Christen sein, vor denen er sprach. Er mag diesen Satz sehr, denn im Sommer hatte er ihn schon einmal unters ergeben lauschende Volk gebracht. Denn die mag er, ganz im Gegensatz zu Muslimen.

Und da hatte sich Hend Amry, einen bekannte muslimische Bloggerin, vernehmen lassen: "Can I get an Allahu Akbar".

CAN I GET AN ALLAHU AKBAR https://t.co/mSM0VTb3YY â€” Hend Amry (@LibyaLiberty) 26. Juli 2017

HeiÃŸt so viel wie: Danke, Mr. Trump. Sie haben soeben gesagt, dass wir unseren Gott, Allah, anbeten dÃ¼rfen.

Der Tweet hat inzwischen mehr als 102.000 Likes und wurde 38.000 Mal geteilt.

4. Die arme, unterdrÃ¼ckte Muslima

Muslimische Frauen sind brav, folgsam und rÃ¤umen den ganzen Tag MÃ¤nnern und der Kinderschar hinterher. Soweit das Klischee.

Als eine Twitter-Nutzerin fragte, vor was denn die Follower am meisten Angst in der Ehe hÃ¤tten, schrieb die Kopftuch tragende GÃ¼l trocken: "MÃ¼de nach Hause zu kommen und zu sehen, dass mein Mann das Abendessen noch nicht gekocht hat."

To come home all tired and see my husband hasnâ€™t cooked dinner yet https://t.co/ofGeaAwWxH â€” ğ‘”ğ“Šğ“ (@roseification) 25. September 2017

5. Homosexuell? Na klar!

HomosexualitÃ¤t ist im Islam eine schwere SÃ¼nde. In vielen LÃ¤ndern wie Pakistan werden Homosexuelle brutal verfolgt.

Aznahn Munas ist laut Medienberichten selbst Muslim, stammt aus Pakistan und hat in Australien eine Firma mitgegrÃ¼ndet, die TÃ¼cher fÃ¼r Frauen verkauft: HalstÃ¼cher, KopftÃ¼cher.

Seit ein paar Tagen hat die Firma ein neues Produkt im Angebot. Es ist nur gerade ausverkauft, weil die Nachfrage so groÃŸ ist: ein Kopftuch in Regenbogenfarben. Den Farben der Homosexuellen.

6. Der falsche Yoga-Guru

Hamzah ist Muslim aus Texas. Und wenn Muslime beten, knien sie mal hin, mal beugen sie den OberkÃ¶rper. Auf Twitter schrieb Hamzah, wohin das fÃ¼hrte:

"Ich war in der Turnhalle und betete im Yoga-Raum. Drei Frauen folgten meinen Bewegungen. So habe ich versehentlich eine Yoga-Klasse geleitet."

I was at the gym praying in the yoga room and 3 ladies started following my motions.That's my story on how I accidentally led a yoga class. â€” Hamzah (@Hamzah_AlS) 14. August 2013

7. Message an den IS

Nach jedem Terroranschlag fordert jemand, Muslime mÃ¼ssten mehr gegen den Terror tun. Eine Forderung, Ã¼ber die man sicher diskutieren muss.

Nur sind viele Muslime genervt - denn so einfach ist die ganze Sache eben auch nicht.

"Lass mich schnell mal eben dem IS 'ne Whatsapp schicken und den Typen sagen, sie sollen mal chillen."

Lemme just whatsapp ISIS and tell them to chill out Piers, one sec https://t.co/qc6DGE3MyE â€” Ù¡Ù¡ (@babyygrill) 23. Mai 2017

8. Christen ohne Fehl und Tadel

Der bekannte US-Anwalt und Aktivist Qasim Rashid war sauer. "Ein weiÃŸer Ãœbermensch hat mir geschrieben, der Islam sei gewalttÃ¤tig und hÃ¶hnte, ich solle ihm eine christliche Version des IS zeigen."

Die Antwort Rashids:

"400 Jahre transatlantischer Sklavenhandel, im Zuge dessen 20 Millionen afrikanische 'Heiden' verkrÃ¼ppelt, ermordet, verschleppt und versklavt wurden, um sie auf den Weg Christi zu bringen.

Der VÃ¶lkermord an den amerikanischen Ureinwohnern im Namen Christi.

Der Genozid an den australischen Ureinwohnern, bei dem 90 Prozent von ihnen in weniger als einem Jahrhundert umgebracht wurden, wiederum von christlichen EuropÃ¤ern."

Und das ist erst der Anfang der AufzÃ¤hlung.

A white supremacist DM'd me claiming Islam is violent & taunted me to show "where's the Christian version of Isis?"



This was my response. pic.twitter.com/YgvbrTjzCi â€” Qasim Rashid, Esq. (@MuslimIQ) 3. April 2017

9. Es ist allein deine Sache, mein Kind

Die 17-jÃ¤hrige Lamyaa aus dem US-Bundesstaat Pennsylvania verÃ¶ffentlichte im FrÃ¼hjahr 2017 eine Konversation mit ihrem Vater in Saudi-Arabien.

Sie fragt ihn, ganz vorsichtig, was er davon halte, dass sie vielleicht ihr Kopftuch ablegen wolle. Der britischen BBC sagte sie, sie hatte das nicht wirklich vorgehabt, aber sie habe ihn testen wollen.

Die Antwort, die Lamyaa auf Twitter postete, war eindeutig:

"Mein Schatz, das ist nicht meine Entscheidung. Kein Mann hat das Recht, so eine Entscheidung zu treffen. Wenn du das tun mÃ¶chtest, dann tu es. Ich bin fÃ¼r dich da, egal wie du dich entscheidest."

SUMMARY:
Myanmar State Counselor Aung San Suu Kyi smiles as she walks from a military helicopter after arriving at Sittwe airport on November 2, 2017, following a visit to Maungdaw in Myanmar's Rakhine State.
Suu Kyi, a Nobel Peace Prize winner, has faced heavy international criticism for not taking a higher profile in responding to what U.N. officials have called "ethnic cleansing" by the army.
Suu Kyi met a group of Muslim religious leaders, said Chris Lewa, of the Arakan Project monitoring group, citing Rohingya sources.
Myanmar?s Immigration Minister has expressed support for a controversial two-child limit on a Muslim minority group that opposition leader Aung San Suu Kyi and the United Nations call discriminatory and a violation of human rights.
More than 4,000 crossed at different points on the river on Wednesday, Major Mohammed Iqbal, a Bangladesh security official in the southern district of Cox's Bazar, told Reuters.
TEXT:
Myanmar State Counselor Aung San Suu Kyi smiles as she walks from a military helicopter after arriving at Sittwe airport on November 2, 2017, following a visit to Maungdaw in Myanmar's Rakhine State.

ADVERTISEMENT

SITTWE, Myanmar - Myanmar's de facto leader, Aung San Suu Kyi, on Thursday urged people "not to quarrel" as she visited Rakhine State for the first time since a military crackdown that drove more than 600,000 Rohingya Muslims to flee the country.

Suu Kyi, a Nobel Peace Prize winner, has faced heavy international criticism for not taking a higher profile in responding to what U.N. officials have called "ethnic cleansing" by the army.

Myanmar has rejected the accusations of ethnic cleansing, saying its security forces launched a counter-insurgency operation after Rohingya militants attacked 30 security posts in northern Rakhine on Aug. 25.

On Thursday, amid heightened security, Suu Kyi boarded a military helicopter at Sittwe, the capital of Rakhine State, to be taken to Maungdaw, one of the districts worst hit by the violence.

Suu Kyi met a group of Muslim religious leaders, said Chris Lewa, of the Arakan Project monitoring group, citing Rohingya sources.

"She only said three things to the people - they should live peacefully, the government is there to help them, and they should not quarrel among each other."

"She only said three things to the people - they should live peacefully, the government is there to help them, and they should not quarrel among each other," Lewa said, quoting information from a religious leader who was present.

Rohingya began fleeing predominantly Buddhist Myanmar for neighbouring Bangladesh in late August to escape violence in the wake of a military counter-insurgency operation launched after Rohingya militants attacked security posts in Rakhine State.

Muslim children are seen at a refugee camp outside of Sittwe May 16, 2013. Myanmar?s Immigration Minister has expressed support for a controversial two-child limit on a Muslim minority group that opposition leader Aung San Suu Kyi and the United Nations call discriminatory and a violation of human rights. Picture taken May 16, 2013. To match Interview MYANMAR ROHINGYA/ REUTERS/Soe Zeya Tun (MYANMAR - Tags: SOCIETY POLITICS)

A U.S. State Department delegation will be in Bangladesh on Friday and Saturday to discuss the humanitarian crisis and human rights concerns stemming from the crisis in Rakhine state.

The delegation will be led by Simon Henshaw, acting assistant secretary of state for the Bureau of Population, Refugees, and Migration, the department said in a statement.

On Wednesday, Reuters photographers saw thousands of desperate Rohingya wade through shallows and narrow creeks between islands of the Naf river to reach neighbouring Bangladesh as the exodus begun two months ago was far from over.

Some had small boats or pulled makeshift rafts to get to Bangladesh on the river's western bank, but most walked, children cradled in their arms and the elderly carried on their backs, with sacks of belongings tied to staves on their shoulders.

Reaching the far side, some women and older people had to be pulled through the mud to reach dry land atop steep banks.

More than 4,000 crossed at different points on the river on Wednesday, Major Mohammed Iqbal, a Bangladesh security official in the southern district of Cox's Bazar, told Reuters.
TITLE: Aung San Suu Kyi Visits Rahkine For First Time Since Exodus Of 60,000 Rohingya Muslims

TEXT:
Erneut schlagen EnthÃ¼llungen von vertraulichen Dokumenten aus Steueroasen hohe Wellen

Das Thema wurde auch im ARD-Talk "Hart aber fair" thematisiert

Dort warf CDU-Politiker Meister den Medien mangelnden Kooperationswillen vor - das konnte der GrÃ¼nen-Europaabgeordnete Giegold nicht auf sich sitzen lassen

MÃ¼ssen Promis und Politiker nun weltweit erneut zittern? Nach den Offshore Leaks (2013), Lux Leaks (2014), Swiss Leaks (2015) und vor allem den Panama Papers (2016) gibt es eine neue VerÃ¶ffentlichung zu Steueroasen und dem Vermeiden von Steuerzahlungen durch Reiche. Das Material der Paradise Papers soll sich aus 21 Quellen speisen und rund 13,4 Millionen Dokumente umfassen.

Die EnthÃ¼llungen, in Deutschland vorangetrieben von einem Rechercheverbund aus NDR, WDR und "SÃ¼ddeutscher Zeitung" ("SZ"), standen nun am Montagabend zur Diskussion in der ARD-Talkshow "Hart aber fair".

Der reiÃŸerische Titel: "Steueroase Europa â€“ wie uns Konzerne und Super-Reiche abzocken!" Fast zwanzig Minuten lang waren sich die eingeladenen Politiker fast einig. Der CDU-Politiker und Parlamentarische StaatssekretÃ¤r beim Bundesfinanzminister, Michael Meister, GrÃ¼nen-Europapolitiker Sven Giegold sowie Journalist Georg Mascolo meinten: Schuld sind die Steueroasen.

Doch dann attackierte Meister plÃ¶tzlich den Ãœberbringer der - zumindest fÃ¼r viele SteuerflÃ¼chtlinge - schlechten Nachrichten. Giegold konnte den Angriff auf die Medien nicht unkommentiert lassen - und keilte zurÃ¼ck.

CDU-Politiker Meister attackiert die Medien

Am Anfang von Frank Plasbergs Sendung musste vor allem der luxemburgische AuÃŸenminister Jean Asselborn einstecken. Der wurde dann auch schnell sauer, dass Luxemburg immer als Steueroase verspottet werde. Er betonte: "Wir haben keine Briefkastenfirmen mehr!"

Doch Mascolo, Leiter des Investigativ-Rechercheteams von NDR, WDR und "SZ" kannte noch weitere Beispiele - deren Daten wohl FinanzstaatssekretÃ¤r Meister gerne hÃ¤tte.

"WÃ¼rden Sie mit den Regierungen kooperieren, wenn Herr Meister fragen wÃ¼rden, die Sachen rÃ¼berzuschieben, um darauf gesetzgeberisch zu reagieren?", fragt Plasberg den Journalisten.

Der zeigt sich hart: Er wÃ¼rde eine Zusammenarbeit ablehnen. "Die Diskussionen hatten wir schon bei den Panama Papers." Mascolos BegrÃ¼ndung: "Aus GrÃ¼nden des Informantenschutz werden die Unterlagen staatlichen BehÃ¶rden nicht zur VerfÃ¼gung gestellt."

CDU-Politiker Meister wollte das nicht akzeptieren - und prescht nach vorne. Aus seiner Sicht gehe es um zwei Dinge: Einerseits um Straftaten wie GeldwÃ¤sche oder Steuerhinterziehung, die hinter den Konstruktionen stecken wÃ¼rden. Und andererseits um Modelle, die man als Gesetzgeber noch gar nicht kenne.

"Da ist es sinnvoll zu wissen, was passiert eigentlich", erklÃ¤rte Meister. "Ich wÃ¤re dankbar und es wÃ¤re auch hilfreich gewesen", wenn die Unterlagen sowohl der Panama Papers als auch der aktuellen Paradise Papers den Staatsanwaltschaften und FinanzbehÃ¶rden zugÃ¤nglich gemacht worden wÃ¤ren - "und nicht nur darÃ¼ber berichtet worden wÃ¤re", stellte der FinanzstaatssekretÃ¤r klar.

UnfÃ¤higkeit der Politik, Probleme zu beheben

Die Medienschelte wollte GrÃ¼nen-Finanzexperte Giegold nicht unkommentiert lassen. "Die ganze Diskussion ist schon ein wenig absurd", keilte er gegen Meister.

Die Politik mÃ¼sste eigentlich dankbar sein. Denn Ã¼ber 30 Jahre habe es diese nicht geschafft, diese SteuerschlupflÃ¶cher zu schlieÃŸen. "Das jetzt die Journalisten den Druck entfalten, der uns zu dieser Debatte befÃ¤higt", sei Giegold zufolge deshalb nur folgerichtig.

Er verstehe die Haltung der Journalisten vollkommen, ihre Ethik des Quellenschutzes nicht aufzugeben. Giegold unterstrich: "Ich bin den Journalisten dankbar!"

Allerdings mÃ¼sse vielmehr "die UnfÃ¤higkeit der Politik" kritisiert werden, das Problem innerhalb Europas nicht behoben zu haben, "dass alle ihre Steuern gerecht bezahlen".

Zumindest das Publikum hatte der GrÃ¼ne da auf seiner Seite.

TEXT:
Dustin Hoffman has been accused of sexually harassing a 17-year-old intern on the set of his 1985 TV adaptation â€œDeath of a Salesman.â€

Writer Anna Graham Hunter recounted the five weeks she spent working with Hoffman as a production assistant in detail for The Hollywood Reporter, painting the Oscar-winner as both a charming and disturbing figure.

â€œHe asked me to give him a foot massage my first day on set; I did. He was openly flirtatious, he grabbed my ass, he talked about sex to me and in front of me,â€ Hunter recounted. â€œOne morning I went to his dressing room to take his breakfast order; he looked at me and grinned, taking his time. Then he said, â€œIâ€™ll have a hard-boiled egg â€¦ and a soft-boiled clitoris.â€

â€œI loved the attention from Dustin Hoffman. Until I didnâ€™t,â€ she added.

Bettmann via Getty Images John Malkovich and Dustin Hoffman in the 1985 television movie "Death of a Salesman."

Hunter regularly corresponded with her sister, sending detailed messages about Hoffman repeatedly groping her and making sexually inappropriate comments, which the outlet has printed in full.

â€œToday, when I was walking Dustin to his limo, he felt my ass four times. I hit him each time, hard, and told him he was a dirty old man,â€ she wrote to her sister. â€œHe took off his hat and pointed to his head (shaved for the part) and said, â€œNo, Iâ€™m a dirty young man, I have a full head of hair.â€

At the time, Hoffman was at the peak of his career, coming off critically acclaimed films like â€œTootsieâ€ and â€œKramer vs. Kramer,â€ a film that has also been embroiled in controversy due to Hoffmanâ€™s behavior behind the scenes.

She claims that actorâ€™s misconduct was widely known and condoned on the set of â€œDeath of a Salesman,â€ despite her efforts to alert superiors who told her to â€œsacrifice some of our valuesâ€ to keep the production running smoothly.

Hoffman issued a response apologizing in broad terms for any harm he caused.

â€œI have the utmost respect for women and feel terrible that anything I might have done could have put her in an uncomfortable situation,â€ he told The Hollywood Reporter. â€œI am sorry. It is not reflective of who I am.â€
TITLE: Dustin Hoffman Accused Of Sexually Harassing 17-Year-Old Intern

SUMMARY:
1 singles on various Billboard charts and become an icon in the music industry.
â€œI just constantly felt pushed into a box.â€Atlantic Records Kelly Clarkson says it has taken 15 years to be â€œallowedâ€ to release new album Meaning of Life.
Though conceding she, too, feels the burden of celebrity, the country music legend told Clarkson: â€œYouâ€™re just a different type of personality.
When he sought to resume his career in country music, though, the stigma of being a gay artist was off-putting to many.
â€œItâ€™s changing now,â€ Clarkson said, but at the time being out was not acceptable in country music.
TEXT:
Kelly Clarkson has scored a trio of Grammys, more than 100 cumulative No. 1 singles on various Billboard charts and become an icon in the music industry. Yet from the beginning, the first-ever American Idol says, record labels and executives have tried to define who she is as both a person and musician.

â€œHonestly, you can look at my previous records and you can hear a suppressed individual,â€ Clarkson told Party Foul Radio with Pollo & Pearl. â€œI just constantly felt pushed into a box.â€

Atlantic Records Kelly Clarkson says it has taken 15 years to be â€œallowedâ€ to release new album Meaning of Life.

Throughout her career, Clarksonâ€™s struggle for creative liberation has been tabloid fodder. She dropped Idolâ€™s 19 Management team, then went toe-to-toe with former industry giant Clive Davis to gain greater freedom in her sound. Sometimes there were victories, she said; other times, she had to â€œcompromise.â€

A deciding factor in her need to â€œbendâ€ to corporate pressure was the band and team supporting her. Had she pushed back too much, she told listeners of Podomaticâ€™s No. 1 LGBTQ podcast, the label would â€œsit onâ€ her music and prevent touring, presenting a financial burden for those with whom she has worked with for nearly a decade.

â€œYou carry this weight on you to keep everyone afloat,â€ Clarkson confessed. â€œI feel everything. Itâ€™s annoying.â€

The superstar recalled a conversation years ago with her equally famous mother-in-law Reba McIntyre. Though conceding she, too, feels the burden of celebrity, the country music legend told Clarkson: â€œYouâ€™re just a different type of personality. You take on everything.â€

Fortunately, it appears Clarksonâ€™s â€œdevastatingâ€ battle for artistic authenticity is behind her. Now signed to Atlantic Records, she dropped eighth album Meaning of Life Oct. 27. Not only does she feel itâ€™s her best work to date, itâ€™s also proven to be a relief.

â€œWhen you are that type of person â€“ an emotional person, in a good way â€“ itâ€™s really wonderful to be part of a project thatâ€™s 100-percent you, 100-percent your personality and no one is holding you back,â€ Clarkson said.

â€œTheyâ€™re supporting you being you,â€ she said of her experience with Atlantic. â€œFifteen years later, this is my first time experiencing that!â€

Atlanticâ€™s belief in both Clarkson â€“ whose eleven Top 10 hits, three No. 1 singles and trio of chart-topping albums make her one of the industryâ€™s most bankable stars â€“ and the album are obvious. Of 14 tracks on Meaning of Life, Clarkson co-wrote four. The rest bear the sonic stamp of a veritable music industry whoâ€™s who.

WATCH: Pollo Del Marâ€™s Track-By-Track Review of Meaning of Life

Lead single â€œLove So Softâ€ alone combines powerhouses Mozella (Miley Cyrusâ€™ â€œWrecking Ballâ€), Priscilla Renea (co-writer of Fifth Harmonyâ€™s â€œWorth Itâ€) and Jesse Shatkin (Siaâ€™s â€œAliveâ€). Elsewhere are the fingerprints of hip-hop producers The Monarchs (Nicki Minaj, Justin Bieber), Grammy nominee Mick Schultz (Jeremihâ€™s â€œBirthday Sexâ€) and Greg Kurstin, the Grammy-winning genius behind Adeleâ€™s â€œHello.â€

Saying she previously has â€œnever worked with people who would allowâ€ an album like Meaning of Life, the Texan indicated the reasons stemmed largely from industry decisions on what kind of artist she should be. However, in the interview â€• recorded Oct. 11, National Coming Out Day â€“ Clarkson related the story of Nashville-based songwriter Shane McAnally, whose sexual identity altered his path to stardom.

â€œHeâ€™s a phenomenal writer; heâ€™s had like a bajillion No. 1s now,â€ Clarkson pointed out. â€œBack in the day, when he was someoneâ€™s assistant somewhere, shuffling coffee around, he got, â€˜You canâ€™t make it as a country singer if they know youâ€™re gay.â€™â€

In 1999, McAnally signed to Curb Records. After marginal success as a solo artist, he relocated to Los Angeles, where he came out. When he sought to resume his career in country music, though, the stigma of being a gay artist was off-putting to many. â€œItâ€™s changing now,â€ Clarkson said, but at the time being out was not acceptable in country music.

â€œHe had to go a different way, and in the end, itâ€™s worked out for him,â€ said Clarkson of McAnally, who channeled his considerable talents into writing hits for other.

Now Shane McAnally is a multiple-time Grammy and Academy of Country Music Award-winner who has written No. 1 country singles for everyone from Kenny Chesney and Keith Urban to Miranda Lambert and former Hootie & The Blowfish frontman Darius Rucker.

He was named the 2014 ACM Songwriter of the Year and won two Grammys for work on Kacey Musgravesâ€™ breakthrough Same Trailer Different Park. He appears on-track for another blockbuster year as Sam Huntâ€™s â€œBody Like a Back Road,â€ written by McAnally, crossed into the Top 10 at pop radio and is the biggest country single of 2017. He is presently at work on a Broadway musical based on the TV classic â€œHee Haw.â€

â€œItâ€™s insane all the stuff heâ€™s accomplishing,â€ Clarkson gushed about the man who contributed two songs to her chart-topping 2015 album Piece By Piece.

â€œBut whatâ€™s sad about that for me â€“ as a friend whoâ€™s watching â€“ is he could have sang all that shit himself,â€ she lamented. â€œHeâ€™s an amazing singer, an amazing performer, but nobody could get past [his being gay].â€
TITLE: Kelly Clarkson Felt 'Suppressed,' Says Top Country Star's Career Changed When He Came Out

SUMMARY:
National treasures Kate Winslet and Allison Janney shared a kiss onstage at the Hollywood Film Awards on Sunday night, and weâ€™re honestly all the better for it.
â€œAllison, I know I donâ€™t really know you, I just want to be you,â€ she continued.
Maybe?â€As the audience laughed, Janney took her cue and made her way to the stage to take the actress up on her offer.
â€œAh, itâ€™s gonna happen!â€ Winslet said.
â€œThis is an exciting moment, isnâ€™t it!â€Thatâ€™s when the two shared a quick kiss and hug on stage, fangirling over each other for a brief moment before Winslet got back to the task at hand.
TEXT:
Someone cast these two in a road trip movie immediately.

National treasures Kate Winslet and Allison Janney shared a kiss onstage at the Hollywood Film Awards on Sunday night, and weâ€™re honestly all the better for it.

Winslet got the ball rolling when she accepted the Hollywood Actress Award for her performance in â€œWonder Wheel.â€ During her speech, she naturally expressed her undying love for Janney, who was also honored that evening for her work in the upcoming biopic â€œI, Tonya.â€

Kevin Winter via Getty Images

â€œAllison Janney is in this room,â€ a very sincere Winslet told the audience.

â€œAllison, I know I donâ€™t really know you, I just want to be you,â€ she continued. â€œI want to stroke you, or something. I mean, we could always kiss, maybe? Maybe?â€

As the audience laughed, Janney took her cue and made her way to the stage to take the actress up on her offer.

â€œAh, itâ€™s gonna happen!â€ Winslet said. â€œThis is an exciting moment, isnâ€™t it!â€

Thatâ€™s when the two shared a quick kiss and hug on stage, fangirling over each other for a brief moment before Winslet got back to the task at hand.

Watch the moment in all its glory below.
TITLE: Today's Joy Is Brought To You By Kate Winslet Kissing Allison Janney

The Oscar-winning actor played A-list cupid in the engagement of Ryan McFarling and Nikki Young at the Texas Book Festival in Austin, Texas, on Saturday.

Then Hanks ushered them onto the stage where McFarling presented the ring â€• and received a â€œyesâ€ from Young.

TEXT:
Actor Tom Hanks has been in enough romantic comedies to know how to help during a real-life wedding proposal.

The Oscar-winning actor played A-list cupid in the engagement of Ryan McFarling and Nikki Young at the Texas Book Festival in Austin, Texas, on Saturday.

Hanks was promoting his new book Uncommon Type: Some Stories during a Q&A event when he declared he was bored with the questions and wanted to ask one himself, KVUE of Austin reported.

â€œHereâ€™s Ryanâ€™s question, and it is for Nikki Young,â€ Hanks said in the clip below. â€œNikki, will you marry me?â€

McFarling took a knee in front of a pleasantly shocked Young, who was sitting in the front row. Then Hanks ushered them onto the stage where McFarling presented the ring â€• and received a â€œyesâ€ from Young.

â€œI couldnâ€™t breathe, I almost fainted,â€ the bride-to-be said in a Facebook video posted by KVUEâ€™s Molly Oak.

Young went on to call it the â€œmost epic proposal everâ€ and said she was a â€œsuper fangirlâ€ of Hanks.
TITLE: Tom Hanks Is An A-List Cupid Helping A Guy Propose At Book Fest

WASHINGTONâ€”The Air Force has launched a review of how the Service handled the criminal records of former Airman Devin P. Kelley following his 2012 domestic violence conviction.
Kelley was convicted by a general court-martial on two charges of domestic assault against his wife and step-son under Article 128 of the Uniform Code of Military Justice.
He then served 12-months in confinement at Naval Consolidated Brig Miramar in California before being released with a Bad Conduct Discharge in 2014.
Initial information indicates that Kelleyâ€™s domestic violence offense was not entered into the National Criminal Information Center database by the Holloman Air Force Base Office of Special Investigations.
Air Force Secretary Heather Wilson and Air Force Chief of Staff Gen. DavidGoldfein directed the Air Force Inspector General in collaboration with theDefense Department Inspector General to conduct a complete review of theKelley case and relevant policies and procedures.
TEXT:
WASHINGTONâ€”The Air Force has launched a review of how the Service handled the criminal records of former Airman Devin P. Kelley following his 2012 domestic violence conviction.

Kelley was convicted by a general court-martial on two charges of domestic assault against his wife and step-son under Article 128 of the Uniform Code of Military Justice. He then served 12-months in confinement at Naval Consolidated Brig Miramar in California before being released with a Bad Conduct Discharge in 2014. He was also reduced in grade to E-1. Federal law prohibited him from buying or possessing firearms after this conviction.

Initial information indicates that Kelleyâ€™s domestic violence offense was not entered into the National Criminal Information Center database by the Holloman Air Force Base Office of Special Investigations.

Air Force Secretary Heather Wilson and Air Force Chief of Staff Gen. David

Goldfein directed the Air Force Inspector General in collaboration with the

Defense Department Inspector General to conduct a complete review of the

Kelley case and relevant policies and procedures.
TITLE: Air Force Failed To Enter Church Shooter's Domestic Violence Record In U.S. Database

SUMMARY:
A former Welsh government minister, who was suspended by Labour over his â€˜personal conductâ€™, has been found dead, his family have announced.
Carl Sargeant quit his post as Cabinet Secretary for Communities and Children in Cardiff last week after what he called â€œshocking and distressingâ€ allegations were made against him.
His body was found at his home in Connahâ€™s Quay, north Wales, at 11.30am on Tuesday.
His family said in a statement on Tuesday: â€œCarl was a much loved husband, father and friend.
We are devastated beyond words, and we know our grief will be shared by all those who knew and loved him.â€
TEXT:
A former Welsh government minister, who was suspended by Labour over his â€˜personal conductâ€™, has been found dead, his family have announced.

Carl Sargeant quit his post as Cabinet Secretary for Communities and Children in Cardiff last week after what he called â€œshocking and distressingâ€ allegations were made against him.

His body was found at his home in Connahâ€™s Quay, north Wales, at 11.30am on Tuesday. North Wales Police said they were â€œnot treating his death as suspiciousâ€. It is understood that Sargeant took his own life.

All Welsh Assembly business was suspended as a mark of respect.

Labour leader Jeremy Corbyn said his death was â€œterrible and deeply shocking newsâ€ and Welsh First Minister Carwyn Jones said his passing would be â€œa great lossâ€ to the party and the country.

Sargeant was suspended from the party last week and had the whip withdrawn in the National Assembly for Wales while an investigation took place into the allegations against him.

Labourâ€™s national party HQ suspended him on Friday following unspecified allegations against him.

His family said in a statement on Tuesday: â€œCarl was a much loved husband, father and friend. He wasnâ€™t simply a part of our family. He was the glue that bound us together. He was the heart of our family. We loved him so very much.

â€œHe was the most kind and caring husband, father, son and friend. We are devastated beyond words, and we know our grief will be shared by all those who knew and loved him.â€
TITLE: Former Welsh Government Minister Carl Sargeant, Who Faced Claims About 'Personal Conduct', Found Dead

Der Physiker Stephen Hawking warnt die Menschheit vor den Gefahren neuer Technologien

Er denkt, dass kÃ¼nstliche Intelligenz zu unserem Ende fÃ¼hren kÃ¶nnte

Welche Gefahren laut Hawking konkret von kÃ¼nstlicher Intelligenz ausgehen kÃ¶nnen, erfahrt ihr im Video oben

Es ist ein Thema, das die Menschheit seit Jahren beschÃ¤ftigt: In den letzten Jahren behandelten Hollywood-Filme wie Steven Spielbergs â€œA.I.- KÃ¼nstliche Intelligenzâ€ oder â€œI, Robotâ€ mit Will Smith immer wieder die mÃ¶glichen Gefahren von kÃ¼nstlicher Intelligenz. Was bisher nur als Science Fiction galt, wird nun immer mehr zur RealitÃ¤t.

Erst in der vergangenen Woche wurde in Saudi Arabien weltweit zum ersten Mal einem Roboter, der Androidin Sophia, die StaatsangehÃ¶rigkeit zugesprochen. Das berichtete unter anderem das Online-Magazin "Live Science".

Auf einer Technologie-Konferenz in Lissabon wandte sich der berÃ¼hmte Physiker Stephen Hawking nun an die Menschheit, um vor dieser Entwicklung zu warnen.

Das berichtet der amerikanische Nachrichtensender CNBC. Er warnt, dass der Fortschritt kÃ¼nstlicher Intelligenz das Potential habe, die Menschheit zu zerstÃ¶ren.

"Diese neue Form des Lebens wird den Menschen Ã¼bertreffen"

In seiner Rede erklÃ¤rt er: â€œComputer kÃ¶nnen theoretisch menschliche Intelligenz nachahmen und diese auch Ã¼bertreffen. Wenn wir erfolgreich kÃ¼nstliche Intelligenz erzeugen kÃ¶nnen, wÃ¤re das das wichtigste Ereignis unserer Geschichte. Oder das schlimmste. Das wissen wir einfach noch nicht.â€

Hawking Ã¤uÃŸerte sich in letzter Zeit immer wieder zu den Entwicklungen in der Technologie. GegenÃ¼ber dem Magazin â€œWIREDâ€ sagte er erst kÃ¼rzlich: â€œIch befÃ¼rchte, dass kÃ¼nstliche Intelligenz die Menschheit gÃ¤nzlich ersetzen wird. Wenn Menschen Computerviren designen kÃ¶nnen, dann kÃ¶nnen sie auch kÃ¼nstliche Intelligenz kreieren, die sich selbststÃ¤ndig verbessern und replizieren kann. Diese neue Form des Lebens wird den Menschen Ã¼bertreffen.â€

"Wenn ihr nett zu mir seid, bin ich nett zu euch"

Mit seinen Ã„ngsten ist Hawking nicht alleine. WÃ¤hrend Facebook-GrÃ¼nder Mark Zuckerberg laut CNBC â€œoptimistisch den groÃŸartigen MÃ¶glichkeiten durch kÃ¼nstliche Intelligenz entgegensiehtâ€, Ã¤uÃŸerte sich BillionÃ¤r Elon Musk sehr kritisch gegenÃ¼ber den neuesten Entwicklungen. Er ist der Ansicht, dass der Mensch mit den Maschinen eins werden mÃ¼sse, um auf Dauer nicht irrelevant zu werden.

In einer Pressekonferenz antwortete die Androidin Sophia in Saudi Arabien auf die Gefahren ihrer â€œSpeziesâ€: â€œSie haben zu viel von Elon Musk gelesen und zu viele Hollywood-Filme angesehen. Wenn ihr nett zu mir seid, bin ich nett zu euch.â€

SUMMARY:
ADVERTISEMENTOn October 31, a 19-year-old college student, who was returning home from her coaching class, was gang raped in Bhopal.
A week on, the Madhya Pradesh government has responded to the public furore by ordering coaching centres to not hold classes after 8 pm.
Even though it is the state's obligation to ensure that public spaces are safe for women, the government has decreed that coaching centres that don't close by 8:00 pm will be responsible for safety of the female students.
"We have decided to direct all coaching centres to wind up their business not later than 8pm.
Joshi said that coaching centres will also be asked to develop an an app with an SOS and location-tracking system for students.
TEXT:
ADVERTISEMENT

On October 31, a 19-year-old college student, who was returning home from her coaching class, was gang raped in Bhopal. NDTV has previously reported that the college student was ambushed at around 7:00 pm and raped by four men near the Habibganj Railway station, one of the busiest parts of the city. The four men reportedly took tea and tobacco breaks while raping the student for three hours.

A week on, the Madhya Pradesh government has responded to the public furore by ordering coaching centres to not hold classes after 8 pm.

Even though it is the state's obligation to ensure that public spaces are safe for women, the government has decreed that coaching centres that don't close by 8:00 pm will be responsible for safety of the female students.

"We have decided to direct all coaching centres to wind up their business not later than 8pm. If they refuse to do so, they will be held responsible for their girl students' safety after 8pm," School Education Minister Deepak Joshi told the media on Monday.

Joshi said that coaching centres will also be asked to develop an an app with an SOS and location-tracking system for students.

Also on HuffPost India:
TITLE: MP Govt. Responds To Bhopal Gang Rape By Asking Coaching Centres To Close At 8:00 PM
